description:
LOVE this place! I brought a friend here to celebrate her engagement and we absolutely loved it. 

My friend really wanted to try some paella and also wanted ceviche so I thought we'd give this place a try. We ordered the arroz con mariscos which is basically Peruvian take on paella and it was VERY good!! I have had great paella in Spain which set the bar pretty high and this place was definitely up there in terms of quality and flavor.

We also ordered the ceviche (honestly I can't remember which one!) and it came with taro chips (!!!) instead of corn tortilla chips. The chips were so good we ended up ordering extra. 

Excellent service! Our server, Jorge, was very attentive and accomodating. When the paella came out, it had a cheese garnish on top and when I told him I couldn't eat dairy he took the plate back and brought us a new one without the garnish. Very much appreciated! 

They were very busy so I definitely recommend making a reservation. We were able to make a reservation the day before for Saturday evening so seems they have availability if you plan ahead.
author: Eva R.

description:
Best place to have chicken - Polli Papas is a must try! 
I tried El Pollo a la Brafa as well - really soft chicken breast and a meal for two!
Must visit!
author: Sakshi S.

description:
Ah, I have come to this location twice and we had pretty awful service the first time. It took nearly 30 minutes for someone to come take our drink order, which I found absurd. Then we ordered a bottle of wine thinking that'd be the faster way to get some drinks. After 15 minutes, we ended up fetching another server to see if he'd help.

After that, the service was fine. We sat downstairs, which was so loud that we felt like we were screaming over each other. The second time I came, the noise level was still the same, but the service was great.

Food is always pretty solid. I love the chicken, yuca fries, the paella. Empanadas are okay and I would get them again but they're not a must in my opinion. I personally didn't love the ceviche, but the rest of my party did.

Parking is tough here. I personally like the Valencia location more.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Finally I was able to try this place. 

Service was good and the place is ok, we were seated quickly since we arrived early, as usual in San Francisco parking is difficult to find. 

We ordered:
- Chicken (half).- this is the specialty and it was very good, Chicken was very soft and well seasoned. 
- Lomo Saltado.- So so, it was too salty, very little meat and tough. 
It was happy hour and we got:
- Calamari.- really good. 
- Empanadas trio.- I like the one with cheese and veggies, not so much the one with chicken. 

I enjoyed it and liked it but it is not the best Peruvian restaurant I have ever tried.
author: René C.

description:
I've been to Limon Rotisserie twice and both times have been for large birthday parties.  With both parties, we ate off of a prefix menu, which was fine since it was a selection of some of their popular dishes which included their empanadas, ceviche, lomo saltado, and their famous pollo a la brasa.  It was a lot of food to pass around and both times there was an overabundance of main dishes leftover.

I'll admit this, the first time I tried their chicken, I thought it was a little too salty.  However the second time around, it was much better with the salt and spices being more evenly distributed.  And all their other dishes were pretty good.  I'm always a sucker for lomo saltado because who doesn't like fries and steak mixed together and their ceviche was delicious.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed Limon.  Both times have been great hosting the large parties I dined with and I will more than likely return in the future to try more things off their menu.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Limón is my favorite Peruvian place in the Bay. But this is made even better by the fact that it's not super expensive - 8 of us had a meal and 1-3 drinks each for $50 each somehow (tip included). My favorite part about it is that if you're trying to eat low carb it is perfect. 

All we get there is the chicken and Ceviche (Mixto) both of which are amazing. The chicken is so simple yet tasty but I would get at least a whole chicken for 2 people. It's not as much as it looks on paper so you will want it. The green beans are really really good so maybe order more than one as is the salad. I don't mess with the starchy stuff but my dinner partners said they were all good. If you're like me, stick to the veggies and meats and you'll have a great time and leave feeling stuffed. What more can you ask for.

The drinks are also good and they have a full bar. On the wine menu I loved the Albariño, which was not at all sweet - quite dry, light, and refreshing. I then switched to a martini that was made well (unfortunately they don't have Hendricks).
author: Neechi M.

description: I have giving this place very many opportunities to get my order correctly which is pretty easy if you're a good listener because I'm pretty specific on what it is I want for the fact that I am a Pesca Terrian so my options are very limited. For some reason I can never get what I want at this restaurant which is very unfortunate because the food is good. As a paying customer who is allergic to certain foods it would be nice to finally get my food made correctly just like everyone else will like the same thing it's not an expectation it's good customer service. #justsayin
author: Elvis Z.

description:
BF is a huge Peruvian cuisine fan. He is adamant that Peru has the best food in South America, followed by Argentina/Brazil for meats. When I discovered Limon, I put it on the list and we made reservations for a Tuesday night dinner - right before our flight back home.

We arrived on time and were seated right away. Since there were three of us, we opted to order about 4 dishes and split them all.

What we ordered:
Half Chicken w/ Chifa Green Beans and Tacu Tacu (Sautéed rice and beans)
Chicharrón de Pollo
Lengua a La Parrilla w/ mashed potatoes, chimichurri, and aji panca sauce
Ceviche de Pescado w/ Clasico marinade

I think my favorite was the grilled beef tongue. The tongue was very tender and moist. The mashed potatoes were a really nice addition and I think I had about 75% of it.

The grilled chicken was also very tender - it practically fell off the bone.

Service was fairly attentive, but we did lose our waitress about halfway through the meal. I think they had a large party downstairs, because the main dining room lots a few waiters.

If you're into Peruvian food, Limon is a great choice.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Amazing food!

Got the loaded papas (fries), the specialty goat stew and quarter dark chicken. I had never eaten Peruvian food but it was all carbs! Very very filling. And the beef empanadas blew me away because it was paired with this minty green sauce that was tangy. 

Would come again!
author: Nabiha J.

description:
~Food~  
Although some dishes seem suited for individual plates, most dishes worked well for family style.
Arroz con Mariscos (paella): Good balance of seafood and paella, not too spicy but combined with the lime juice, it gives a little tiny kick at the end
Whole Chicken (8 pieces): They come pre chopped and fall-off-the-bone with a rotisserie sizzled skin. The meat was juicy and flavorful (though it was not consistent/depends on which piece/cut)
Ceviche Trio: Each one had the same base of juices but varied in meat (fish vs. shrimp) and spicy levels. I wish it was served with bread/chips or some type of carb because it can get sour really quickly without something to absorb the acidicness.
Seco de Costillas (braised boneless beef short ribs): This seemed like it was more of an individual dish as opposed to family style but regardless, the beef was so juicy, flavorful and at a good state of "falling apart". The beef come in a few cubes soaked in its own juice from the braising along with a bed of rice. Go ahead and scoop a bite of beef and rice dipped in juice/sauce. 
Sweet Potato Fries: nothing crazy, good standard sweet potato fries
Yuca Fries: I love the texture, which I can only describe as a mix between Taro and Potato. 

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
Price per dish was on the slightly higher side, which is fair for family style. The only thing is that some dishes, such as the braised beef, was clearly not meant to be family style while the paella definitely is. I wish there was some consistency or indicator. We had to just rely on fellow yelp pictures. 

~Atmosphere/Service~
I made a reservation the day before for 7 people on a Friday night and it surprisingly worked out without any snags. We got seated in the basement right by the stairs and it was pretty cramped space and could be an issue if it's really busy. If I reserve again, I'd def take that into account. Our waiter was trying his best dealing with peak hour but they seem to have forgotten about one of our dishes (braised beef) to the point that the busser tried to clear our table while we were still waiting for the dish. Everyone (several people were checking up on us, which is great and all but it was a little confusing) told us it was on the way but we just kept waiting. 

~Bottom Line~
Flavor was good but unfortunately all the other categories dragged the rating down.
author: Lily L.

description:
was too hungry and excited to eat that i forgot to take a picture of the amazing chicken i ate... :,( 

HALF CHICKEN - don't even like rotisserie chicken but amazing and delicious don't even begin to describe how good this tastes. they really do an awesome job in adding bursts of flavor to boring rotisserie chicken. the skin is crispy and juicy and the chicken itself is also juicy and soft. i love everything about it! this dish always comes with 2 sides. i chose green beans & yuca fries.

CHIMICHURRI - $2 extra and a little on the saltier side but you need to get this to dip the chicken into. you won't regret it. 

GREEN BEANS - crunchy and garlicky green beans are always a good addition to any meal :)

YUCA FRIES - didn't think i'd even like these fries but am so glad i went with it! best fries ever especially when you dip it with the yellow sauce!!
author: Yan L.

description:
Very good food
Nice cocktails 

Will definitely come back!

The beef is so good with there special soy sauce.
author: Oren M.

description:
OMG - this place is amazing. i was in the city for a race the next day, so didn't want anything too heavy (carbo loading is a myth) so i found this spot for dinner. I don't normally get the chance to eat peruvian cuisine so i was excited to try this place out. 

we went super early - like 530ish, but oddly enough, there was a still about a 15 min wait. no problem though because we were perfectly fine with walking down mission and taking in the city, which is exactly what we did. 

They texted us and we were seated promptly. we ordered the quarter chicken - leg and thigh and a side of green beans (yumss) and tacu tacu (im not a huge fan of beans and rice but since the waiter recommended i figured it had to be good) and the classic ceviche mixto. 

everything tasted really good. i loved the chicken - super tender and moist and that dipping sauce, whatever it was, was amazing. the tacu tacu ended up being suuuuper yummy. i never would've ordered it but im really glad i did because i ended up really enjoying it. it's not too bean textured and just the perfect amount combo of both rice and bean really. the green beans were good because you cant really mess those up lol. the ceviche was really refreshing. i didn't eat as much of this because i didn't want to take any risks eating raw food before my race, but i had the shrimp and it was super good. 

overall a great experience and would highly recommend.
author: Rachael T.

description:
While certain dishes were definitely stronger than others, I give five stars for the overall experience. We did have a large party but even so, they didn't lack on the service. 

- Arroz con Mariscos (seafood Peruvian paella)
- Churrasco a la Parilla (ribeye) 
- Whole roast chicken 
- Ceviche mixto (Red snapper (the catch of the day), octopus, shrimp, calamari)
- Lengua a la Parilla (grilled beef tongue)
- Panna cotta 
- Bread pudding 

Lots of food for sure and our tummies were definitely full! 

Favorites for me: the paella, the Lengua, and the bread pudding! 

Paella and seafood were cooked properly. Lengua was super good. The grill char flavor was super good and it was tender. The bread pudding was a surprise good choice in the sense that it was still steaming when given and was a great way to end the meal. 

The service was attentive and respectful. Water was also refilled multiple times. I would recommend that they give an extra water carafe on the table for 8 instead of just one small one. 

Tip1: Get there earlier so you don't have to wait. By the time it was noon, it was full. 
Tip2: Make reservations. They're on Opentable and you can call as well. 
Tip3: If you don't want to deal with parking, 24th street BART station is only a couple blocks away.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Mmm, yummy in my tummy! The boyfriend made reservations for our Friday date night here and I was so excited since I've had this place bookmarked for awhile. As we entered, the host led us to the back downstairs into this huge dining space underground --very cool.

We started off with two glasses of the House Sangria ($7), which was nice and strong, yet fruity. As for the food, we decided to share the Seco De Costillos / Braised Boneless Beef Short Ribs ($20.95) and Half Chicken ($18.95) with Chifa Green Beans and Papas Fritas. Our short ribs arrived first and smelled absolutely amazing! It came in three chunks of meat, which just fell off the bone into the marinated juices. The broth poured over the jasmine rice gave such good flavor and was an overall solid dish.

If you come to Limon Rotisserie, you just can't go without ordering their famous open flame marinated rotisserie chicken! The half portion was perfect for us two, but I probably would've loved to take the whole chicken home with me. The marinade on the chicken was such a good mixture of spices with the thick pieces of chicken. The aji amorillo huacatay sauce was perfect for dipping the chicken and even the green beans and fries that I had as my sides. Seriously, so delicious!

Next time, I definitely want to try the Truffle Mac and Cheese, which smelled amazing from the table next to us. Too bad we were too stuffed to try anything else, but that just means I'll need to come back for sure.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
4.5 stars. It feels good to cross something off my Yelp bookmarks after several years. I was catching up with a friend, and she made reservations. Would highly recommend making reservations since it was relatively empty around 12:30 PM on Sunday but got packed within the next hour. Service was friendly, and food came out fast.

There were so many great options on the menu, from poultry to seafood. I'll definitely have to come back to try the chicken, since it's the ceviche that really caught my eye. I couldn't decide between all the choices, so I went with the ceviche trio. It's like they invented this dish for indecisive people like me!

I was impressed with the amount of food this was. Huge bowls of fresh ceviche, a mix of shrimp, octopus, and snapper. What I didn't expect was how spicy some of them would be. Holy crap! I had horrible allergies that day, so I was just a mess. So good, though. I'd recommend the ceviche trio, but beware if you're sensitive to heat.

Looking back, I'd recommend sharing food (especially ceviche) family style so you can try a bit of everything. For me, it was too much seafood in one sitting, so I took the rest home for dinner. Oh and I forgot we started with the yuca frites. They weren't very flavorful, which is probably why I forgot about them. Wouldn't recommend those. But I do want to try their salads and plates in the future. Perhaps at their other location?
author: Stefanie C.

description: I visited Limon while I was visiting San Francisco and I was pleased with everything we tried.  We had the roasted chicken that is so savory and delicious, it came with a mustard sauce that i didn't expect to like but was so yummy!   We also tried the kale salad, green beans, Mac & cheese and 2 different ceviches!  EVERYTHING was so good!!! I wish i could go back when ever I wanted but i would need to book a flight!   When I go back to San Francisco I will definitly have to visit this restaurant again!
author: Let V.

description:
Mmmmmm if you love roasted chicken then you must try Limón. Their aji sauce is amazing but of course their chicken steals the show! Juicy, tender, flavorful, "falls off the bone"... and the skin, omg, the skin is the best part! My bf thought the chicken was rather salty but I beg to differ. The chicken was definitely my favorite dish of the night. We ordered half chicken (comes with 4 pieces) and picked two sides: yucca fries and tacu tacu. Yucca fries were delicious. I wasn't a big fan of the tacu tacu--took three bites and was done with that. Flavors were nice but I think it was too salty and heavy for me. 

We also ordered the ceviche trio which came with three yummy ceviches. One was just shrimp, one had shrimp and octopus, and the last one had fish. All really zesty and jam packed with flavor and citrus/spice notes. The shrimp and octopus one had more sourness to it than the others. That was probably my favorite. We also ordered taro chips ($3) to go with the ceviche, recommended by our server. 

I made a reservation a couple of days ago through OpenTable for Saturday date night. Thanks to the other Yelpers' recommendations, making a reservation was a smart move. No lie there will be a crowd outside on a weekend night and if you don't have reservations I have no idea how long your wait will be. It didn't seem too bad but the place is small, so if you can, PLAN AHEAD! Parking can be a pain too, but after circling twice, we got lucky and found a spot 5 blocks away (good for digestion, right?)

Anyway I was quite impressed with the food and also loved the atmosphere. Trendy, loud, fun vibes all around. Can be hard to hear your date talk, but it definitely feels intimate, vibrant, and cozy! Downside is that the main floor can be crowded and small. Literally bumped elbows with the other group next to me. Lol. 

Service is good. Servers were attentive and refilled water every now and then. They did forget our order of truffle mac and cheese but we were so full anyway that we decided to cancel our order. They were flexible and took that off, which was reflected on our bill. This works out because I plan to return and try their other small plates and dishes! Yum!
author: Debby N.

description:
As good as the first time!

It had been a while since the last time we ate at Limón Rotisserie, so since we were in the neighborhood early enough to avoid the Saturday night dinner rush, we cashed on the opportunity.

The classico ceviche was out of this world, especially when chased by sips of House Sangria! It must've been the Drambuie in it, but half a glass through I was already getting a mild buzz! That probably made the main course decision a bit more challenging, but we decided on Whole Chicken with Camote Frito (Sweet Potato Fries) and Chifa Green Beans (Wok Stir Fried green beans).

The night wouldn't be complete without a desert, so we shared a Tres Leches which might as well have been dos or cuatro leches, because I could not tell the difference at that point! I was floating around in food heaven with all the other people who just had a fulfilling and delicious meal! 

If you have not tried Limón Rotisserie, you should! You will not regret it!
author: Afshin A.

description:
My friend and I came here for dinner. While it was pretty crowded, we managed to get seated right away and services was prompt and friendly.

We shared a full Rotisserie chicken with Yukon fries and the stir-fried green beans as sides. The chicken was decent, but it wasn't mind-blowingly good and did feel quite a bit overpriced for rotisserie chicken.

I felt the quality was only a small notch above what I could have gotten at Costco, and at Costco it is way cheaper! The flavors and the sauce were delicious, but it doesn't quite make up for the difference.

The yukon fries were excellent though, they are quite starchy but in fries form they added a nice touch that complimented the chicken quite well. The green beans pretty much just tasted like what you would expect chinese stir-fried green beans to taste like.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Great ambience, food, and service! Made reservations for dinner since I had a party of 7 on a weeknight but didn't realize there was so much seating downstairs and wasn't needed. It was much nicer being upstairs though, so glad we made the reservation. 

Started off dinner with some empanadas and mixto ceviche. All the empanadas had a good filling to skin ratio, my favorites were the chicken and the cheese. Use the sauce they give you, they make the taste of the empanadas go from average to amazing! Get the ceviche with taro chips, you won't regret! The mixto ceviche by itself is a little more acidic than what I'm used to and the pieces of shrimp, squid, fish were rather large making it difficult to eat. 

Tried the rotisserie chicken with green beans and tacu tacu as my sides. Green beans were a tad too salty, but still tasty. Tacu tacu definitely was the better side option. It was a really tasty mix of rice and beans. I got the quarter white meat and surprisingly was not too dry! Flavor was good but not way too different from rotisserie chicken I've eaten at other places. 

To finish off the meal, with some chocolate molten cake and bread pudding, both delicious and a great way to end dinner!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Came here for lunch today and really had a great experience! Did not have any wait, we came around 12:30 pm and were seated promptly to eat. We ended up ordering:

* mixto ceviche with ajillo sauce (yellow) - this was delicious, the seafood was very fresh and the sauce was very yummy as well. The sauce was a little spicy but had a great kick to it

* 1/4 quarter dark meat chicken with tacu tacu and yuca fries. Now let me tell you this was so delicious!! I was surprised that the chicken was so good and it definitely easily fell off the bone. I loved the seasoning and the yellow sauce on the side which was sooo good! Also the tacu tacu was delicious. Did not expect it to be so good but the seasoning that went into the rice and the flavors complimented the chicken great.

Overall we had a great experience and would recommend others to go try as well!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: First visit.. Have seen alot of post on IG about this place was dying to try it. Told them it was our first time and he went over the menu and helped explain popular items ordered! Food was amazing, sweet potato fries to die for and he even brought over a sample of the empanadas to try, chicken one tasted just like chicken pot pie but a million times better! thanks ill be back
author: Ashley P.

description:
It was exciting to discover decent peruvian restaurant in the west coast!
I got so spoiled with great peruvian res in Florida.
The dishes we ordered were:

- Grilled octopus with mashed potatoe
- Roasted chicken with Tacu tacu and fried yuca
- Empanada (carne)
- Mango lemonade
- all three sauces

grilled octopus was great but I wished they cooked potToes like what I had in Florida, "roasted then smashed".  This allows me to savor the crunch and soft potatoes. 

the roasted chicken was dry, and think it was not fresh due to the time we went which was after lunch hour.  was not super impressed.

Tacu tacu was good, different kind than other res.

empanada was average...

thought $2 per each extra sauce was bit pricy..

over all, they were bit too salty for my taste but pretty good peruvian!
author: Sona K.

description:
Wao, don't be fooled and think it's only one floor... they have a whole other floor of seating down stairs! We came for a birthday reservation and were seated not too late (also because some people in our party were late smh). The servers were friendly and the menu looked small but was also overwhelming at the same time. We all swore the waiter told us all "individually" or "together" for the check at the beginning and we all thought it was going to be individual for a party of 11, which would've been SUPER COOL. However at the end, it was all on one check and they could only split it evenly 4 ways. So we ended up doing some math. It might be a little hard to hear in the restaurant as it does get loud.

Foodwise, I enjoyed everything! Everything just tasted good, especially the truffle mac n cheese. The rotisserie chicken was tasty, but nothing too out of the world. The beef tongue was one of the better dishes as well. Fries were enjoyable. Drinks were pricey but their cocktails are delicious. They pack a powerful punch in tastes! Also I enjoyed their Inca Cola.

I had a good time here, but be prepared to spend a lot of money!
author: Crystal N.

description:
3.5 stars, rounded down.

The ambiance is better than the food. Came here with a bunch of co-workers and it was definitely a fun time. I really enjoyed the various ceviches, but the rotisserie chicken, which they're known for, was very basic. SO basic! It wasn't bad, but it also just didn't have that wow factor. Costco's $4.99 chicken is tastier. On the bright side, the aioli for the fries was pretty good. I'm sure if I ordered something else, it would've been better...rotisserie chicken just isn't amazing if not done right.
author: Angela C.

description:
We had come down from Paradise CA for a doctors appointment and wanted to get a bite to eat before leaving. My daughter recommended the restaurant, she lives in the City. It was a wonderful place to eat. We ordered their specialty of rotisserie chicken and ribs to share. So good and flavorful. The owner/manager came and waited on us, he was helpful in making choices and describing the dishes.
It was reasonably priced for the City, we ordered sangria for drink that matched well with our meals.
The waitperson was attentive and everyone was happy and thoughtful.
author: Deann L.

description:
Omahgah the combination of chicken, aji amarillo sauce, and jasmine rice blew my mind! So freaken delicious I had to order a whole chicken with 2 sides of rice to take home! Truffle Mac & Cheese mmm hmm 

8pm Saturday reservation for this seemingly small but vibrant establishment. They managed to fit a bar on the left wall with some seating, plus I heard there's seating downstairs (Laurina of Limon said they have a private room for up to 100 at this location). Open kitchen along the back wall. It gets pretty loud. Troublesome finding street parking so I called and they changed it to 8:15 =) We got a corner window table next to the bar.

Michael waited on us-- nice & informative. He told us the specials, including price, which I appreciate. Also explained the salad dressing for side orders: creamy aji amarillo sesame which was fantastic.

White truffle oil Mac & Cheese contains smaller macaroni; I ordered one for to go and it hardens a bit under enclosed heat. Make sure to eat this fresh. So good! Decent portion for under $10. Quarter white chicken plates with two sides is $13.95, not bad.
We ordered tacu tacu (rice mixed with refried beans, on the salty side), fries, ensalada, and that jasmine white rice! Might be seasoned during cooking? Chicken is so flavorful both with/out that addicting aji amarillo sauce! Try it without sauce first.

*whole chicken (cut into 8 pieces) w/ 2 sides is $28.95

I wasn't too impressed with the carne empanadas but that's because I ate chicken first. They use top sirloin and the crust was delightfully crispy. Our polli papas was forgotten but brought out 7 min later. Their version of loaded fries: crispy chicken on fries drizzled with aji amarillo huacatay, mustard aioli, and Parmesan. Yum!

Reserve a table and have patience with parking because this food is worth the wait!
author: Kristine F.

description:
3.5 stars

Given the rave (and plentiful) reviews all over the internet, I had a high bar set for Limon. Unfortunately, it fell a bit short. The food was good but not out of this world.

We had...
- Wine, Peruvian Liquor, and Limon Punch
- Leche de Tigre Cocktail (ceviche)
- Veggie Empanadas
- 2 orders of Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries and Rice (camote frito and arroz)

Service was the downfall of this place; no one cleared our used plates during the entire meal, which resulted in a leaning tower of them at the corner of our table. No one offered water or then replenished our glasses, once we finally got it after asking (and we had to ask twice).

Overall...something of a letdown. The food was tasty but not worthy of the bill we racked up. If someone else was paying I would return, but I wouldn't spend my own money here again.
author: Nic Z.

description:
Tired of Costco rotisserie chicken?

Pretty tight place with little to no elbow room.  It was kind of an annoyance to maneuver around the people coming in and out.  Thankfully, they have a separate dining area downstairs.  My friends highly recommended the rotisserie chicken here.  And I repeat in their own words, the chicken is "life changing."  So I had pretty high expectations. 

I ordered the half chicken with two sides of the string beans.  The chicken wasn't dry but nice and juicy. However, the yellow dipping sauce is what you really crave about ! I'm not sure what it is but it was to die for.  We also ordered a pitcher of margaritas to share and it packed a nice punch.  

The service was mediocre. Our server pretty much just came by to take our order, bring our food/drinks, and give us our check.  The service and ambience was lacking but the food made up for it.
author: Derek L.

description:
Overall: The food is really really good, but I'm so disappointed with the portion sizes because you pay in my opinion so much for how little you get. I went here for dinner and maybe we ended up ordering the wrong thing, but the portions were so, so tiny!!! I left the restaurant feeling so hungry afterwards because you have to order a bunch of expensive dishes to feel satisfied. Only go here if you're down for good Peruvian food, but want to drop a lot of money or not feeling super hungry. I honestly would only come here again and get the empanadas, because I felt those were fairly priced and good. 

Food: I ordered the chicken empanadas which were super tasty! It sucks that you can only choose one kind of empanada when you get two of them though. My boyfriend also ordered the octopus dish which was super tasty, but again it was $17 and such a small portion!!!! 

Ambiance and Service: The service was great! The guy we had serving us was super nice and always made sure our glasses were filled with water. The ambiance is super cozy and I really liked the layout of the restaurant.
author: Rithika V.

description: We placed a reservation for a party of 5 and was seated right away when we entered. Servers were attentive in filling our waters and taking the finished plates away. The ambience was a mixed of fancy and causal. The food was incredible. We got the whole chicken, short rib rice plate, octopus dish, sautéed mushrooms, sweet potato fries, and yuka fries. THE YUKA FRIES ARE MY FAVORITE. You must try them! None of the dishes we tried disappoint. I will be coming here again!
author: Vega T.

description: This review is for the delicious Margarita I had, paired with the friendly service and clean dining room. We (12 of us) came here before our outing at Urban Putt and were treated with the utmost respect and fast service. My happy hour Margarita was amazing and to my surprise, I only needed one! I recommend this place if you're in the area and are looking for a nice, stiff drink. The food looked good going to the other tables too, but I can't speak to how it tastes.
author: Alex M.

description: Food was good. Place is incredibly loud and one cannot have a conversation. Service was mediocre bordering on rude.
author: Patricia K.

description: We came here with a party of 16. The wait staff was nice but some manager with a man bun tried coming over and telling us we had a certain amount of time to eat and leave. Basically rushing us. We were all dumbfounded that this man, with a man bun was trying to act tough with us so we weren't sure if he was joking. He kind of looked like Russ the rapper that's mad he works at a restaurant. Anyways I hope he gets a hair net for that thing I would hate to find a hair in my food. He tried to tell us his uncle was Randy savage and with his intimidating eye brow piercing I had to take his word for it. I think he was an extra in willie wonka and that's why we thought we recognized him. He was just not very nice and looked like he had just took a swim in the grease trap in their kitchen. When we got our food it was cold and dry kind of like the man bun guys sense of humor but I can't be mad at him.
author: Aj M.

description: I sure as hell would LOVE to come back. The drinks were refreshing, i was able to get a table right away and my waitress was very genuine. I ordered the ceviche mixed and it was was better than any mexican ceviche I'd ever had, from anywhere. I was unsure of what to expect because I've only had peruvian food made at my friends house ive never gone out and had it. I was in for a real treat. Their flavoring game was spot on i made sure to send the plates back cleaned, with nothing going to waste. I was also sharing the steak with fries i forgot what that was called but it was muy delicioso. I decided to order a drink called la bomba, it was so good.... prickly pear with notes of passion fruit served in this cute little glass. I wanted to order another kind of drink since this one was so bomb haha get it La Bomba...but was pressed for time. Great music, great atmosphere, nice setting ..the brick wall gives it a warm homey kind of feeling. I heard there's a downstairs as well. Diverse group of people ranging from stroller age to old coots were all there. Keep putting out that authentic cuisine!! Way to go.. oh i forgot the empanadas were to die for with the sauce they serve with it. Decent plateware as well as plating. All the staff members did a Kickass job. Thank you
author: Adriana B.

description: All the locations are excellent. I have been a bunch of times and loved everything I've tried on the menu. From the ceviche, to the paella, to the steak, sweet potato fries, yuca, and the chicken, everything is outstanding!!!! The ambience is fun and festive. There is usually a bit of a wait, but not bad. Might be helpful to make a reservation. Make sure you try the sweet potato fries!
author: Ashley E.

description: This is hands-down the best rotisserie chicken I ever had. Whatever happens I'm coming back for more even though I don't live in the city. The octopus/Pulpo was also amazing bit too but too spicy for me unfortunately. Normal people will be able to enjoy it just fine and if you love octopus is much is I do you should definitely order it!
author: Cerraeh L.

description: this is one of those restraunts you cant get tired of. great quality traditional food. this is my go to everytime im in the city.
author: Alex G.

description:
Date Night was a success with this place. The lady and I were looking for something a little different and I saw this place on Yelp. Given the high reviews and the fact that we had been talking about finding Peruvian place, I suggested we try it. Suucess.

All the comments about this place being packed was true; there wasn't an open table until well after 10:00 pm (we got there at 7:30). Reservations were highly recommended and the good news was that I could do it directly from the Yelp app. Nice. No problems with that, BTW.

Starting with the drinks we both tried the Pisco Sours. I had the lychee and my date had the regular. Very nice. Good pour on the alcohol. We both didn't know what a Pisco was, but I'd definitley order it again--even at $12 each.

Moving on to the food, it was fantastic. I had the rotisserie chicken with sauteed green beans, sauteed rice & refried beans. Holy smokes was it good! The chicken was so flavorful and tender, I realized I should have gotten the whole chicken instead of the half (I'm a big eater). The lady had boneless beef shortribs and this was also excellent. We shared everything. Again, the food was sublime.

The dining room was quite lively and I noticed there more than a few folks who looked like they were out on dates. Our server was attentive as he could be on what was a very busy night. We had no issues with that. 

I'm echoing the comments of many of the other Yelpers this this is definitely 4 stars, solidly. Fellas, this is a good date spot in B'game.
author: Rich H.

description:
It's simply lovely to lounge and delve into flavorful Peruvian food on sunny days, especially!  

Their pitcher of sangria is perfect for the warm weather and opt to sit next to the airy open window, if it's not already occupied!  It's enjoyable and I can be here all afternoon.

We ordered most, if not all, their signature dishes, such as the ceviche, rotisserie chicken, beef empanadas, and lomo saltado. From the zest of the ceviche, spice of the tender chicken, sauce from the lomo saltado and pastry delight of the empanadas, everything filled each of the tasty taste buds!  I asked for picante salsa and I guess it's not typical.  They charged us for it, but it was worth it.  It was lightly creamy and just like the Peruvian style take on hot sauce. 

Attentive service and open kitchen with bar space! 

I was at dining bliss!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Lychee Sour!! Simply divine!  If you're a fan of the Pisco sour- look no further. And the food is delish. Quarter chicken, yuca fries and out-of-this-world green beans for under $15.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Tried Peruvian food for first time and they have good vegetarian options  
A definitely going back kinda place
author: Siddhi P.

description:
I came here tonight with a group of people and I have to say, this experience was better than the last! We ordered a handful of dishes so prepare yourself: the whole rotisserie chicken, the lengua that came with a divine sauce and mashed potatoes, the lomo saltado (something like that) that came with rice and french fries with bell peppers tossed in the beef, ceviche mixed with calamari octopus and shrimp, chicken chicharrón, and truffle mac & cheese. I ordered the Pisco sour, there were three varieties and I ordered the original while two of my friends ordered the other two options. They were strong yet very flavorful, a delicious cocktail in my opinion!

All of the food was very good and I recommend everything that I just listed. My one small complaint is that we ate in the downstairs basement area which they have converted into a restaurant. While I love the ambience and the decor, finding it very romantic, there is not much insulation so it is very noisy because every little sound bounces off the walls. After a while of chatting and a few drinks, it gets pretty loud and you get pretty dizzy! Other than that, I had a great time and I can't wait to come back.
author: Alejandra A.

description: We came here for a date night one Saturday and glad we had a reservation because it was busy! With a reservation we were seated almost immediately. It was our first time eating here and we had a blast. Service was fantastic, everyone was friendly, and we ordered quickly after having time to look at the menu. After ordering, I quickly used the bathroom and was shocked to find that our food had arrived by the time I came out...some of the fastest service I've experienced in a long time. We ordered the chicken empanadas, lomo saltado, and a half chicken. It was all delicious but the empanadas were to-die-for. We actually ordered another set because we couldn't get enough of them. I can't wait to eat here again.
author: Katie P.

description: Today's lunch was catered by Limon- as such, my review is strictly for the food. I can not comment on the location or service. This was my first time trying Peruvian food. I'm trying to compare the online menu to what I had. First and foremost, their chicken! The "Pollo a la Brasa" is so moist and flavorful. Wish I would have grabbed more. Without shame, I went back for seconds of the Truffle Mac & Cheese. I LOVE mac & cheese, and Limon did not dissapoint. I *think* the salad was the Ensalada Mixta. Whatever it was, the aji amarillo dressing was delish. It actually reminded me a lot of the dressing at my favorite sushi spot in Concord. The chifa Green Beans had an interesting taste, with just a kick at the end. The white rice and black beans were pretty standard. I grabbed a veggie empanada, but honestly was too full from my chicken and mac & cheese to give it a try. I really enjoyed Limon!
author: Jessica H.

description:
This is a really solid choice for Peruvian food in the mission.  Came here with a group of friends and had a blast. All good meals start with a pitcher of Sangria, followed by the empanadas, main courses and desserts.

Highly recommend the chicken empanada, the Peruvian paella and the mango panna cota.  Had left over chicken the next day and it was still good. 
Service was really, really fast and this place is loud and plays really vibrant music.
author: Andrew S.

description:
LOVED IT! 

I tried almost all of their famous dishes: all 3 types of ceviche, roasted chicken (with green beans and fried sweet potato), paella, and the sangria. Personally, I really love sour, citrus food and so ceviche is just always must-try dish. All 3 types of ceviche at Limon Rotisserie were just PERFECT, full of flavor, seafood was fresh and.... I just can eat it all day, everyday lol Roasted chicken and paella were nothing special. Chicken was on a bit of a salty side, but was worth trying and juicy! I am definitely coming back for ceviche :))
author: Jane L.

description:
Ok, was just driving by late in the afternoon and saw this place. We took a chance and couldn't have been happier. The Pisco Sour is the thing of youthful dreams. We just happened to hit happy hour 3-6pm and the happy hour specials were great. A quarter chicken white meat with a double side of green beans, Leche de Tigre cocktail, an amazing ceviche, bright with citrus and fresh calimari and shrimp; and a side of Champioñones Anticucheros, mushrooms in a delicious sauce. 

Highly recommend Limón
author: Jennifer W.

description:
First thing, there were so many great items on the menu, it was hard to pick. I finally went with the Truffle Mac n Cheese and it was a great decision. Tasted incredible- really hit the spot.

Atmosphere: it's a bumping place on a Friday night, lively, loud, great music. Maybe not the place you want to go if you're looking for quiet, romance and good conversation. That being said, it was definitely a fun, cultural hub, a little haven away from the quiet streets of SF.

Truly a gem, will be revisiting.
author: Maansi D.

description:
I've always wanted to try out this place since forever and I'm glad I was finally able to last night. 

My brother ordered the tartara de tuna and truffle mac & cheese. The tartara de tuna was pretty good for a small dish. The chips were interesting - it tasted like thin cut potatoes. The truffle mac and cheese wasn't really creamy at all that my brother couldn't finish it. :/ if they put more cheese into the dish, I think it would have tasted better.

I ordered the polli papas -- it had grilled chicken pieces with french fries, mustard aioli, and parmesan cheese on top! It literally smelled like the garlic parmesan wings from wingstop! My grilled chicken was really dry that I wish I asked for more of the mustard aioli to mix it in. 

My sister got the carne a la parilla dish! It's a very hearty meal so I'd recommend this if you're hungry. The sauce was pretty salty that we had to scrape most of the sauce off. My sister couldn't finish it because of that. But the mashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables were good! 

My sister's boyfriend got half a chicken with potatoes and a salad on the side. The chicken was very tender yet pretty salty. But he still enjoyed his meal! 

Overall, I think this place needs to work on their portion control when it comes to seasoning. It was devasting when the saltiness took over the actual meal itself.
author: Sarah F.

description: They are known for their rotisserie chicken and rightfully so...very flavorful....Grab a pisco sour while you are at it.
author: Sunil R.

description:
This review is for Michael, who was the best server I've ever had! He was so attentive, not overbearing, but constantly aware of when drinks needed filling and just checking in at the appropriate times! He gave us some great food suggestions, loved the ceviche Classico. The passion fruit pisco sour was tasty, but a little sweet for me. Chicken was absolutely amassing, love the sauce it comes with, and great with fries and green beans!

Will return and will ask for Michael as a server!
author: Kimia M.

description:
edamame salad
Rotisarie chicken
yucca
tacu tacu
ceviche mixto
ceviche de pulpo

what a great spot. Everything was spot on and delicious, I should know as my mothers peruvian and i grew up eating this type of food my whole life. If i lived in the city I would make this place a stop on a tour for friends visiting.
author: Erica U.

description:
Really liked their food here last night:
1. Pulpo a la Parrilla - grilled octopus with mashed potatoes, chimichurri, and a killer aji amarillo anticuchera sauce. That aji sauce was the bomb. So flavorful - can't even describe it - warm, not spicy, so full of flavor. The octopus was great, not chewy, nice grilled texture.
2. Pollo a la Brasa - grilled quarter chicken with salad and the tacu tacu (rice and beans). Moist and flavorful chicken, and the rice and beans are like nothing else I've had before of the type - flavorful!
3. Lomo Saltado - wok stir fried beef tenderloin with veggies, fries and rice. I sneaked a bite of this one - beef was very tender.
4. Mango panna cotta with strawberries and mango slivers - wow, incredibly smooth and silky.

One of the better dinners I've had - will definitely be back!
author: June W.

description:
I haven't been to any other Peruvian restaurant in SF but I want to say this is probably the best one just because the experience was fun. The service was great and the food was equally amazing.

Menu items you should try:
1) Sangria (was decent--would recommend getting a Pisco Sour instead)
2) Lomo Saltado (delicious and fresh-tasting!)
3) Whole Chicken (get that tacu tacu for a side)--I'd say get a whole chicken if you're in a group of 3-4 because it won't be too ridiculously big and the presentation will be more appetizing

I spent a bunch of time in Peru and while there I ate a lot of Aji de Gallina (Peruvian spicy creamed chicken) which I do not think they serve. If they had this dish, it would be like that scene in Ratatouille and I wouldn't be able to not give this joint 5 stars.

Try to make a reservation, but if not the wait won't be that bad. Try going downstairs to see if you can snag a bar seat down there if you're not inclined to wait at all. The downstairs area is surprisingly huge.
author: Marlon T.

description: I've been to both Limón locations many times and love the food!!!  I like both service is always great and food is delicious!  This Van Ness location I think is less busy so I tend to come here more often. The service is great and staff is very nice and friendly. Food comes out quick after ordering even when the place is packed. We really enjoy our meals at Limón. Good job guys!
author: Dee G.

description:
How to spot a gentrified restaurant: You don't plan to splurge but there isn't much on the menu that's under $10, the food is beautiful but in small portions, it's ethnic food but nothing really feels that exotic, it's in the Mission but feels posh to some degree.

That's my TL;DR rundown of Limon Rotisserie--there are good Peruvian flavors, but prices seem marked up. (And I have no idea what truffle mac n cheese is doing on a Latin American menu.)

(+) Lomo saltado ($18.95, traditional Peruvian beef tenderloin stir fry with onions, tomatoes, fries, soy sauce, rice): Quite good, with strips of tender strips of beef accompanied by soy sauce and pepper, which almost reminds me of Chinese stir-fry dishes. I always have a problem with the fries getting soggy in lomo saltado, and I have yet to find a place that resolves this. Overall, Limon's lomo saltado is above average, though also with above average prices and a below average portion size.

(++) El pollo a la brasa ($17.95 for half, marinated free-range rotisserie chicken slowly roasted over open flame with aji sauces and 2 sides; chose yuca fries and tacu tacu): Mmm, as a place named rotisserie, they have surely refined their rotisserie chicken. The chicken is delicious and juicy, permeated with light lime and soy, with a roasty and well-seasoned exterior. It brought back fond memories of how excited I was as a kid to have Boston Market rotisserie chicken (except tastier, of course). The trio of sauces allowed you to mix and match your own flavors so that each piece stays interesting. The yuca fries were satisfying with a crispy coating but soft interior, and the tacu tacu (rice and beans) is a simple dish that fills you up. I think this is one of the dishes with better value, since it comes with sides. 

I enjoyed my dinner at Limon, but expect at least $20 per person and don't be too hungry. Oh and you can get excited about the food porn; the tapas size plates and careful preparation make for good Instagrams.

(Fun fact: My favorite Peruvian restaurant of all time is Lima Limon at Santa Clarita--would recommend for anyone making the drive to Socal!)
author: Edna C.

description:
This place was an interesting mix of cultures. On the one hand it had a Latin American feel to it but then it also had the feel of a fancy/hipster sports bar. 

The pollo al la brass was pretty good in taste, possibly the strongest dish out of everything I've tried. A plus for presentation and minus for functionality, I enjoyed their plates as they were pretty unique in style. However, their utensils were unbalance and annoying to use. ( I know its weird to comment on this but you might care about this). 

Their ceviche had too much lemon for my taste. Though I imagine if you enjoy lemon it's probably okay. The yuca fries were pretty legit. I also enjoyed the ice tea they had. Once again their strongest dish in the menu is the rotisserie chicken. 

One last thing, unfortunately their service was not very good. Don't get me wrong when they were around they were polite and helpful. But sadly, they weren't around often. Either they were understaffed or didn't care. Either way it's not cool. We even had a hard time when we wanted to pay. One to get their attention to pay and second to get our receipt back. 

Overall it's a nice looking spot with normal tasting food but it's their lack of proper service that gets them a 3 star rating from me.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description: Absolutely loved this place even though it was crowded and we were stuck at the corner of the bar. It was fun watching the bartender make pisco sours and the people call him by first name basis. We ordered the trio ceviche and some yucca fries; both did not disappoint. Although we've had better and various in flavor in Peru, the fish portions were hefty. The yucca fries weren't overly greasy and chunky in size. Busy night so I'd suggest making a reservation even on a weeknight. Street parking (usually free after 6pm I believe).
author: Jackie R.

description:
5 stars for great food -2 stars for service. 

Food: 
We got the half chicken, the grilled octopus and the seafood paella. We also ordered the red sangria. All was very good and I would order again. 

Service: 
The man who helped us out was nice. The lady who helped us out was unprofessional. We were a party of three and one person was late. We were waiting for her to come to order, and the lady helping us had a lot of attitude about it. I definitely understand it's awkward that our third person came pretty late (We were waiting for like 20 minutes) and we had felt bad about it, but the restaurant was nearly empty at the time and we had even placed orders for four drinks in the meantime. We weren't just taking up an empty table in demand and being annoying about it. Yet the waitress made faces that were just short of rolling her eyes when we said sorry and that our person had nearly arrived. I had done some waitressing jobs in the past and have been in some similar situations, but I would have never reacted this way. Her actions made the dinner uncomfortable, and I wanted her to stop waiting our table altogether. Definitely subpar customer service on her part, and if it weren't for the other waiter who was great, I wouldn't have wanted to leave tip. 

All in all though, I would come back for the food and just hope she isn't serving our table.
author: Lanny N.

description:
Limón Rotisserie is a local favorite, a large-ish, upbeat, noisy café where the only thing missing is soccer on the... oh, wait, there's soccer on the TV over the bar, so... more noise and excitement, and service just got slower, but you're having fun, right? 

Now shout an order to your waiter, and wait, hopefully, patiently, to learn whether or not you've made yourself understood. 

He didn't hear you?

Yell some more, then wait some more. 

It's no problem, because your friends are here, the game is close - I mean, it's soccer, so of course the game is close - and all that matters is having a good time, 'cause you're young and full of noisy energy, and, unlike old people, you absolutely don't expect value for the money you spend. 

Lucky you. It turns out that since your expectations are so very low, you've picked exactly the right spot to hang out.

******************************

Limón Rotisserie serves comfort food, the sorts of dishes you'd find at your Peruvian aunt's house, but on a weekday evening, not at holiday time, y'know? Here are some notes:

TACU TACU

Limón's take on Peruvian refried beans and rice costs nearly $5 and would be expensive at half that price. I'm glad I tried this dish; I'm thus enabled to use the word "unctuous" properly, to wit: "Limón Rotisserie's Tacu Tacu is an unctuous and dense grease/carbo-combo, more appropriately referred to as 'Peruvian spackle'."

LOMO SALTADO

Lomo Saltado is one of those "national" dishes you hear about, like feijoada, pad thai and hamburgers. This Peruvian favorite is a "Chifa" or Chinese-Peruvian stir-fry of beef, French-fried potatoes, tomatoes, onion, soy sauce, cilantro and chili, served with rice. It's good. It's not complex or special. It's cab driver food.

The dish being simple to make, Limón Rotisserie relies on quality ingredients to differentiate their Lomo Saltado in the Bay Area, where a thousand restaurants call "stir-fry" a starting point. Limón's version is often overwhelmed by soy sauce but is otherwise clean-tasting, and one might enjoy a larger portion, provided enough rice were offered to mitigate the saltiness. Oh, and provided those "seconds" were included in the $19 price tag.

TRUFFLE MAC & CHEESE 

From the menu: "Limon's signature creamy truffle infused macaroni & cheese."

I have so many questions...

How is it that the Castillo brothers (Limón's owners) charge $9.95 for macaroni and cheese? and how does one not hear them laughing from the kitchen, all night long?

and:

Given that Truffle Mac & Cheese is in no way Peruvian food, but is, instead, a very silly, trendy combination of cheap and sham ingredients intended to rake in the dough, why don't the bros add Brussels sprouts, beets and kale to the menu and call the place, "LuluLimón"?

EL POLLO A LA BRASA

Want to see a magic trick? Watch as Limón Rotisserie turns a $5 rotisserie chicken into an $18 one, right before your eyes. 

OK, fine. It's not magic. But there's an "invisible hand" at work that keeps people from buying better-tasting, substantially less-expensive chicken from Costco, just a mile away, so it's still spooky.

I grant that warehouse takeout is less fun than café dining, but these things also matter: one can hit up Costco three and a half times per Limón chicken; and, more importantly: if you skip Limón Rotisserie, no one there will notice that you're gone.
author: Omar S.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for awhile now, and finally got a chance to. Parking sucks around this area...it took us forever to find a spot and they only seat you when your entire party is there.

We got seated downstairs and it's SUPER noisy, like you have to be screaming to talk, totally different from the upstairs and a lot darker too.

-Arroz con Mariscos (aka Paella): worst paella I ever had...the taste was totally off from any I've had before. I've had ones where it comes out soupy but this one had cheese in it, which totally throws off the taste. There's a good amount of seafood, but furthest thing from an actual paella dish. 

-Seco de Costillas: this was pretty good except it would've been better if they used lamb, and they skimped out on the sauce. My mom makes this at home, so it could definitely be more flavorful, but this is a pretty rare find. 

-Half Chicken w/ Yuca Fries and Camote Frito (sweet potato fries): the chicken was very flavorful! The skin by itself is super salty so be careful. They messed up and gave us the green beans instead of the yuca fries, but both were pretty good. Yuca fries were fried very well, a lot better than the ones I had at Mochica. Sweet potato fries weren't anything special. I think they also gave us two of the same sauce when we wanted the chimichurri sauce and the rocoto molido (hot) sauce instead...and they ended up charging us for that...

I would come back to try the ceviche and the grilled octopus and the beef tongue, but none of the dishes stood out to me otherwise. DEFINITELY WOULD NOT RECOMMEND DOWNSTAIRS SEATING if you want somewhere quiet and/or romantic. It is super loud!
author: Tina P.

description:
Everybody talks about their chicken, but what I most enjoyed was their Asian Peruvian fried rice. The cultural fusion does it again... Definitely a highlight dish that I'd reorder. It's a special and not on the main menu. Hope they serve it that day, and you will not be disappointed. 

Limón is a popular restaurant that gets very busy. You'll wait in line during peak hours, unless your group is big enough to make reservations. Atmosphere is loud and noisy. If you like a quieter environment, simply drown out the noise with the fried rice. Yes, I won't stop talking about it.
author: Joanna L.

description:
I always have a good time when I visit here with friends or family. Limon is a trendy Peruvian restaurant that is always bustling with young people. It might not be the best place for a date because it's quite noisy, but it's great for groups. Make a reservation beforehand so you're not waiting forever.

Service is very friendly and attentive. My boyfriend and I love the lomo saltado, the yucca fries, their chicken, and their paella. The pisco sour is not for the faint of heart or lightweight - it's quite sour (which I love) and it can pack a punch. My mom had a few sips and was already feeling it hahaha. When you first look at the menu, it can seem overwhelming initially because the items and descriptions have a lot of foreign words. But have no fear! There is a little glossary at the bottom corner of the menu XD

This location is situated at the end of the most popular section of downtown Burlingame. There's lots of street parking available and if after 6pm, parking is free.
author: Judith C.

description:
Having just come back from three months in South America and a month in Peru, I had high expectations which were all met when I ate at Limon. 

The ceviche was amazing. Maybe a bit spicy but who cares. It was real leche de tigre and top notch fish. Delicious. 

The chicken is a must because it's also amazing in the traditional pollo a la brasa method. Yum. 

Finally... Lomo Saltado!!! Delicious soy based sauce with onions beef and French fries. Top notch!! Only issue here was I remember the French fries being fat in Peru... 

Pisco is delicious and you should try it as well. I prefer the maracuya sour
author: Michael S.

description:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 - 93/100

My friends made reservations for our large group, 13 people to be exact, a week ago but we were all seated 45 minutes later in the basement level of the restaurant. 

Although off to a shaky start and super hangry, Limon Rotisserie's dishes are absolute amazing! We decided to dine family style in order to try out most of the popular dishes on the menu. Our orders included two of the whole chicken, Ceviche Trio, Lomo Saltado, Carne la Parilla, Arroz con Mariscos, Carne empanadas, Truffle Mac 'n Cheese and a couple of other sides. Everything tasted super delicious, but my favorite is definitely the Arroz con Mariscos (Peruvian-style paella)! The chardonnay sauce brings the saffron rice and seafood together so well. I just can't stop raving and thinking about what I ate last weekend.

Overall, I recommend ordering everything on the menu except for the pitcher of Sangria. We were all kind of confused as to why the pitcher was the most expensive thing on our bill. I hope I'm able to find Peruvian food that can top Limon Rotisserie here in LA.
author: Celine C.

description:
I love Peruvian food. It's been a go to choice for me for birthdays and get togethers. I've been wanting to venture out to Limon for quite some time because I've heard rave reviews, the food did not disappoint. 

Went there when they were doing their last call for food orders. Everything came out quick. They were out of the chicharron de pollo so that was a bit disappointing. But we ordered carne a la parilla (grilled skirt steak) came out a perfect medium and very tender and seco de costillas (braised boneless short ribs) which had great flavor. 

They serve you a jug of water so you don't have to keep asking for it, a big plus for me since I drink a lot. 

Service was great. Ambiance was very warm and welcoming. My only complaint was that you have to pay for all the extra sauces, like chimichurri and their hot sauce (rocoto molido). A tiny maybe 2oz cup for $2-3 each. 

Will def come back to try more of the menu and drinks.
author: Sanz E.

description: When I wanna impress someone with my food choices, I'd take them here! And I'm talking Bizz people on Bumble!! Lol because good food and satisfied tummies mean great Bizz matching and relation! I recommend the Peruvian Style Paella with some Pisco Sour and you'll win your match over!
author: Linah S.

description:
I can see why the Raiders are here. 
Food is amazing. The house Sangria was great as well. 

Be warned: if you are 15 minutes late for a reservation you will lose your table.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Who would have guessed that a Peruvian restaurant would have amazing macaroni and cheese? If you want to indulge in creamy, deliciousness, then you must order the Truffle Mac & Cheese. In addition, I'd recommend trying their signature rotisserie chicken, empanadas, and Lomo Saltado (beef stir fry). Even though I love the mac and cheese, there are plenty of gluten-free options, which made Limon Rotisserie the perfect pick for one of my friends visiting last week.
 
I've been to this location on South Van Ness a few times and if you come during the week, there isn't a long wait for a table. We had reserved through Yelp, but didn't end up needing our reservation on a Thursday night. We also found parking right away, which was wonderful for the Mission.

I like the relaxed and casual atmosphere and there's a spacious seating area downstairs to accommodate larger parties. I always have a nice experience at Limon!
author: Shira W.

description:
Came here for my roommate's birthday dinner. Fast forward a few hours later that night - half of our party got food poisoning. The biggest suspect was the tuna ceviche. We tried calling to complain but the staff didn't want to believe us. Sad.

On the plus side, the service was great and I highly recommend the Tres Leches. I'll honestly never come back but if I do, it'll be for the Tres Leches.
author: Iris H.

description:
I've eaten at all three Limon locations (including the one on Valencia many times, and Burlingame) and this one is my favourite. 

Our group of four ordered a whole chicken with yuca fries (you can never go wrong with these) and ensalada. I love the yuca fries so much, I normally dedicate my choice of two sides for yuca only. Get it. 

In comparison to the locations on Valencia (decent) and Burlingame (bland), the chicken here is incredibly tender and fell off the bone as you plated it. I've eaten at the one on Valencia at least ten times, but I find the chicken here to be cooked way better. Highly recommended, and a restaurant I always love introducing others to.
author: Heather N.

description: I have heard so much about this chain Peruvian restaurant. The service was nice. Where our server was attentive even though he was slammed and the bartender was awesome. The meal was a beautiful balanced, simple dish. My boyfriend ordered the classic rotisserie chicken,naturally I snagged a bite, which was delicious. The seasoning was on point and the dipping sauce had a perfect kick. I ordered the octopus. It was a nice dish with the sweet smash, I wish there was some veggies on the plate. The sour signature drink was good, but nothing wow about it. All in all a cool place to check out!
author: Allie P.

description:
What's not to love about Peruvian food and rotisserie chicken!? We came around 12:30PM on a Saturday with a group of 4 and were immediately seated. 

| FOOD | 

- Sangria ($35 for a pitcher) - GET THIS. The sangria is delicious and like all good sangria tastes like juice so it's also something you need to be careful about. haha

- Half Chicken  - Nice crispy skin & juicy meat inside. They cut the half chicken into 4 large pieces so you don't have to worry about how to split it if you're sharing with a group. The chicken had nice spices and flavoring and paired well with the sides.

- Tacu Tacu (sauteed rice & beans) - I really enjoyed this. For this side I thought that they would have the rice & beans separate but they actually mix it together. The contrast in textures makes for a great pairing with the chicken. 

- Green Beans - If you want to add veggies to your meal I would get these. The green beans are coated in a nice sauce and have a great crunch. 

- Ceviche Mixto - OK. It's not the usual ceviche I'm used to. The pieces are cut super big so it was hard to split with our group and it's already a small dish so there were less bites. They also DON'T pair it with yuca chips which was weird since all ceviches I have ordered at other places come with some sort of chip to scoop it up with. 

- Lengua a la parilla (beef tongue w/ mashed potatoes) - The tongue wasn't as tender as I was expecting. Since it's grilled it actually has a tougher and chewy consistency. When cutting it it felt like I was cutting a steak. It was OK. The mashed potatoes they pair it with are tasty though! The potatoes are creamy and not dry. The tongue and and potatoes go well together. 

- Championes (mushrooms) - Can never go wrong with mushrooms. They had a nice sauce and went well with our meal but they weren't the most flavorful.

| SERVICE |

Our waiter was accommodating when we asked one of the dishes to be split in two due to an allergy and they were more than willing too. They constantly came around to make sure our waters were full and plates cleaned up. I would have liked if they didn't come around as often to pick up the plates though since we took a break for a while and felt rushed to eat what was left on the place so they could clean it up.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Went to Limón on a Saturday night. Food and service were excellent. Creative cocktails and yummy ceviche. Wait staff was very attentive and friendly. There were a couple of downsides which contributed to the evening. We were seated on the basement level which smelled like bleach and there was a major draft. And it was extremely loud, leaving me and my date to basically shout in order to hear each other. Because of that I don't know if I will be back. Maybe one of their other locations aren't as loud?
author: Jillian A.

description:
Boyfriend took me here for the first time and it was just really crowded, but not to the point where I can feel the next table's food or hear their giggly conversation. Is it a cool date spot? Yeah, I didnt mind the crowdedness and the ambiance is actually really cool. Slightly dimmed lighting and great drinks!

Now for the real question....Chicken lover? Why, yes I am!

We share dishes and ordered the chicken with sweet potatoe fries and roasted veggies. In addition we ordered fried fish w plantains and some other sides that, to be honest, wasnt worth mentioning because all eyes on you, chicken! Next time we go back, we will ONLY get the chicken, and I wont be sharing .
author: Samantha T.

description:
Limon is a quality Peruvian tapas joint. They serve hearty meat dishes and artsier takes on the traditional Peruvian dishes (or so I think, I'm Asian so IDK). They also have a bar and serve different types of sangria, which I thought was unique. I came here for my mate's birthday. I enjoyed my experience here greatly and would definitely come back.

Service is slow because it's quite busy normally. There are two floors of seating, but it's usually pretty packed, you may want a reservation. 

We ordered set menu. There were a lot of tapas, but i really enjoyed the:
-"Lomito" Saltado
-Pollo a la Brasa
-Both the white and red sangria
author: Sean W.

description: You go here for the Chicken! The menu has a good spread, from Peruvian Ceviches/Cebiches to Lomo with Potatoes.... but you go here for the Chicken! This place is swamped whatever day/night it is. Location and parking in mind, the S Van Ness branch is far better than the one on Valencia, not unless you would like a scenic drive and go to their Burlingame branch. You go here for the Chicken! Sauces are great too. For a nice meal for 3-4 the whole chicken with 2 sides is my normal takeout order. For dine in it's a casual ambiance, a little trendy and a bit noisy.
author: Jan R.

description:
I eat Peruvian food about every chance I get whenever I travel. I love how well balanced Peruvian cuisine is and that they make amazing ceviche. I  came to sf craving Peruvian food so I was pretty excited to try this place reading how highly rated it is on yelp. 

After landing in sf this was the first place I went to go eat. We walked into a pretty crowded and nicely decorated  restaurant with great staff to greet and seat us. The experience peaked here- the food was pretty disappointing- the ceviche was so sour that it was unpleasant to eat. Having ceviche I didnt want to devour was a first for me. I tried to stay positive for the entree, but that turned out to be not so good either. The beef tongue and chicken looked really well plated but the seasoning was just average. So between above average ambience, bad ceviche and average entrees I give this place a meh. Wouldn't recommend, wouldn't come back.
author: Tien T.

description: Amazing service, quality food & wonderful atmosphere. We came in on Friday night during the dinner rush and our table was ready, after making a reservation on Open Table. The drink options were great and all the signature cocktails sounded good. We had the pollo empanada to share, which is made with their signature chicken & a yummy dipping sauce ( I could have ordered more, they were that good! ) The half chicken with green beans and sweet potato fries were done perfectly. They also had the option of Yuka fries, which we were able to try & we're equally delicious. You have to finish with the Tres Leches cake, it is the perfect end to a meal. Will come back for sure.
author: Katelyn K.

description:
I started this new thing  where i let my friends choose where to eat everytime, otherwise we'd be eating korean food everytime and no one would enjoy it except for me. 

They ended up choosing limon and i am so glad they did!!! We made reservations for 5 people on sunday at 5 which we definitely needed because the restaurant got super packed afterwards. We went after climbing so we were starved. 

We ordered the octopus, lengua, veggie empanadas, an entire chicken, truffle mac n cheese, yucca fries, roast veggies, mushrooms, and their steak dish.  Bill was $150 including 4 drinks which was not bad at all because we were stuffed. 

My favorite dishes were the lengua, octopus, and the steak. The lengua was really tender and flavored well.  The octopus  was very tender although a bit pricey. The steak was a decent size and cooked well. I would order  the steak again for myself next time i came.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Good food (not the best in town, but very enjoyable), large portions and also it's one of the few popular SF places that allow reservations for large groups
author: Jesus M.

description:
My mom and I have been coming to Limón for over 5 years. We've seen changes of staff and upgrades in their menu - but it's stayed stellar throughout the years. 
It's the most authentic Peruvian food we've found, and being from Peru ourselves we'd know good food when we taste it. 
Their service has always been great, although I'll acknowledge that there can be a bit of a wait sometimes - but the food is worth it.
The rotisserie chicken is amazing, ceviche is delicious, and I'd definitely try the lomo if you get the chance. Don't skimp on the yucca fries, and for drinks we'd recommend the Chicano!
I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars! Definitely recommend!!
author: Valerie C.

description:
I didn't know that chicken could be so juicy and tender. It was like nothing I've ever tasted! 

I also recommend the empanadas and Mac and cheese. The best Peruvian food I've ever had!
author: Ashley M.

description:
I am writing this review late, but it one still on my mind. It was date night and I did not really know where to go. This was a last minute decision and it was a great one. We went late enough that we just walked in and did not need a reservation. All the food at the other tables looked so good we knew anything we got was going to be great. But the pitcher margaritas were the best of all. You could not go wrong with margaritas! 

The only thing we were bummed about was that they did not have the dessert we wanted, but it is the perfect reason to come back!
author: Demi K.

description: Limón is a fakey Peruvian Restaurant. I was disappointed to see that the restaurant didn't have many of the traditional Peruvian dishes such as tallarines verdes, chicha, or pollo saltado. Nice restaurant, but not original. First and last time coming here.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Good food, terrible service.  My family has been ordering food from Limon for several years now but are finally giving up.  They screw up the orders constantly (about 1 out of 3).  They're very creative in the number of ways they get an order wrong too.  Incorrect orders, missing dishes, missing sides, incorrect dishes, we've experienced them all.  And they do *nothing* to fix it after the fact.  We used to order online on their website to minimize the errors but the website ordering has stopped working too.

When I raised these issues with the manager his best advice was for customers to open all the boxes of food they've prepared to verify that they've given you what they claim they did.  I can't think of another SF restaurant that would take so little responsibility for their own customer service.

Time to move on!
author: Charles Z.

description: First off food was too expensive nothing special I've had better Peruvian food at hole in the walls. Portions were way too small. They charge $2 extra for the salsa. Our server Gerardo went from being super nice to super rude. Never coming here again
author: Mari M.

description: Excellent food and excellent staff! This is one of the most consistent restaurants! I'd come every week if I could and I'd never grow tired of it! Just be ready. It's simple and elegant.
author: Tammy R.

description:
Stopped in for lunch. Began with ceviche and empanadas. The ceviche mixto was excellent. Large corn kernals, sweet potato, and lots of seafood. The empanadas were average, but the sauce that comes with it made it spectacular. Then we split the lomo saltado and rotisserie chicken. I really enjoyed the lomo but it would be better if they provided extra sauce to mix into the rice. The yuca that came with it was just average too-- could have been cooked a little softer on the inside and needed some salt. The chicken was delicious. Presentation of all the dishes was magnificent.

Service was great. When I went to the bathroom, the kitchen staff had reggaeton blasting back there. I wish they played the same music up front-- would give the restaurant a better latin feel in my opinion...
author: Phi N.

description:
Good food! 
Ambience: 1st floor is on a quieter side while the basement carries a lot of excitement and noise. :)
Service: friendly and fast!
author: Jessie L.

description: Find myself have not much to say. Its a great place for lazy late brunch. I heard it is super loud when it's busy, so we avoided visiting during the busy hours. Chicken is decent, a bit dry inside tbh.
author: Charmie L.

description: Literally the best food. Small, simple yet sophisticated menu that is so so delicious. Try the Tacu Tacu or the chicharron de pollo, it's amazing. And the mixed drinks aren't watered down at all! I personally love the La Passion. Just the right amount of tropical juice and hard liquor . And, as the chicken is regularly the star of the show, the steak is a must try! Melts in your mouth, it's incredible. I've went here for birthdays before and it's never disappointed. Don't forget to try the mango panna cotta! I could go on and on haha.
author: Katherine M.

description:
Arrival-
Fast greeting and seating.
Great atmosphere grate attitudes and music. 
All it's missing is a dance floor. 

Food.
The drinks are great and they are not stingy with there drinks. Pisco Sour gives u power!!! It's a great creamy cocktail. I don't even like cocktails like that I'm more a beer man but this is the one place I'll have me a cocktail.
The beers are great and tasty Peruvian beers. 

The lomos  Saltado with aji amarillo sauce is a must. Extra sauce please!! 
I really can't complain about this place not one and I have been here 4 times. Restrooms are clean 
Two bars top floor and bottom. Great look to it sounds to good to be true but you only will know if u go.
author: Jay V.

description: Loud, elbow to elbow sitting, great service, good drinks, good food! Yuca fries and greens beans are delicious along with the sauces! Chicken is solid and truffle Mac and cheese is a bit on the runny side, but still great flavor!
author: Marian B.
