description: Having moved from nyc, I would have to say that this is better than pio pio. The ingredients are of a higher quality and the aji sauce is great for anything, not just the chicken.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
My partner and I shared a half chicken with wok tossed string beans, a salad and Truffle Mac & cheese. 

The chicken was perfect, cooked just right. The beans were marginal, the salad was fresh and the Mac & cheese left me wanting more.
author: Bulldog W.

description: One of my very favorite restaurants in SF.  The drinks rock with Peruvian specialties.  The food is so good that I recommend d goi g with a few people that will order something different and share.  Love the spices and sauces!  The service is outstanding.
author: Claire O.

description:
I ventured here with two friends last night and had an excellent experience. The restaurant was pretty full so we decided to sit at the bar for dinner and drinks instead of waiting for a table. We ordered a few plates to share including the Leche de Tigre Cocktail, Yuca Fries, Ensalada, Tacu Tacu, Jalea, and a half chicken with some sauces on the side. I was thoroughly impressed with everything that we ordered. 

We started off with drinks and my friend ordered a traditional Chilcanos for herself and I had the Chica Morada Chilcanos. Both were absolutely delicious. Definitely happy I went with one of these instead of one of my normal mixed drinks. 

The Leche de Tigre Cocktail was spicy, juicy, and scrumptious. The chips and corn gave the dish a crunchy balance. I literally could've eaten this all night. The Yuca Fries were delicious as well along with the sauces we ordered on the side. The Tacu Tacu was another favorite of mine, tasting somewhat like refried beans but seasoned perfectly and having a hearty texture. 

The Jalea was delicious! The shrimp was perfectly battered. I really wanted this plate all to myself. The chicken was really good too but the other dishes were so unique (I've only had Peruvian food once before) and gave me the Peruvian experience that I enjoyed so much. I can't wait to go back again!
author: Cheryl L.

description: My first dinner here in Cali with my boyfriend and I couldn't have been any happier. Because we were a bit jet lagged, we were only going to share one dish. We ordered the half a rotisserie chicken with rice and beans. The chicken was so good, cooked to perfection. It wasn't dry one bit, it was full of flavor and just amazing. The rice and beans weren't how I expected it to come out. It was mushed like mashed potatoes and I wasn't too crazy about how that tasted. The waiters were nice and friendly and the staff was also. Worth a try if you're around and want some authentic Peruvian food. The price was right as well.
author: Lily F.

description:
Their mixto ceviche was excellent! The empanadas could have been slightly better pastry but they were so tasty. 
Slightly over priced (ceviche was $17) but was great food.
author: Frankie H.

description:
Limon Rotisserie is one of those slightly intimidating places at first. 2000+ Yelp reviews? Crazy busy inside? Man, what am I even gonna do with all these expectations I can't hold them all! So beyond hyped, but it's all for good reason as they put out such a damn good product.

You can order whole chickens here, which is actually what I'd recommend to share. So juicy and flavorful. My group also ended up ordering the lengua and even though it felt like I had a second tongue in my mouth, it was delicious as well. 

Drinks were solid even though we only had the sangria. It went down super easily, but be careful as it's one of those drinks that's so smooth it'll catch up to you if you don't moderate. 

Really the only thing I didn't like about the place is how it smelled. It felt like I walked into an armpit upon first entry, but that went away after I got used to it. Other than that it was a pretty darn good place to have a bite to eat. Definitely a nice option to have if you're in the Mission and don't care for one of the hole in the wall places.
author: Sean H.

description:
This is my favorite Peruvian restaurant in San Fran! Amazing food Lomo
saltado and chicken. I highly recommend
author: Veee W.

description:
Reserved a Friday evening dinner a few days in advance with four friends. We split the ceviche sampler with chips, whole roasted chicken, yuca fries, green beans, and beef entree, which ended up being sufficient amount of food. I really enjoyed trying the different types of ceviche that included a variety of fish and flavors. 

To drink, we shared pitchers of sangria, and tried the pisco sour. The drinks were all delicious, though typical cocktail prices (~$13) so added up. 

We were seated downstairs where the atmosphere was loud and fun- good for groups, but not necessarily for a first date.
author: Naomi S.

description:
There are many items on the menu, all undoubtedly delicious. If you're looking for succulent, mouth-watering rotisserie chicken then you most certainly in the right place. 

Being not too far from my home, Limón has been on my bookmark list for a while (check!). The Frenchman made a same-day reservation via Open Table, for a 9pm reservation. Upon arrival, we were welcomed with smiles then immediately seated. The restaurant isn't very large in front, but it must be massive in the back. At least 2 parties of 10 walked from behind those walls to exit the front door throughout the evening. From what I could tell, it appears to be a good spot for a large dinner party. Make your reservation in advance. 

* Sangria 
On the sweeter end, but full bodied with plenty of cut fruit. 

* Ceviche de Camarones
Fresh, fresh, fresh with a splash of lime! These shrimp had a snappy textured when you bite into them. 

* Half Chicken + Vegetales Salteados+ Tacu Tacu
Enough to feed two people, with possible left-overs to take home. While there were plenty of the vegetable side, I wish there were more of the rice and beans (Tacu Tacu.) The skin on the chicken has a nice golden brown color, with a light crispness to match. If this is your first time dining at Limón, I encourage you to order their chicken! 

Service is pleasant, nothing extraordinary. The floors could have used a bit of cleaning. I'm assuming with the constant flow of customers and limited space between tables this may have been overlooked. 

Astonishingly, the amount we paid for our meal was very reasonable. Considering the Sangria was the most expensive item on the bill at $35.00 a pitcher, our dinner was very inexpensive compared to most places in the area. I am curious about there other menu options, we'll be back to check those out soon.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Affordable ($12.95+ for entreés), relaxed neighborhood atmosphere, and delicious truffle mac n cheese!

Got the rotisserie chicken, tuca tuca and yuca fries also. Im always a sucker for yuca fries, and these did not disappoint! The chicken was moist and was seasoned pretty well, bur nothing too too special. Refried beans and rice (aka tuca tuca) were very warm and on a cold night, it felt like it was giving me a hug with every bite! 

Chimichurri was $2 and was not worth it. It was simple and went well with the food at times, but a better one can be made at home fairly easily. 

Overall, Limón was tasty and I'd go back to try other dishes, the truffle mac n cheese, and yuca fries.
author: Alice L.

description:
Delicious Peruvian chicken and other specialties in the Mission. 

Was very glad we had a reservation as they only have a few larger tables (ours was a party of 9) and even had to wait upon arrival.

The waitress was very friendly and they constantly checked to make sure we had water and didn't need anything else.

We tried several things that we all shared. The ahi tuna tartare was served was taro chips. While the presentation was nice the size was very small and thus somewhat challenging to get a bite on the chip.

The ceviche trio was great. Full of acid, seafood (shrimp, fish and squid) and other bright flavors Limon knows how to make a tasty ceviche.

All the entrees were great. The chicken is the star cooked to perfection with delicious skin, juicy meat and a tasty yellow curry sauce to dip in.

The lomo saltado is a nice mixture of beef, rice, French fries and vegetables. 

Try the green beans as a side. They are sauteed in soy sauce as well as a few other spices and were fantastic.

As people constantly streamed in at the bar and both floors (dining area downstairs as well) it's obvious that this is a happening spot.

It is a loud place so don't go expecting anything else.

Would definitely cone back when in San Francisco again.
author: Jesse B.

description: I'm not sure if I like this place compared to other Peruvian restaurants. The food was good but I wouldn't say it was amazing. Their ceviche was pretty good but the chicken was too dry. I do like the ambiance of the place and the service was good, but not sure if I would take a date here. The music is way too loud to have a conversation.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Limon! Why are you so delicious?! I came here recently with my bf and his friends for a bday celebration! Despite it being way too loud &a being seated late, the food is pretty good! 

It was a pre-fixed meal and majority was good! We started off with the tuna tartare and it was delicious, the amount of seasoning was perfect and the fish was fresh & went well with the chips.The chicken was the highlight of the meal! The juicy and tender chicken was nicely roasted and it came with a great dipping sauce! Lomo Saltado was also delicious, nice big chunks of seasoned beef with a tasty sauce with fries was exactly what we needed! The next thing that we had was the empanadas and I was only able to try the chicken one and it was amazing! I really liked most of the good here! I didn't get the chance to try the salads but they did look tasty!

Overall, this place is decent but the noise level is way too loud. Our reservations were at 8 but we didn't get seated until 9, it's also extremely hot and stuffy downstairs. Would help if there was a bit more ventilation. Definitely will be back in the future to have more chicken!
author: Stella J.

description: Very tasty food, fast and courteous service. The ceviche mixto was superb! Fresh, perfectly marinated, seasoned and the right level of hotness, they really got it right! Reasons I don't give it 5 stars: first, the ceviche was supposed to have octopus, I only had two thin slices in a mountain of fish and shrimp, it could have been better balanced. And second, the chicken although tasty... it was a bit dry, I've had it here before and it was juicier, cooks, please watch the moisture on your rotisserie...you need to be consistent. Costumers, if you order the chicken make sure you make a note to the server that you don't want your chicken to be dry.
author: Hiram M.

description: The servers could do a better job at being friendlier... But the food is good here. Pisco sours are also good.
author: David C.

description:
Ambiance is only good on the upper floor. They have extra seating down below but the light is harsher, it's typically noisier, and there's less decorations. Feels like a standard restaurant basement.

I love their chicken empanadas best; their carne empanadas are a close second.

Always get the mango lemonade; it's pretty rich in mango flavor and it's thick and syrupy. 

I got the Arroz con Mariscos entree. Great seafood entree, comes with jasmine rice. Will probably order again next time I go. $21.95, and a good filling amount of food.
author: Rose L.

description:
This place is so so so good. My friends and I ended up sitting at the bar because they were full in the dining
Room and we didn't have a reservation. That was totally fine for us though, and I'm honestly glad we did because our bartender was awesome. We got the piscos which I could drink all day and several plates of food and it was all delicious. I would totally recommend and go back!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Awesome place! wow loved the customer service Christian is the best guys 
Food was awesome had to order some for later to go lol drinks are so good!!!! 

Christian is the best waiter knows about everything that's what's up!
author: Ray D.

description:
Had a very good experience here. The staff are friendly and when knowing we're out of town, bought us a round of Peruvian cocktails! 

We loved everything we ordered including the roast chicken of course, a (Arroz con Maricos) seafood paella, and roast beef tongue (Lengua a la Parilla) and also a sampler appetizer. My favourite is the sampler and everything is done really well and flavourful.

It was the best meal we had in SF on our trip.
author: Lesley Y.

description:
They have a great happy hour. Appetizers and drinks!
I had a margarita & it didn't taste like the pre made ones happy hour places usually have.

As for food, got the beef empanadas which were good, not amazing. The green sauce it comes with, ooooo, GET IT AND GET EXTRA. 

Also got the lomo saltado and that was really good too. The crispy chicken appetizer was cool. Not as good as the lomo!
author: Paulina T.

description:
First time here after they opened August last year.. We always passed by the Kabul Mediterranean Cuisine til they closed!! We were visiting The Peninsula, all restaurants and places we used to go to, then we planned to have a sit down late lunch here.. 
Customer service, it was indeed excellent, our server and David/Dave and the owner Francisco..
What we ordered was one of the recommended dishes Polli Papas, composed of Peruvian Chicken with fries and Parmesan ..
The dish was presented well but the taste was strong and too bland..tasted overcooked that it lost its taste.. Combination of a burned chicken and melted parmesan cheese is overkill... probably not the best combo.. 

We might probably try some other dish to give them the chance..
author: Kash D.

description:
Man, this is a noisy restaurant. But it fits. If it was quiet and refined, it wouldn't work at all.

We were sat at a small table next to a window and ordered drinks. The service is super friendly and, given the number of people in the restaurant, it was remarkably efficient.

I ordered a steak, spud thing... and my wife ordered the day's special of seafood. The meal was sensational. It wasn't served with any bread...but maybe that's a Peruvian thing. It didn't affect our appreciation.

At the end, I ordered a chocolate dessert which was fabulous and my wife had the tres leches which she thought a little sub par when compared to the Cuban efforts available in South Florida. .

However, the food, the atmosphere, the service...and the price were are very good. It is definitely on our list for a return next time we are in San Francisco.

PS We both had coffee and that was very good also.
author: David F.

description:
I had a decent lunch here this time, but the waiter kept pushing us to order more drinks, dessert, anything to pad the bill. It seemed he had his own interest much more in mind than ours and it was not pleasant or even wise on his part. We gave him a good tip decent the pushiness. 

The food was a bit greasy this time. I'm willing to give it another shot, but unsure of what to expect.
author: g b.

description:
I have bad experience to ordering my to go order food all the time when I call they don't hear me very well and they leave on hold like a 10 minutes and finally when somebody to pick up my order the girl answer me say don't speak Spanish and after having taken  my order she was speaking very well Spanish.
I don't speak very good English for that reason I prefer speak Spanish is so sad because there are people really don't speak nothing English and this it's frustrating .
author: Miguelation C.

description: Ok, so this place was a huge let down. I love Peruvian food and I was looking forward to enjoying this place; however, I left disappointed, dissatisfied, and insulted. We were a party of eleven, and when the waiter took our order, he forgot three of us. When he was partially finished with taking the orders from one side of the table, he promptly moved on to the other. We were expecting him to come back, but he did not. Perplexed, we called him over, and gave him our orders. When we were trying to order drinks, my sister asked for a bloody mary, since they have an open bar. The waiter asks for her ID, which she hands over, and then he reveals that they do not make bloody mary's. A trained waiter should have divulged this, and asked for the ID at the same time- instead, he played around with the fact. Furthermore, he did not offer an alternative to the bloody mary. The most terrible happening of this experience was the manager's doing. When my mother received her Ceviche Mixto (sorry, no pic) she asked the manager if they offered "tostadas." The manager answered in spanish "this is not a Mexican restaurant, it is Peruvian." In another case, I would have dropped everything and asked for the check immediately, but there was another side of the family present. I have never been insulted or treated like that ever, in any food place. Note to the manager, what you should have done is: say no, offer a substitute, turn around, get it, come back with it, and leave. But no, you had to behave in the most ridiculous and disgusting manner. We did not ask you for a fact about the place, we asked you for something you could potentially serve, therefore, you either serve it, or serve us an alternative.  After behaving like a child, the manager brought us some sort of yucca chips, which was very displeasing. By the way, what was brought to us are still "tostadas," but they are made with yucca instead of maize; this fact only emphasized the unnecessarily immature behavior of the manager. In any case, the Lomo was second-rate, chewy and gummy, but the octopus was great, as well as the Ceviche Mixto. Untrained staff, disrespectful manager, and hit-or-miss food. Come in at your own risk.
author: Jorge A.

description:
I've been here a couple of time and it's still my go to place for Peruvian food. I cannot switch to another restaurant even though I have tried. Made reservations a couple of times at some other Peruvian establishments but I always ended up crawling back to Limon on S Van Ness since it feels authentic there. 

When you are here, you have to definitely pick out the chicken rotisserie ( It's to die for..) Some Yuca Fries -- NOMMM, may be also a bucket of sweet potato fries? Heaven is here.

Another dish I would recommend for sharing is Ceviche: the mix. That plate is fresh, a light touch of lime and the delicious taste of fresh seafood. I am drooling as writing this review atm, perhaps I will need to head myself down to Limon for dinner tonight after this. 

Seafood rice (Aroz Mariscos - I think I typed it right, too lazy to look it up, sorry guys :D): This is a paella taste alike =  DELISH 

Well, the most important part of this review is: S.A.N.G.R.I.A !!! Stole my heart babay.. *heart 35$ for a pitcher and it's well worth it. :D 

Great night catching up with friends, family? - Limon is def your choice. 

If you are thinking of bringing a date, please aware the noise of this restaurant, a little loud to have a first date conversation. You kind of have to scream across table to hear each other. Been there done that - damn never again. :)  

*****
author: Thao P.

description:
I LOVE LIMON! I love everything about it. The food is so delicious and perfect for a large group of people.

Location: I tend to prefer the other location a little better. This location has a small dining area on top with a larger area underground (with no windows). We were seated in the underground location and it just felt kind of weird dining without any windows. 

Food: The food is amazing!! We love to order family style when we come so that we can taste a bit of everything and share. We ordered: 
Half-Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries and Regular Fries- Juicy and moist rotisserie style chicken. 
Empanadas- A MUST! We love to get the pollo. The cheese is just filled with gooey cheese. If you're looking for something simple and just want cheese, you should try this one!
We also tried the rice and a few other small dishes to round out our meal.

I highly recommend coming here. They take reservations and are able to accommodate groups. When you order family style, the prices are really affordable!
author: Courtney O.

description:
I made a reservation for 4 friends on the yelp app. It was a good idea because they were crowded for a Sunday night dinner. 

My friends and I split a bottle of wine. They were courteous enough to pour and refill our glasses. Fancy!

For food, one of my friends and I split the half chicken with two sides dish. We got the vegetable side and yucon fries. We also go the rice/bean mash as well. The chicken was very good and moist! It had just enough flavor. The serving size was just right for two people. The rice bean mash was very good as well. Probably my favorite side. The yucon fries/veggies were okay, i wish the fries were a little saltier. I will probably try other sides next time.

I had a bite of my friend's truffle mac and cheese. Very tasty! It was just the right amount of truffle seasoning and not overkill in the cheese. Perfectly done.

Overall, I'm definitely heading back to try other dishes!
author: Marcie A.

description: We Stayed in a nearby Inn who recommend Limon. I haven't had much Peruvian food but we gave it a try. I have to say this was the very best roast chicken I've ever eaten. So juicy with crisp skin and tons of flavor. We're coming back to SF in a few days and will be definitely be back
author: Tom S.

description:
To increase your chances of skipping the inevitable Sunday afternoon wait and grabbing seats at the bar, plan your visit to Limón with just one other person. 

I'm a huge poke fan. And the ceviche mixto here makes me question if ceviche is better than poke. That lime juice though.. Is it lime juice? 

When I think rotisserie chicken I think of Costco. ... that is not the case here. Chicken rotisserie done right. With the skin. Delightful with a capital D.

Queso empanadas = that warm crispy flaky texture on the outside with a burst of warm gooey cheesy awesomeness on the inside. Goodness gracious.

Overall I felt like I was in heaven from the sensation of the food to my taste buds. The volume of customers and the liquid splashing on me from the bartenders and the slight delay in service due to volume of customers.. Didn't bother me. Because I was in heaven. 

There's a TV at the bar so this might be a good place to catch the Warriors beat the Cavs. 

Lastly.. Eat a light breakfast and/or just have coffee before you indulge at Limón. 

Enjoy:)
author: Sheila D.

description:
Limon was such a pleasant surprise! I'm a huge carnivore, and therefore a bit of a snob when it comes to meats, but I was thoroughly impressed with the chicken. Their seasonings were delicious and the portions were large. 

And, being a carnivore, I was SHOCKED that my favorite dish was- wait for it- the GREEN BEANS. I almost didn't order them, but decided to give them a try based on our server's suggestion and I was completely blown away. They are crispy, well seasoned, and pair well with the main dishes. Especially if you dip them in the sauce, the flavors are like fireworks in your mouth. 

Overall, I was very happy with the experience, and would certainly come here again.
author: Sonia D.

description:
Beautiful people and cozy space. Awesome location for dinner and drinks in general. Kids are welcome and there is more than enough room for big parties. Please be aware... If the food came any faster, you'd think they microwaved it, but it was definitely delicious. 

The staff members are welcoming and very tolerant of tastebuds, for that I'm very thankful. Spacing between tables seems tight and can only be an issue if there's a lot of movement around; besides that you'll enjoy the atmosphere the most, followed by the wonderful hospitality.


Thank you Limón Rotisserie- I hope I can visit you in the near future. Cheers!
author: M K.

description: Everything here is DELICIOUS! The rotisserie chicken and sauce is outstanding and the skinks ultra crispy and flavorful. Chicharon de pollo was amazingly crispy! Our group had several ceviches and enjoyed them all with pitchers of sangria. Even the desserts were great. Chocolate cake with coffee ice cream was warm inside and cold on top. Highly recommend!
author: Steve S.

description:
Limon Rotisserie is an upscale Peruvian restaurant with I think three locations now, one in the Penninsula, one on Valencia and the other on South Van Ness. This location is always busy but surprisingly was not difficult to snag a last minute large group reservation on a weekday. Note: They have a large dining area downstairs for groups and allow you to throw down multiple credit cards. I loved that the food comes out quick and the service is super friendly.

* SANGRIA - Delicious - is there alcohol in here?
* CEVICHE MIXTO - Pretty good but so small!
* BEEF SHORT RIBS - 4 STARS: Delicious, fork tender short ribs sitting in an Asian style sauce. This was really tasty, not mind blowing, but really good. 
* CHICKEN - 3 STARS: What's up with San Francisco and famous rotisserie chicken. I've only had amazing rotisserie at Zuni and everywhere else I went is pretty standard. Hey, I appreciate a $5 Costco rotisserie, and if you're going to charge me more it better be even better!
* RIB EYE - 3.5 STARS: Quite a thin cut of rib eye, and you could taste the marbled fat. It was good in a very standard way, but I would recommend the short ribs over the steak if you had to choose. 
* SIDE: SWEET POTATO FRIES - Meh.
* SIDE: VEGTABLE - 4 STARS: A nice asian style vegetable dish.
author: Jess C.

description: Limon is a must try Peruvian Restaurant but for me I think it's time to move on. Monday night wasn't busy and the food was lacking. Chicken was dry and I was throwing more meat than bones in the waste bowl. Lomo Saltado was tough not tender. Truffle Mac great but lots of restos have the same similar side. Sangria was fine. Staff was nice and friendly but never asked how the food was. I have seen better days at Limon so those memories will last. Must have been an off night....
author: Rich S.

description:
Limon has always been a recommendation people have given me and after finally trying it for myself I can see why. 

We arrived on a Saturday night around 6:30 and expected a long wait, but we were seated within 30 minutes. Not a bad wait when you're spending it seated at the bar grabbing a drink or two. The craft cocktails menu had a little bit of everything from light, refreshing drinks to "strong, manly" ones. All of which we tried were delicious. 

We ordered...
- Truffle Mac n Cheese 
- 1/2 El Pollo a la Baras
- Ceviche Mixto
- Lengua a la Parilla 

My favorite by far was the lengua. Nice thick cuts you eat like a steak with their aji sauce - little chimichurri on top - amazing. Truffle Mac n cheese was definitely a close second though. I'm not sure if it's cause I'm a sucker for mac n cheese or if it's cause of the creamy texture and distinct truffle taste...or both! All the dishes that we had were fantastic and there is so much more of the menu to explore. Cold plates, hot plates I want to try them all. I will definitely be back.
author: Jen V.

description:
Make a reservation!!!!

Although this place has 2 levels, seats are always filled! We came here for mother's day and was not disappointed. We ordered all of the Cheviches, whole chicken, sole, beet salad and some sides. 

Everything was delicious! The waiters were super busy but made enough time to check in on us to make sure we had enough to drink and all of our food was out. 

They did forget to bring out a drink for my sister but took care of it on the tab quickly after we told them that it never came out.
author: Mai W.

description:
I love this place! I've only been here 3 times but every time, I always leave super satisfied. I wished they would open a location in SJ or at least in Mountain View or PA. I would definitely be visiting more often.

So far I have tried their famous roasted chicken with aji sauce, grilled beef tongue, grilled Mediterranean octopus, lomo saltado, ceviche mixto, yuka fries,  tacu tacu and pisco sours. Everything is good except for the ceviche. IMO the seafood taste as though its been over marinated so I can't taste the freshness. If I had to pick my favorite dish, it would be the grilled beef tongue. It's is fork tender and the sauces on the plate complement the yuka mash potatoes and of course the tongue. NOMS!  My second favorite is the lomo saltado. Who doesn't love meat and potatoes? My only complaint is that it can be a little salty but a little extra rice will fix it.

Would I recommend this place? Heck YES!
author: Judy V.

description:
I really like this place. The food was really fresh and items to choose from were unusual and yet familiar at the same time. We shared an order of mixed ceviche which was fresh and had great flavors. You choose the type of sauce it comes with. We had the Cream de Aji Amarillo. Light and fresh with a bit of spice. We than shared a main plate of Pescado ala Macho, crisp sautéed fish with a delicious sauce. We also shared the Pulpo a la Parilla. Super fresh octopus in a chimichurri and aji amarillo sauce. Served with a small serving of mashed potatoes. We were too full for dessert but had a couple of drinks prior to dinner that were also spot-on. The first was a pisco sour, the second was called La Bomba del Amor...it was definitely a love bomb! 

Average price in the city for drinks and reasonable prices for food. Since we don't live in the area and wanted to try their other food (we saw a lot of people ordering the chicken) we ordered some for take out for the next nights dinner. Ot was well packaged and reheated perfectly at home and had great flavor! I just wish there was a place like this closer to us!
author: Andrea K.

description:
Decided to have an early dinner (about 5pm) here with friends. 

No wait, excellent cocktails, Trio Ceviche, Chicarron Pollo,
author: Raul A.

description:
Their beef tongue is soooo bomb!! It LOOKS dry but it definitely is not. It's so tender and melts in your mouth. 

I got the quarter dark chicken. The aioli sauce that comes with it, YUM YUM YUM!! 


Only bad note is 

**if you ask for hot sauce, they don't give it for free or a simple tapatio bottle. It's in a sauce cup and it's $2.00 extra charge. We didn't find out until the bill is given to us. We were only upset because our server didn't inform us! And the sauce portion for $2?! No thanks!!

So that was the deduction of -1 star
author: Cindee P.

description:
Great food , great drinks and ambiance is really nice too 

Worth the drive in every sip and every bite
author: Louie H.

description:
One of our Peruvian friends recommended this place and since we were in SF we decided to try it out. Like most restaurants in the city, they don't have a parking lot. It was pouring rain that day so we were lucky to find street parking two blocks away. I made a quick reservation about 30 minutes before we arrived for dinner around 6pm and the place looked really busy when we walked in. Lots of windows which is nice. They have another dining room downstairs and that's where we were seated. No windows and kind of dark, and the acoustics down there was strange. We were seated near a big party that was a little loud (which doesn't normally bother me at all) but the sound just seemed to be amplified x10. The sound dramatically decreased walking just ten steps away. 

We enjoyed the food though. We got a chicken and rice for my 4 year old, my husband got the lomo saltado, and I got a pallela dish. We also got empanadas. Everything was really tasty.
author: Susan K.

description:
My mom and I eat here multiple times throughout the year --it's one of her favorite spots in San Francisco.  

The interior if the restaurant is modern, clean, with a moderate sized dining area.  The hosts and waiters are all really friendly and helpful in making suggestions while ordering your meal.  

We ordered : 
- A glass of Sangria
- Clásico Ceviche de Pescado (Fish)
- Leche de Tigre Cocktail
- Quarter white rotisserie chicken, with sweet potato fries and rice.  

The menu has a variety of items to choose from --chicken, ceviches, empanadas, or larger entrees.  Your bound to find something for every palate ; however, the non-meat eaters will have limited options.  

The plates are served family-style allowing my mom and I to try a bit of everything.  The Classic Ceviche is a very good portion (enough for one person to eat alone or to share among two --depending on the appetites) --lots of fresh fish with a great citrusy sauce.  The Leche de Tigre Cocktail is on the smaller side and although very tasty with its mix of seafood (fish, shrimp, calamari) --it wouldn't be enough as a stand alone dish for one person.  Since we had ordered ceviches, the one quarter white piece of rotisserie chicken was a great extra to share. the chicken was flavorful and moist --GREAT for being white meat chicken which is easy to dry out.  The sides were a great accompaniment and a great portion --we ordered the sweet potato fries and received a large quantity, but note that if you order the yucca fries, the portion is very different (smaller).  

I'd definitely recommend this restaurant to people --great peruvian treats in the heart of the city.  My mom and I have never made a restaurant and have usually been seated right away or within 5-10 minutes.  We've only been here at lunch hours, but perhaps a reservation at night is recommended.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Very good.  my BF and I were on vacation, wondering around San Fran and we came across Limon.  I had the mac and cheese with a side of Green beans.  The beans were seasoned so yummily.  my bf had chicken and he really liked it.  I recommend!
author: Vinyasa G.

description:
Beef tongue was the highlight of dinner.
Four thick pieces of juicy chewy beef tongues for that price was so worth! 
 
The special today was fried chicken wings glazed with sweet soy sauce. Very nicely fried. Kind of taste like Korean fried chicken.

Try to sit upstairs if you can! Atmosphere is a lot nicer than the basement
author: Andy L.

description: Food is good ok but I was really shocked when I learned that they charge too much for an extra sauce!!! I didn't know that they were going to charge for just tiny bit of Chimichurri sauce for 2 bucks and the extra sauce for the yucca for the same price!!! They should tell customers in advance that there's a charge! What if some people don't have enough money to pay for those extra charges or surprises!! That's really uncalled for!  Chimichurri sauce MUST come with the rotisserie chicken!!! I don't advice people to eat here you have a lot of money to pay for their unexpected charges!!!!!
author: Maria T R.

description:
Not very familiar with Peruvian food, but my experience here was pretty good. 

For our party of 7, we were brought downstairs to a cellar area which was dim yet very loud.

Their Lomo Saltado, was praised by everyone, but they also added that they could have made the dish themselves. I ordered the small plate called lengua a la parilla, which is beef tongue, mashed potatoes, and their aji panca sauce. The beef tongue was super tender and the mashed potatoes were great. Of course, we also had to order the truffle mac and cheese. Yes, the truffle was very aromatic, but the pasta itself was just average. 

A good place for parties or large group of friends and a great place to get your Peruvian fix!
author: Samantha C.
Miko B.

description:
Food
As a note, i came here with a friend who is a vegetarian. We ordered veggie empanadas, and a truffle mac and cheese. This was been the best mac and cheese i've ever had. For me personally, I find mac and cheese usually to be too overwhelming, and as result I'm only able to eat a few bites. But this mac and cheese though, was ridiculously good - wasn't heavy at all! The empanadas were average. 

For drinks, I ordered a lychee sour, which I loved! I like alcoholic drinks on the lighter side, so this was perfect. 



Service
If it wasn't for service, I would've given it 5 stars based upon food alone. I found the waitress to be rude. Throughout the whole meal, I found myself to be rushed. Literally after a minute of sitting down, she asks us if we're ready to order. After that, as soon as a plate was empty (thirty seconds max), she immediately took it. Again, as we dropped our utensils at our end of our meal, she immediately came over and asked if we were done.
author: Kristen L.

description:
Time for some tough love. This review is for the management. 
I have been a longtime fan of Limon, I live in the 'hood, so it's my go to for good, consistent reliable great comfort food. Limon is the place I bring my out of town friends or place I pick for b-days and group gatherings. The chicken is delicious, it melts in your mouth. I always have the chicken and a couple sides. If with a bigger party we get more sides, they are all good. I've occasionally tried other entrees but their chicken is so good, I've even ordered a chicken for the table, so I can at least have a few bites. 
So why one star? First, I'd never been to this location, I always go to Valencia, but we decided to try it for a change of pace. It was packed so I can't imagine that it is always this bad, but wow. The food was inedible. My chicken was so dry, I was hungry so I tried to eat it, but I took one last bite and spit it out in my napkin, no way I could eat it. I actually ordered the half because I thought I'd take some home for lunch, what a waste. It was dry, shriveled, gross. I had the yucca fries and beans and rice for sides. The fries were delicious. they were the only thing that were edible. The beans and rice were a gelatinous flavorless blob, reminiscent of dog food. If I didn't know it was beans and rice, I would not have known. I took one bite. I was done. 
Typically when you return full plates the waiter will ask if everything is ok, but we ate at the bar so no one asked, I really wanted to say something, but I didn't want to be a buzzkill on an otherwise fun night catching up with a good friend. She didn't say anything, but I noticed that she only ate her steak and left the sides almost untouched. 
Who knows? Perhaps a bad night? Either way, you are lucky I am a regular and have had many, many wonderful meals at Limon, because if it were my first I would never be back. SF has too many good restaurants. You cannot slide like this. Please, do some quality control, make sure this doesn't happen to anyone else. No one likes to waste their hard-earned cash on a bad meal, and I don't want you to go out of business. I want to be able to rely on you being there!
Meanwhile, I will never go to this location again, unless it's for a drink at the bar. As always the service was incredible. Everyone was so nice. I really love your concept and your staff  - and typically the food. I'll see you at the Valencia location.
author: Yolanda I.

description:
Had dinner here with a friend recently and I actually prefer this location to the Valencia St. one seeing as it has more of a neighborhood feel and a downstairs area. 

I'll keep it brief since a million people have been here and I've also reviewed Limón's other location. OF COURSE we ate chicken but you don't need another review about that. 

Standouts:
- ceviche sampler (3 for $22 - definitely enough food to be a whole meal on its own)
- Picudo (tequila, lime juice, ginger, mango) is deceptively strong. 

We ended up getting dessert elsewhere but I'm definitely going to come back for my panna cotta. Every time, man.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Quarter chicken dark meat $12.95 6.5/10 decent but eh, nothing special

Yuca fries as the side 6.5/10 pretty good

Tacu tacu (rice and beans) side 7.5/10 pretty good, I'd recommend it. 

Carne empanadas $8.95 6/10 nothing special

Customer service was what brought it down to 2/5 stars and made me never come back. I told waiter the empanadas were cold when I bit into it, so they took the dish to the manager. Rather than replace the dish, I over heard the manager call me a liar and it wasn't possible that it was cold. I had to point out the meat inside was cold, not the outside. When he realized he messed up he replaced it. 

Don't call your customers liars just because you think others don't understand the language.
author: cool g.

description:
Made reservations for a Friday night at 6:30 and once we arrived we were quickly seated in the downstairs area. Note: the music is loud. Felt almost more like a club atmosphere than restaurant. 

We had to wait at least 15 min before anyone even acknowledged us. For drinks I decided to try the maracuya sour and bf got the sneaky limon. Both of our drinks have egg whites in them and that usually gives a frothy top. I have no clue what happened to mine (obviously wasn't shaken well) because it looked like scrambled eggs. NO frothiness. Taste was decent. Bf's drink had the tiniest bit of froth but still not what I would consider passable. 

For dinner we ordered the ceviche mixto, half rotisserie chicken with yucca fries and tacu tacu for the sides, and the truffle mac and cheese. The ceviche was good! Nice and bright with big chunks of fish. After we ordered, our server came back and asked if we wanted chips with the ceviche. We said sure. The taro chips are very similar (if not the same) as the Terra ones that you can get in the stores. When we got the bill I didn't realize it was $4 -___- a tad overpriced and wish the server would have told us since it wasn't on the menu.

The chicken was tender and well seasoned, even the white meat (though the dark meat was much juicier). The sides were good and the sauces that came with the chicken were on point. The truffle mac and cheese was truffly without being overpowered, and the noodles were al dente. 

We got 1 more round of drinks to see if they would be better than the first, and luckily they were. The original pisco sour had the frothiness and was well balanced, and bf enjoyed the chicararra. 

For dessert we got the bread pudding which was tasty and definitely a great choice. 

Service was soooo slow. There seemed to be only 2 servers but tons of bus boys just standing around. It took forever to get someone's attention and I think when they made our first round of drinks, they just had someone put the ingredients quickly together since the bar was backed up. It wasn't busy when we came but by the time we left it got packed.
author: Noelle H.

description:
I wanted share my recent experience dining at Limon for my birthday celebration on November 11, 2017, since they have yet to offer something for a celebration ruined. Prior to my reservation, I chose to go with Limon because of all the positive and great things I have experienced dining at the restaurant, also heard from friends who have dined with here before and mostly, with great accommodation for huge parties. Everything was going well and I especially appreciated the host (whose name started with an E) and their politeness and attentiveness. As you see, not all of our parties arrived at the same time, but the host was really nice and directed us to the bar while we waited to be seat. That was no problem at all, we even caught glimpses of the Warriors' game playing on the monitors. 

A few things did not go as planned and while I felt it may have been an honest mistake, we were not offered an apology, not once. Right before our appetizers and entrees were served, our waiter brought out our drinks - spilled one of the drinks on one of my dinner guest's Louis Vuitton purse and did not apologize or excuse himself. He did not remake the drink and proceed to hand it to her (half full). Also my empanadas were like warm and burnt, most of the steak in the Lomo's were over cooked, and just overall the food was below standard. Secondly, I'm unsure if this may be a restaurant policy but we were not made aware of this, the waiter informed us we would be served the cake, so we waited for about 20 minutes before we reached out to the manager Javier who was extremely rude. Javier refused to serve the birthday cake until every person was finished with their entrée, which we were not aware of since the waiter informed us he would get the cake even though there was one guest who was still eating due to her food coming out extremely late. Javier decided to get very smart with me and even slightly raised the tone in his voice when I grew frustrated because we were not informed of the cake policy. When the cake was brought out, the slices were incredibly thin, comparable to a slice of bread. Needless to say, not only myself, but my guests all seem quite disappointed. Especially since it was an ice cream cake, it was partly melted by the time it was served. Lastly, there was a huge confusion and mix up on the bill - we were charged incorrectly for quite a few items we never received. We had a difficult time communicating with the manager Javier on duty that night. Not only was he unhelpful, he was also very rude and unprofessional.Unfortunately, it was a very disappointing and poor dining experience for all of us. I feel like my birthday dinner was a nightmare, and actually ruined. For these reasons, I do not believe I will be returning to Limon Rotisserie.
author: Alize B.

description:
Came here after the Exploratorium free day when my friend suggested that we have Peruvian food for lunch.  I've never tried Peruvian food prior to this, so I was pretty excited.

The place is very casual and modern.  It had a very good vibe to it, which I am not too sure how to describe.  Our group of three was seated quickly.  We ordered the rotisserie chicken (came with two sides; we got the yuca fries and sautéed veggies), "Lomito" Saltado, and truffle mac'n cheese.  They were all well seasoned, especially the "Lomito" Saltado.  The chicken felt over-hyped.  Maybe they left this particular chicken too long the oven because it was very dry.

The food here was flavorful but I didn't feel like it was worth the extra money.  The service here was pretty good and the setting is nice, so I guess we were paying for that mostly.
author: Helen Z.

description:
There are a few locations of this Peruvian restaurant around SF. I have a soft spot for Peruvian food after I was introduced to it after visiting the country a few years ago. 
I came back craving a few of the signature dishes. After that, whenever someone suggests Peruvian, I jump at the suggestion. 

While I couldn't find Aji de Gallina or Chaufa on the menu, we did have some good dishes to choose from. 

Food & Drink

Pollo a la Brasa - this is a staple of a Peruvian restaurant, and (I hear) amongst Peruvian restaurants this is how they judge their merit.  If their rotisserie chicken  is good, then they are worth "their salt" as the saying goes. 
Limón's chicken was good. The dark meat was moist. The white meat was a little dry, but luckily it was served with a duo of Ajis. (Another way that Peruvian restaurants judge themselves.) the sauces definitely added to the dish and were welcome. 

Lomo Saltado - if you have never had this dish before, it is basically beef stir fry with French fries. All good things.  This was good as well.  The marinade in the steak was flavorful, it was a little small of a portion and I feel like the meat could have been more tender, but overall it was good.  The sauce when mixed with the rice was a special treat.  


Ceviche Mixto - I really liked the ceviche!  We chose the mixed version with fish, calamari, and tiger shrimp marinated ("cooked") in the citrus juice "Leche de Tigre." It even had choclo and canchita.


Truffle Mac & Cheese - what is truffle Mac & cheese doing at a Peruvian restaurant?!?!  I don't care. It was delicious. Served in an iron skillet, it was cheesy and "truffely" but not overwhelming. I'm going to be thinking about this dish in the future. 

The sangria was good too!

We had three people and shared the 4 dishes. This was probably the right amount of food for us.  

Service
It was ok. Not bad, but not terribly attentive. Our server seemed nice enough. 

Atmosphere 

The upstairs was cute. Maybe a dozen or so tables and a small bar with some bar and counter seating. They have a TV perched above the bar for games.  I hear there is a downstairs, but I didn't venture down there.
author: Kris G.

description:
A whole chicken + 2 sides and a hot plate was enough to share for 3 people. 

Chicken - very juicy and well-seasoned.

Yuca fries - crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. The aji sauce went really well with the yuca fries. 

Grilled veggies -  slightly over salty and overcooked.

Grilled octopus - tender and has a nice spicy kick!
author: Margery W.

description:
Absolutely delicious and healthy but flavorful food! I'll be back for more. We tried the half chicken and shrimp and octopus ceviche. The ceviche was so fresh! Some of the best we've ever had! I'll definitely be back... 

Service is great and we got lucky, no wait on a Sunday at 12pm.

A true hidden gem in the Mission Area of SF
author: Anastacia W.

description:
Thanks to Hazel C. for inspiring me to finish this review!

Back in March, 2016, Yuri and I went for a vacation in San Francisco.  She contacted Ann who invited a bunch of us to dinner at this restaurant.  Parking was a challenge, but we found a space on the street in the residential area.  Stephanie had caught a Lyft, Hazel and Michael used the BART, and Ann had a ride. 

So began our first adventure with the Yelpers of San Francisco. It was so appropriate for us to dine "family style" because Yelpers are our extended ohana!  Ann is such a great hostess: she suggested a good place, invited fabulous Yeeps, and led the excellent conversation! 

This place is bigger than it looks from the outside.  We sat downstairs!  It was such a cozy and exclusive feeling!  We were seated in a corner which was good since we were quite lively!

We had had unusual Peruvian dishes that I had never seen or heard of before!  Yuca Fries, Camote Fries, Ceviche Mixto, Tartara de Tuna, Lomo Saltado, and a Whole Pollo a la Brasa.  Everything was so exotic and tasty - it was overwhelming, especially after the pitcher of Sangria!  Service could be better, but it was probably because the place was packed!

Mahalo to Ann, Stephanie, Yuri, Michael, and Hazel for a wonderful dining experience!
author: Nadine C.

description: Their ceviches improved! Great service! Go during lunch to avoid crowds! The drinks are fantastic! The half chicken is to die for! The waiters answered all questions! Overall great experience and worth the price! The spicy sauce with the ceviche was actually a bit spicy, but bomb!
author: Cecilia H.

description: The chicken was so dry I couldn't even swallow it without downing water alongside it. The whole time I wished I had just bought the Costco $5 rotisserie chicken which is 20x better than what we ordered. The empanadas were alright but small for the price. The fries were good but I could get those anywhere else for cheaper. For the price, not worth. But the Mac and cheese looked pretty bomb so maybe that was better. But I wouldn't go back for it.
author: Kalani R.

description:
Great for out of town guests. Limón never fails to impress. 
Be sure to order family style so you can try a wide variety of dishes, and save room for dessert. Two others and I shared one chocolate dessert and the tiny, strong, taste was enough. 
Amazing service, wonderful food, great cocktails, reserved a table online: what more could you want? Ok, Parking.  :)
author: P. G.

description:
If you're looking for a hearty meal then Limon is the place to go. It was completely packed despite being a Tuesday evening and it took them awhile to get is seated. Reservations recommended. 

Ceviche was perfectly refreshing without being overly sour/citrusy and I loved the different types of corn kernels that accompanied the dish. The roast chicken which they are known for was juicy and tender and the beet salad was so tasty! I left the restaurant feeling full and satisfied and my out of town guests were really happy with the meal too.
author: Eunah T.

description: Pass on this, especially the chicken which is overcooked and reheated. So many better Peruvian restaurants, don't bother with this location .
author: Laura D.

description: The ceviche was excellent and the  rotisserie chicken was out of this world. The service was fantastic. This is a highly recommended restaurant
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I have been to this Limon a few times before. But after this evening, I will never return! So we chose to take a friend for her bday to this place. This was her first time to Limon.

we were a party of 6 people. our server was rude, rushed us our entire meal and never refilled our waters, or let us know when drink service would end. 

This was the WORST birthday dinner I have ever had the misfortune of witnessing!

To make things worse, they spilled the birthday girls drink (because they were rushing to literally hand everyone their drink! They forgot drinks, dropped the sweet potato fries on the bday girl and did not even comp them on the bill.

As if things couldnt get worse, they charged the 20% gratuity to our party. Our server in NO WAY earned a dollar in tip! We saw how he served other tables and LITERALLY walked away mid ordering of our food because he said we were taking too long. excuse me?! we should have walked away and left but I was trying to save face in front of my friend the bday girl.

I cannot believe we chose this place to take her for the first time and will be sure to never set foot in this place again. The service we recieved at this Limon was nothing short of DISGUSTING. Management should be ashamed of the poor training our server exhibited.


Update: while management posted to this review, my response email went unanswered still to
this day. Im not sure they really care about resolving this poor experience and simply want to save face here on yelp. what a shame.
author: Christina M.

description:
I had lunch here today with a group of friends and I was very surprised with the food/ service and drinks.
We shared a whole rotisserie chicken with yuca and fried sweet potatoes and a lomo saltado dish. everything was delicious, I ordered one of the pisco cocktails and it was delicious, our food was served quickly maybe 10 minutes waiting even tho when the restaurant was super busy, I will come back here in a future I loved it.
author: Fabricio V.

description: Best ceviche ever.....! Get the sampler trio platter. Got a whole chicken as well. It comes with two sides. The refried beans and rice, freaking amazing! Definitely need to come back to eat all the other stuff I didn't get to try
author: Peter S.

description:
Had such a good Peruvian Dinner here for my Friend's Birthday. 
The Ceviche is Delicious and the Lomo Saltado! :)
author: CharSydney M.

description: The roast chicken was very tasty but I enjoyed the paella and empanadas more.  The seafood in the paella was perfectly cooked.  The carne empanadas was loaded with well seasoned and tender beef.
author: Betty Z.

description: Peruvian food is one of my favorite types of cusines and I believe Limon Rotisserie does a really good job. Their lomo saltado is one of my favorite things to get there. It's steak with rice, tomatoes, onions, and fries in a delicious sauce. If it is your first time trying Peruvian food, the lomo saltado is a great starting dish.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Chicken! Packed with flavor and cooked perfectly. 
The ceviches were great also. The drinks were amazing- we ordered pisco sours. Overall, everything we ordered was incredible. Would come back anytime.
author: Allie M.

description: I really enjoyed the dishes we ordered ceviche mixto was fresh and delicious, grilled octopus was soft and very savory and chifa green beans were amazing with a very Chinese inspired taste. Everything was amazing and would definitely come back to try new dishes, especially the their chicken which they are known for.
author: Pau Y Monica C.

description: Pricey but good. Recommend the ceviche over the Peruvian chicken. Tres leches hit the spot.
author: Nicolas M.

description:
If you're craving rotisserie chicken, Limon offers that and much more.

We came on a rainy Monday night and the place was packed. Luckily we made reservations and were seated promptly. Unfortunately, we came the day they were closing early for a company party. As such, some of the items weren't available at the time of order. However, the service was excellent, and even though they closed early, we never felt rushed to finish. 

I ordered the half chicken with tacu tacu and camote frito. When the food came out, some of our orders got a little mixed up, with different/missing sides. They were quick to amend the issue and brought us extra sides to share so everyone got to try more than they ordered, which was a huge plus. My chicken was delicious, but I only had dark/thigh meat because they ran out of white/breast. All of the sides I tried, tacu tacu, sweet potato fries and yuca fries, were delicious as well, especially with the provided aji sauces. The whole backside of the menu was dedicated to drinks: beers, wines, and cocktails. I had a beer and tried the pisco sour, but there was nothing special about it. It was good, but it wasn't memorable.

At the end of the day, Limon's chicken is very good. But is half a chicken here equivalent to 4 whole Costco rotisserie chickens? That's for you to decide. I will definitely come back to try their other dishes and hopefully they'll have chicken breast next time, but it may be awhile before I crave such expensive chicken again.
author: Philip W.

description: Delicious! A tad on the pricey side for the amount of food they serve. Service was very attentive when we initially arrived at 11AM and it quickly got busy soon after (seems like they just opened at 11 on a Sunday). It was very difficult to get our check and then get our card back after paying because they were so busy. That was the only negative experience during our visit but otherwise, everything was great!
author: Kat T.

description: I have to say they make the best Peruvian rotisserie chicken of all places I've tried in sf. But the portion size is getting smaller and smaller which is disappointing.
author: Xiu L.

description: Top 1 on my SF reataurant list. I regret that I didn't come here earlier. The food is so delicious. The chicken / chimichurri combo is just 5/5. The waitress did also a great job keeping us and our kids entertained.
author: Almgren P.

description:
I thought this place would be better. Maybe it's because I came on Valentine's day? I felt really rush with the waiter as he didn't give us much time to figure out what we wanted to eat. We ordered the paella, quarter chicken (dark) with yuca fries & veggies, ceviche, & 2 glasses of sangria.

Paella was a disappointment, it was kinda watery tasting. I hate to compare it this way, but to Trader Joe's frozen paella.

Quarter chicken was good, but for the price you pay for it, just okay. I feel like Costco isn't too far off.

Yuca fries - it's just like a potato. eh. The aioli sauce was good though.

Grilled veggies - yum. Worth it.

Ceviche - Delicious. It was with the passionfruit sauce and yummy yummy. Would order again.

Sangria - Hard tie with the ceviche. It was super good. 

I give this place 3 stars because of the service. I didn't like being rushed and also he kept continuously pushing the specials on me. Like, I didn't know the prices of the special so stop, also I said I don't eat dairy and you're still pushing the gnocchi that had cheese that could not be removed. Please, stop. 

I think if we came on a normal night it would have been fine. I do really like that they took reservations. Definite plus for that. Would I come back? Yes, but probably would, but not my first choice.
author: Julie L.

description:
Everything that we ordered on this night was superb.  This is a Peruvian place that does the taste, quality, and service very well.  

We were welcomed very nicely and our waiter, Angel, was good about suggesting certain things to try.  We loved the ceviche, their famous chicken, the carne empanadas were so good that we had to order it twice, and the pork dish was really tasty.  I can't remember what it's called, but pretty popular and common at Peruvian places.  Labo Salto or something like that?

Anyways, we also had a pitcher of sangria and we enjoyed the very intimate atmosphere all evening long.  Servers were professional and kind, and it feels very family-run here.

I was very impressed with the taste of the food and this was one of my favorite meals during my weekend in SF.  Great place to check out with a small group of friends or for a date.

I highly recommend Limon!
author: Matt K.

description:
I'm a planner at heart but it's good to be spontaneous sometimes! Our friend Ann S invited us at 5 pm on a Monday afternoon to meet here at Limon Rotisserie and have dinner with visiting Yelpers Yuri and Nadine, and I'm like, why not? We've never been to Limon and though I was in the middle of making a Coconut Cream Pie in observance of Pi Day, I'm always up for having dinner in the city with fun company! 

I'm so glad we joined our friends that evening 'cause I loved Limón Rotisserie! I can see why  this place was packed even on a Monday night. Their food is fantastic! We ordered a bunch of dishes and shared them all family-style. Here's a rundown of what we ordered:

Tartara de Tuna -- so light and perfect. Dressing is just right.

Ceviche Mixto -- very refreshing, not too acidic and the seafood was nice and tender.

Yuca fries -- this was just okay. I'm not a big fan of yuca fries as they are too stringy for me, so I won't get this next time as a side to the chicken.

Camote fries -- we got this as a side to our chicken order, and they were fine if you love sweet potato fries.  

Whole Pollo a la Brasa -- very good. This rotisserie chicken is definitely a lot tastier than the  grocery store variety.  Loved the marinade and in general it was very moist.  The dark meat sections were juicy, the breast a little dry and the wings a bit overcooked.  It comes with two sauces and they were very good with the chicken.  

Lomo Saltado -- marinated beef tenderloin with onions and fries. This was my favorite out of all the dishes.  The beef was tender and the sauce was really tasty.  Came with rice on the side.  I would definitely order this again next time. 

We also ordered a pitcher of sangria ($30) and that was enough for 6 of us.  We didn't try dessert as we were simply too full after all that food.  Service was a little slow.  We had to ask for the Sangria as it was taking a long time to get to our table.  The food also took longer than usual.  I hope wait time for food and drinks is better next time.
author: Hazel C.

description:
Service was quick and attentive.

Ambience is casual and fun. I love the Latin music playing.

The food was delicious. I had the quarter chicken (dark) which was very flavorful, moist, and tender. The tacu-tacu and green beans I got as sides also had great flavor, especially when the green beans were dipped in the sauce for the chicken.

I give my full recommendation and would absolutely come back to this place.
author: Kendra T.

description: Yummy paella, ceviche and chicken.  Plenty of food!  We had ceviche first and I was already full!  Definitely will come back!
author: R C.

description: Great service, great food! Went in on a Friday night and got seated within 3 minutes. I definitely recommend making reservations as this location is quite small.
author: cristina c.

description: Let's talk about the service here. I understand you all are busy but to blatantly ignore a customer is 100% unacceptable. The hostesses are so unbelievably rude and actually just don't care when providing quality customer service. This really turns me off and makes me not want to return to this location.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Thursday night after driving up from LA without a reservation and we were able to get a table without a wait. Our waitress was very sweet and prompt with our waters and drink orders. We decided to order the ceviche as an appetizer and the half chicken dinner for our main course. 

The ceviche was so delicious, the seasoning they use is quite poignant, very lime-y and sour. I've been to Peru and had ceviche there and this was the first time I thought it compared to the real thing. I liked that they garnished it with the corn and corn nuts. I definitely recommend. 

The half chicken dinner was also very good. Chicken is moist and tender and flavorful! The sauces they come with are also great, we also got the chimichurri for an extra $1. 

Service was great and ambiance was casual but nice. I would definitely recommend!
author: Emily T.

description: Food is good, the steak better than the chicken, if you ask me. The sauce reminded me of adobo sauce. I went around 6:00pm on a weekday and available parking was scarce. I recommend Lyft or bike/walk, if you're close. Lots of families there with children, which work well with the loud atmosphere.  The bottom floor has an old SF home smell, like basement, so try to get a seat upstairs (the entry floor). Overall, a great place to eat.
author: Rochelle B.

description:
For our team holiday party, about 20 of us went to Limon. They have a fairly spacious downstairs area that easily accommodated all of us

We all had to agree on one pre fixe menu and after some debate, the most expensive option with sangria seemed like the best deal 

Across the board, food was delicious and came out in a timely manner. While most things are not vegetarian-friendly during the main entrees section you can let them know and they will bring out a mushroom dish 

Overall Thoughts

For big parties in need of space, food, and a fair price point Limon satisfies all of the above
author: Eddie W.

description:
What a disaster. Arrived 15 minutes ahead of a 5:45 pm reservation, so they sit us right next to a drafty door. Requested a different table, and they put us in an almost deserted basement. Three waiters come and go, take our orders without communicating with each other. Seafood ceviche was really OK, but things went downhill rapidly. Hot sauce requested when we ordered the cerviche did not arrive until we were almost done with the chicken, (Repeated requests to each of our waiters.) Chicken was luke warm, as if it had been brought over from another restaurant and then microwaved briefly. Empanadas ordered, never arrived until we caught the eye of some head waiter and told him our problems. They arrived barely warmed up, and not filled with anything recognizable as chicken..

We then overheard that the table next to us was told they were just about out of chicken. This is 7 pm! At a restaurant that specializes in chicken! Table of 20! Trying to find another venue on a Friday night. In the Holiday season. Lots of luck. Got out of there and told the hostess that they better resolve these problems soon.  

Two stars instead of one for the ceviche, and knowing that this restaurant can do a lot better.
author: Cliff L.

description:
Every time we come here, we are always leaving very, very happy.
Delicious, fresh food. Never had we had a fishy seafood plate. 
The ceviche mixto is sooo good! Fresh shrimp, fresh fish, thinly sliced red onion, and some garbanzo beans (I think). 
The chicken is always moist and delicious! Especially when dipped in the aioli sauces they provide. 
Yucca fries are fresh and crisp, never soggy. 
The paella is buttery deliciousness.. But missing the crispy rice that I tend to like from the bottom of the pan. 
The roasted veges are roasted to perfection- a heavenly mix of yellow squash, zucchini, and green beans. 
The pitcher of sangria never disappoints either, for 35$, a table of three will get a good 3 cups out of it!! 
The ambiance is bustling with people, and loud Latin music.. Very fun if you're dining out with a group of friends!
author: Maria C.

description:
Heard great things, so I stopped in for dinner. Overall staff was great and the bartender very friendly. He even made me custom drinks based on my flavor likes. 
In terms of food, I started with the fish ceviche. It was ok, the flavor was not fully there, not enough jugo and could have used a little bit more onion, choclo and spice but not terrible. I know this might not be there strongest dish as they are more of a rotisserie place instead of a seafood place. My advice if you like good ceviche, is to skip it and focus on their stronger dishes.

Second dish was the lomo saltado. Good serving size with a good steak to fries to veggies ratio. Taste was great and overall met expectations of a good lomo saltado. So recommend this dish.
author: Jessy V.

description:
Early dinner with the family with a 3 yr old was family friendly.  They have high chairs but tables are tight and it's loud to mask the noise of a screaming toddler.
    Started with the tuna tartare was hardy size for 2 vs French small style of a couple tablespoons.  My wife enjoyed the quinoa salad was large portion, split the seafood paella was so flavorful(fish, mussels, clams, scallops and shrimp, but not Spanish style with burnt bottom. The chicken was fall off the bone perfect with sweet potato fries and mildly spicy sautéed green beans was kid friendly. Would go again as the service for the early before 5pm dinner was attentive and smooth.  Would go again and recommend for small families, large parties maybe tight squeeze if after 6pm.
author: David K.

description: Fantastic service I had a few weeks ago at the downstairs bar. Hats off to Das and Adam who were the absolute best! I know a few places that can learn from their wonderful service. Good times.
author: This Is M E.

description: Been here plenty, both for take out and eat in. Place is great, staff there from the host, waiters/waitresses, cooks to the bartenders make u feel right at home. We went for Mother's Day lunch and they gracefully had flowers for all the moms... the food: I always do the chicken with the yuca and the tacu tacu. I used to do the veggies but they didn't have them this time. The ceviche is awesome and all of them will blow your socks off. Luis is a bomb bartender so make sure to grab a specialty drink or two. I will keep coming back here and u should def check it out.
author: Roberto M.

description: Definitely a distinctive taste, but almost a little too powerful in the flavor profile. Chicken was good though. Got the polenta fries and wasn't blown away. (Yeah, THAT'S RIGHT, I expect polenta fries to blow me away.) Overall, the meal was a little "too heavy" and I ended up feeling kinda crummy afterward. Lol. Oh well.
author: Peter G.

description:
Holy crap, Pio Pio, you're no longer my favorite Peruvian rotisserie chicken shop. 

The boyfriend has not stopped raving about this place for the past 6 months and I finally came around to trying it. I was still holding out that Pio Pio in NYC had the best rotisserie chicken. This location is popular! At first, I thought they only had one dining area, but surprise! Downstairs had plenty of tables and a bar. Winnn. And thank you, Yelp reservations. Love it.

Ordered:
- Half Chicken $16.95: slow-roasted with aji sauces, sweet potato fries and tacu tacu. Honestly, I chose the tacu tacu because of the funny name, but you know, sometimes food with funny names are actually freakin' delicious. Yes to sauteed rice and beans. Chicken was (mostly) moist and juicy, but the skin was so good. All the flavors were on the skin and it had that perfectly roasted crunch when you bite into it.
- Lomo Saltado $16.95: beef tenderloin sauteed with onions, tomatoes, fries, soy sauce, and rice. Almost Asian-sounding (and Asian-tasting) but also freakin' delicious. Omggg so good. The beef was so tender and the flavors meshed together so well. Tip: eat the rice separately at first, BUT THEN, mix it all together and leave the rice to soak up the juices/oil a bit. Mmmmm so good.

Friendly service as well, didn't have to be kept waiting. When we wanted to change reservation times, they were open to that as well. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF now. Can't wait to come back (all the time)!
author: Lucy Z.

description: Very nice place, decent tasty food. Price was decent, small portions though. My husband and I tried Peruvian food for the first time. Only bad thing was that all tables were very close to each other, so no privacy and kind of loud because everyone is talking in small space. Overall I recommend this place for someone who wants to try something new.
author: Laila A.

description:
If you want Amazing food.. fresh.. and authentic Peruvian food. This is your place.. absolutely delicious!! I will come.back over and over
. Spoke to the owner and he is Peruvian amd yes i asked for the Chicken soup andnots coming soon.. love this place!!! Thank you fpr everything!
author: Zulema G.

description:
The food is absolutely amazing and the prices are super reasonable! You really can't go wrong with anything you order. The atmosphere is great for an intimate date or large group. I thought the service was just okay though. We had to ask a couple times for water and utensils and the server seemed a little impatient at times.

They are known for their rotisserie chicken here which was tender and perfectly seasoned (half order $18). It also comes with delicious sauces. I highly recommend it! The red snapper ceviche ($15) was fresh and tasty. I loved the jalea ($14) which was crispy seafood with tartar sauce and the polli papas ($12) which were fries topped with savory chicken, sauce, and cheese. The queso empanadas ($9) were warm and cheesy. My favorite dish was the carne a la parilla ($19). The skirt steak had a wonderful marinade served with soft mashed potatoes. I would definitely order this again! Lastly the sangria was a hit with the entire group.
author: Linda X.

description: 'Limón Rotisserie' you were the only good thing from our trip! Thank you for making our last day worth coming out of our sucky ass hotel. Definitely coming back when we visit again!!
author: Diane M.

description: Been here on two occasions now, and blown away both times. They have little tapas that are the size of appetizers so this is definitely a family style type of place. They're proportioned well so that you can get a little taste of everything in every bite. Their drinks are also amazing. They're strong with lots of flavor, very well balanced. If you have a large party definitely go with sangria, if you want to go a little more exotic then you've gotta order your own and you won't be sorry. The empanadas were so creamy, those were gone fast! The ceviche was so fresh! So refreshing on a nice warm day. If you want to impress someones taste buds, this is the place.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Been here through the years and they're fairly consistent. I always gets the ceviche mixto but wish they'd cut the fish into small pieces. The chicken is a popular dish but the skin comes out too overly seasoned to the point where I have to chug a glass of water after. Veggies are veggies so can't complain. 

Service is good. They have upstairs and downstairs seating. If possible, take the upstairs as it's airier and better for conversation with the reduced noise level. The downstairs is super loud...like a club so you end up having a hard time listening, let alone speaking.
author: Julie L.

description: This place is INCREDIBLE - I'm still emotional over it. I've gone to so many Peruvian restaurants state side, paying anything between $11-40 for a classic entrée, and this place is hands down the best. They have a very full, classic menu. I got to share so much of what I love about Peru with my friend. For entrees, we both got lomo saltado. They have options for aji which was awesome. For drinks we get a pisco sour, maracuya sour and chicha morada. The prices were on point. Everything was perfect. Everything was better than you could dream.
author: Morgan G.

description: We love this restaurant. The food is amazing service is great and the drinks will rock your world
author: Jay G.

description:
Consistently seated, served, and satisfied in less than an hour and a half.

The service was quite friendly and snappy but not overbearing. Our group is seated promptly and our food usually gets to our table within half an hour of being seated.

The food quality is always excellent and comparable to much higher end restaurants while maintaining a more casual feel. I especially love the tin trays the chicken is served in; they provide a nice rustic touch. The standout dishes are the rotisserie chicken (somewhat obvious) and the tacu tacu which is a Peruvian bean and rice dish. Additionally, the side sauces cut the richness of food quite well and nicely round out the taste.

One of my favorite upscale casual restaurants in all of SF! I highly recommend Limon Rotisserie for chicken lovers.
author: Anish B.

description:
My girlfriend insisted on coming to Limón while I was visiting her. I'm not a fan of foreign food because I'm a very picky eater and don't like to be a hassle. 
The food was amazing!! I didn't have to make one adjustment to my order. We got:
The half chicken with Yuccca Fries and Green beans, ceviche, and the Lomo Saltado. Everything was amazing. I can't wait to go back.
author: Frankie A.

description:
My taste buds are still feeling awesome from my meal at this place two nights ago. No seriously this place is awesome. By far the best Peruvian cuisine I have ever had. 

So this is setup more as tapas style; which is great for a romantic dinner. We tried the half chicken with two sides, steak empanadas, and the slow roasted brisket. There was not one bad part of this meal. Everything was absolutely delicious. If I had to pick the brisket was my favorite. With the carrots potatoes and gravy it was just delightful. If you order the chicken I recommend to get atleast the half as the portions are not huge, especially if you are sharing.

For drinks tried the Sangrias and they were nicely prepared and just enough strong. Service and presentation here was also a five star rating.

If I had to make a complaint it would just be that the basement area felt a bit warm. That is literally all that's wrong in my opinion. If I ever come to SF again I will be definitely returning.
author: Ahmed A.

description:
Today was my 23rd birthday. My sister, who flew from Washington D.C. on a early flight, came to celebrate with me and she also has her birthday next Monday. Per my request, we came to Limon Rotisserie with my boyfriend to eat the food that everyone's been raving about.

I'm giving the place a one star because of my extreme disappointment in the service we received. First thing I notice: I made the extra effort to make a reservation early in advance for a good table and we are seated downstairs with the big loud family gatherings and children. In my yelp reservation, I even wrote that it was for a birthday celebration. Second thing I notice: The server is ridiculously slow and we aren't taken care of. Getting our water took 10 minutes.
