Our food came before our sangria drinks. The table next to us, who got into the restaurant 20 minutes after us, gets all of their food before we do. My sister was so angry that she told the waiter and I've never seen her react that strongly to anything. 

Food service is an art. You don't think that we notice these things, but we do. There is sort of a noticeable bias when other people are taken care of first and where certain people are seated.

We came to celebrate our birthdays and to enjoy our company over food. Your restaurant service really disappointed me. I won't be going back to this Limon Rotisserie anymore.
author: Emily F.

description:
the food : delicious. although not that many options for vegetarians. I got a dish with mushroom and it was mediocre but I tried from my friends dishes and they were all really good. besides their cheese empanadas was bomb.
BUT
our experience was not perfect there because of the bad customer service. I made a phone reservation and when we showed up I encountered a rude hostess who just kept shaking her head and telling me my name is not there. no apology or acknowledgment of my frustration. we didnt have to wait that long (25mins) but the behavior of the hostess made us all bitter. we asked multiple times can you tell us why despite making reservation our name is not there and even had to show on our phone that we have indeed called. she kept telling us she's busy and she will find out but she never did. we liked the food but we will not got back and we suggest other people also dont, while food is important, feeling respected and mannerism are also very important. 
P.S. I also had a punch and it was mediocre :)
author: Helia S.

description:
Limon, with its attractive full bar and exposed kitchen, was looking pretty full. So they seated us downstairs, where the atmosphere wasn't quite as lively, but we could spread out a bit more.

Pollo a La Brasa (grilled chicken), comes w 2 sides & aji sauces
$24.95 whole chicken - 8 pieces
I thought the chicken was dry. Normally I would forgive that, because chicken breast dries out easily, but since rotisserie chicken is what Limon does, then I'm not quite as forgiving. The flavor was okay, but the seasoning didn't permeate through the meat that well. So that makes the aji (pepper) sauces quite necessary. Perhaps it was succulent and tender to begin with, but maybe the juices ran out after they cut it.

$4.95 Yuca fries - bland
$4.95 Tacu Tacu (rice & beans) - good amount of flavorful carbs

$14.95 Ceviche Mixto - fish, calamari, tiger shrimp:
It tasted refreshing & tart with meaty pieces of fish, squid, & shrimp with crunchy corn. Apparently the marinade is leche de tigre, "milk of the tiger," or citrus marinade in Peruvian terms. It was plated with some sweet corn & crunchy corn that resembled corn nuts. It also included sweet potatoes, and topped with slivers of pickled red onion.

$16.95 Lomo Saltado - beef tenderloin stir fry w/ onions, tomatoes, fries, soy sauce, w/ rice:
Pretty good, when is beef stir fry over rice ever bad? The tenderloin was nice and juicy.

I would come back to be proven wrong about the chicken (& also to try the cocktails). I'd like to be reassured that they do chicken right, and maybe my experience was a fluke. But $24.95 is a little more than I would like to pay for chicken. Even for a whole one, 8 pieces, that's about $3 a piece of chicken. My frugal and geek cards are both showing.
author: Joy W.

description: This location is never as busy and you can usually get a reservation. Get the Ceviche, it's absolutely amazing. Great food all around. I love bringing out of town guests here, they're always blown away by the flavors and food.
author: Janice T.

description: I have very limited understanding of what Peruvian cuisine tastes like, but this place is pretty great with chicken and seafood. Four plates (with a specialty item on the larger side) were enough for three people. I loved the paella here. It had lots of seafood but wasn't overly seasoned. Chicken empanadas and tuna tartare also didn't disappoint us! The dip for empanadas was slightly sour and not too heavy. Service was average
author: Alex L.

description:
Delicious!  We don't have the opportunity to sample Peruvian cuisine too frequently so this was a pleasant experience for us. We met friends here on Sunday evening during Halloween weekend - great seats by the window for four adults and a baby (didn't get to use the high chair as much but it's the small black high chairs by Koala that we prefer). Restaurant was pretty busy and our server was relatively attentive. 

The smells as we waited for our food to come were incredible and noteworthy - this particular location has the tables quite cosy and close, and the ambience is lively but quite loud.  My husband ordered a quarter dark chicken with the green beans and yuca fries (the meal came with the aji sauce). I had the Lomo Saltado and our friends ordered half a chicken and Seco de Costillas so we could try a little of everything.  Everything was wonderfully flavored and there was a ton of food.  The fries and the meat in my lomo saltado were the standout elements of the dish.  I kept stealing my husband's green beans (to be fair he also helped himself to my lomo so I feel it was even) and even my little one kept asking for more rice, green beans, lomo meat, and chicken.  Had we not been there to celebrate a wondrous occasion that roused a boisterous conversation, everyone would have been happy to fully concentrate on eating the wonderful meal and savoring the flavors.  

As it was an extremely happy occasion for our party, the one negative I had from this experience was the change in attentiveness and tone as our waiter (and it felt like other patrons) started checking in on us a little too frequently.  I felt like we were not being allowed to enjoy our food and indulge in conversation with great company.  I did not see a huge line (though there were definitely a lot of people in and out) so I could not see the reasoning as to why we needed to be pushed out.  My little one was getting fussy towards the end (which we knew and were trying to finish up to leave) but the amount of side glances and "check ins" by the waiter towards the end really made me uncomfortable.  I suppose I come from a place where slower meals are taken in stride when you have good food and good company.  Perhaps we were not in like company at that time because it felt like we were being encouraged to leave.  In either case, everything else was wonderful up until the very end of the meal.  I would go again without question but I would feel like I needed to watch our time lest we "over stay" our welcome.  Doesn't seem right to me as a paying customer but maybe it's because I am from out of town and just excited to hang out with great friends for a little longer before we part.
author: Julie W.

description: I've dined here about 10 times and am never disappointed with their food. My particular favorites are the chicken empanadas (crispy and savory), truffle mac & cheese (you just have to try it - it's not overly cheesy and the truffle oil is sublime) and the tacu tacu (a perfect blend of rice and beans). They have a good cocktail selection. My only concern is the noise level on certain days - it can be hard to have a conversation. Other than that this is a great go to restaurant with excellent food.
author: Anna C.

description: Great food; Amazing, knowledgeable waiter​!  My friends had them sing Happy Birthday to me, pretty cool that they were willing to do that!
author: Nick L.

description: I love Limon! Best Peruvian restaurant around. The food is absolutely delicious! I order the chicken (pollo de chicharon) with the three dipping sauces, and of course a few of the wonderful sides, Mac and cheese, yuca fries, rice. I also recommend the empanadas but FYI, you only get two of those, which are quite small for the price but very tasty. If you love sangria, order the pitcher!
author: Dee G.

description:
Terrifying environment. 
Loud (rock concert volume) gangster music. Poor service. Our waiter reeked of weed. Do yourself a favor, eat a putomadre from a local basura. But seriously, this was bad. Don't take family here. Full of gangster thugs.
author: Omid Z.

description: The best chicken in san fransisco it comes with the lemon sauce is amazing test nice place and good service
author: Mostafa O.

description:
The empanadas are TERRIBLY OVERPRICED.  The chicken itself is consistently bomb, and the sides are always good. Drinks are decently priced, but I just cannot get over those dry ass empanadas. Those shits were so dry they were dusty. Man, what a shame. They're also tiny. Like, close your fingers and thumb around them tiny. Not at all worth how much they are.  $6, I believe. Or 2/$9, maybe? Either way, they should be $2 or 2/$5.  Yep, I said it.  

The staff is always nice here, and I've been to two locations. I appreciate that! Wish I knew the guy's name, but I can't remember. I believe we were in the mission, and he was tall, bald, and handsome :)
author: D W.

description: Very, very loud, echo prone atmosphere that makes it difficult to talk. However, the empanadas are delicious, as is the tres leches cake. I am on the fence about this place because I had a terrible time the first time we went, but my friends convinced me to go again last night and if you can look past the really loud, unpleasant room, the food is actually really good.
author: Ryan E.

description: I don't know how Limon could get anything less than 5 stars! 1/2 a chicken, green beans and rice&beans, one of the best meals I've had in a loooong time! We'll be back before our trip is over.
author: Erica E.

description: My company catered from Limòn for work and their food was good, so I decided To take a friend to their restaurant. Be warned - make reservations! If not you most likely will need to wait or sit at the bar. I'd recommend you get a pitcher of their house margarita if you're sharing with two people, it ended up being two drinks each. I ordered their half roasted chicken with veggies and their chicken is moist and. Luther watering. My friend ordered their mushrooms and they were amazing as well! Note, parking is non existent in this area, it took me 15+ mins to find parking.
author: Sandeep C.

description: One of my favorite restaurants to go to when I feel like having some rotisserie chicken. They have changed the menu a little bit but I still stuck to what I came for.. My chicken. Yummy.
author: S C.

description: For the lunch, pretty good choice. l was really impressed by the atmosphere. Friendly waiters made me confortable with their nice chat.
author: Amy A.

description: Pico Sour was yummy. The Beef tongue was to die for. It was perfectly cooked and leaves me wanting to go back just for those two items alone. The place has some wonderful Peruvian flavors, I will be back!
author: L T.

description: ...took friends...everyone very pleased...limon does it again...highly recommended from me...waitperson illa (blond with ponytail) was superb...
author: Bob L.

description: Such a great spot!  Went in on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. Service is outstanding and so is food. Had the veggie empanadas, sweet potato fries and Lomo Saltado. It was a skosh too salty for me but still tasty. Ordered the pineapple and passion fruit lemonade and an Inca Cola which is similar to the taste of a cream soda.
author: Tracy M.

description: Absolutely love this restaurant.  One of my favorite places in the city.  The food is amazingly tasty, high quality, absolutely delicious and satisfying.  Everything I've ever had on the menu is a winner. Reservations highly recommended.  It's not a big place and give yourself time to find parking in the neighborhood.  We always get the roasted chicken.  The ceviche is amazing.  We got the beans and rice which is the best beans and rice I've ever had anywhere.  The mixed toasted vegetable dish is delicious too.  Got the the special on the menu that night which was a rib eye steak with chimichuri.  Perfectly prepared.
author: Malia K.

description: There is nothing wrong I can say about this place. The food was delicious and unquie in chef ingredients. Simple presentation that allowed food to speak for itself. The service was excellent, not overly  engaged but perfectly tentative. Great location close to theaters and fun bats. Good first casual first date spot.
author: Lesley T.

description: Wow, what an experience. Went here with a party of 4 for a friend's birthday and the experience was great from start to finish. We were seated quickly, and the wait staff was super friendly. I've been to the one on Valencia and this restaurant has more of the homey vibe that I associate with San Francisco. The waitress gave us a great recommendation and drinks were delicious. I didn't think my experience at the Valencia location could be topped, but thanks for proving me wrong!
author: Will K.

description:
This was the best meal I had while in San Francisco. Also proof of why the group should leave the restaurant choices to me. We all really enjoyed the lively atmosphere and the small plates we shared for dinner. Between four of us we shared five items and found it to be a good amount of food since we had dessert plans after dinner. The individual plates are smaller portions, but they are very satisfying foods so you don't need much to be happy.

We had three of the meat hot plates including skirt steak. We were all impressed with the flavors and preparation of the meats. The sauces served along side were all really good too. We also enjoyed fries and the truffle macaroni and cheese. These didn't disappoint either. We spent the whole meal remarking on how much we loved all of the flavors and sauces.
author: Lauren C.

description: Great service! Got seated right away. Ordered. Got my tea in no time. Staff is courteous and welcoming. Keep up with the great job!
author: Beatriz M.

description:
I like coming to this Limon Rotisserie than the one on Valencia because this one is a lot larger. Their downstairs is AWESOME, and I really like getting seated there. 

I always get the chicken and side dishes (best bang for your buck), and depending on size of group a few of their smaller plates. 

+ chicken: really good, very well done. flavor and zest is totally there! and the sauces that they come with YUMMMMMMmm
+ sides: yuca fries are my favorite! so big and not like the boring traditional fries. also beans and rice are SOOOO YUMMMY
+ truffle mac and cheese: really good, they put it in a little skillet
+ ceviche (super good!!!!) i like the shrimp and ahi poke 
+ lomito saltado: (sirloin strips w fried and grilled veggies I LOVE!!!!!)

NOT WORTH IT: 
+ empanadas: for $8 you only get two and they aren't even that good. 

Overall, this place is great for groups, they take reservations, and the food is always on point. Giving this place a four, because while it is amazing, I'm not mind blown.
author: Cathy Y.

description: Really good food. The rotisserie chicken, green beans, and chicken empanadas where all delicious.
author: David R.

description:
I assume people who review limon base their food on just Hispanic restaurants in SF 

Limon was lacking a lot of the flavor Peruvian food tends to have, which I have usually had in miami and even in Peru itself.

The service was good but the food I wouldn't go back
author: Laura G.

description:
Food - 4.3 stars! 
Yummy! Especially lomito saltados, beef tougue, ceviche mixte. 

Takeout - 2 stars. 
Often gets our order wrong. The last time, they totally forget to put it into the system. We got there, and after some confusion, they realized they forgot and we had to wait another 35 minutes while they put the order in and cooked everything. They did give us free fruit juice as an apology.
author: Hua W.

description:
I've been here 3 times this month since first trying Peruvian food here! I always get the Ceviche trio as an appetizer, and either the Lomo Saltado or Carne de Parilla as entrees because I'm a big fan of meat n potatoes and these dishes have a healthy helping of both! The seafood paella is decent. Truffle mac and cheese is also very good, I love the note of truffle blended into every creamy cheesy bite. They have like one fish entree which is some type of fried fish. I don't think that was great.

Overall the vibe here is good for a night out. Lots of shareable menu items and you're guaranteed to be having a good time after your 2nd or 3rd Pisco Sour (a delicious Peruvian specialty cocktail made with egg whites, pisco and lemon juice).
author: Michelle N.

description:
Each time I have been here the food has been on the mark. This time we shared the ceviche, ahi tuna, beet salad, lomo saltido, and roasted chicken.  All were good with the ahi tuna appetizer the best. It tasted like poke.

The roasted chicken was cooked to perfection. The skin was brown and crispy and the meat juicy and tender.   My only complaint was that I had to share this dish with my other table mates.

For dessert we shared the chocolate tart, bread pudding, and tres leche cake dessert. Out of the 3, the bread pudding stood out. It was tender and sweet, as a pudding should be.

Great job Limon Rotisserie again.
author: Marck N.

description: Amazing. Great great food. The chicken is extremely tender and flavorful. The other dishes are equally as delicious. Service is efficient and of great quality. The only drawback is the noise level. It is extremely loud (perhaps due to the large amount of people). You have to yell across the table in order to be understood. This being said I recommend making a reservation as the space is obviously packed at peek time.
author: Clementine R.

description:
Limon is a great place to go for groups in a trendy, fun, family style/sharing atmosphere. The restaurant is really cute with a whole basement for additional seating and a bar.

FOOD
- Pollo a la brasa- Limon's most famous dish of rotisserie chicken. Juicy, marinated chicken that is perfect with the paired sauces and sides. Half chicken ($16.95) can be shared with 2 people, whole chicken ($24.95) for 4. The tacu tacu (sauteed rice and beans), yuca fries, and vegetales salteados (sauteed veggeis) are all delicious.
- Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron (fish and shrimp $14.95)- delicious, really nice citrus marinade with the seafood.
- Truffle mac and cheese ($8.95)- can't go wrong with creamy mac and cheese
- Empanadas ($8.95)- large empanadas with a lot of filling. The crust is a nice balance of crispy outside and chewy inside. I prefer the carne with beef, eggs, olives, and raisins over the queso.

DRINKS
If you love sours and refreshing mule-type/Pimm's Cup drinks, then you'll love the drinks here. My favorite is the lychee chilcano ($12) with pisco, ginger ale, bitters, and syrup. The flavors are infused into the pisco so you can actually see it sitting at the top of the counters if you're eating in the basement.

The restaurant isn't that big, so make sure to book a reservation. There are lots of large groups that come here. The service is really good here. My second chilcano was way watered down compared to the first, and the server immediately got me a new one.
author: Alice T.

description: Phenomenal Peruvian chicken. The sauces are where it's at for sure. 100% recommend. Nice folk there too.
author: Zachary H.

description: Very poor service.  The server was aggressive at the end of dinner wondering why the tip was so poor.
author: Kieran P.

description: Terrible service, unfriendly people. I just had a drink there and decided to leave right after which I hardly ever do. They are just plainly unfriendly, have too many tables cramped into the space so it feels claustrophobic and if you bring anything but yourself (we had helmets) forget about a place to put it. Don't ask - they'll make it very clear that you're a nuisance. There are several other great Peruvian places nearby, Lolinda in mission, Alma Cocina on 24th, go there instead: great food and friendliness galore.
author: Silly H.

description:
Limon is a wonderful place to catch up with friends over a delicious dinner. We came here on a Friday night just before the dinner rush hit. We had a reservation and were promptly seated downstairs. 

I ordered the Arroz con Mariscos ($17.95) and a whole chicken ($23.95) with trio sauces and yuca fries and camote frito (sweet potato fries) on the side. The Arroz con Mariscos is delicious and I highly recommend it. The portion is small and barely enough to make you feel full. The chicken is very tender and tasty. The chicken and the sides were shared between two people and it was more than enough. 

The waiters were very quick to clear the table. I was in the middle of eating and the staff started busing the table and asking if we wanted boxes. I felt incredibly rushed to finish my meal.
author: Katie C.

description: The service was great but the restaurant is quite small so the tables are almost stuck to one another, the food was too salty :(, we ordered the Lomo Saltado and the french fries were damped on the salty sauce from the meat so it wasn't delicious as expected (we had tried their food truck before). The drinks are really good! We were celebrating our anniversary but it is not a great place for that kind of celebration...
author: Natalia T.

description: This place is awesome.  Dont know why it's not higher rated, especially given it's in Sunnyvale.  Get the octopus or the dish in the butter sauce (everything we had was delicious though).
author: Greg M.

description:
Came here on a Saturday for lunch and was seated right away.. and we found parking right across the street!  Score.

Being hearing a lot of good things about the chicken here so I have to give it a try since I am in the city.

Ordered the Truffle Mac n Cheese and half chicken which came with 2 sides.  We choose yuka fries and taku taku (sauteed rice and beans).

The chicken came out very tender, juicy, and flavorful.  I have to say that it is pretty yummy.

The sides were okay.  There was nothing special about the taku taku.  The yuka fries were a little more special because it is not served everywhere.

The truffled mac n cheese was not bad.  Didn't taste much of truffle in there tho.  It was pretty good, but not the best.

The whole time we were there, I have to constantly ask to get my water cup refilled.  

Overall, the chicken was the best part of the meal and following closely by the mac n cheese. I didn't really care for the rest.
author: Ashley L.

description: One of my top places for Peruvian food in SF! I love ordering the ceviche mixto that literally melts in your mouth with the fish incredibly tender the lomo saltado is tasty as well, and the pollo a la brasa doesn't fall behind. For dessert I ordered the pudding that came with ice cream, which was on point. All I can say is that if you like Peruvian food this is the place to go:)
author: Cynthia A.

description: Came here a few days ago for a drink and a ceviche with a couple of friends. We sat at the upstairs bar and received a warm welcome from Luis, (he was the bartender on the night we came in) We received  above excellent service from Luis, he was extremely knowledgeable about the different drink choices available and made recommendations to us, he was very professional, energetic and added a great vibe to our visit. We will definitely be in again to see him ! It was a great experience, he was very attentive to our needs and drink questions, he was happy to help, the drinks were exactly what he describe and I've never experienced such fresh flavors. My 5 stars go to Luis and his skills behind the bar.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
I'm unsure how I feel about this place. I've been here twice, both with big groups, and they do have a lot seating to accomodate big groups. If you have 15 or more people, you have to do 1 of the 3 pre-fixed menus, and everyone has to agree on the same one.

Last time I was here, we did #2 pre-fixed menu. Overall, the food was pretty good. The tuna tartar appetizer and the ceviche mixto were both really good and fresh (4/5). I didn't try the beet salad because I don't like beets, and the regular salad was pretty standard. The second round of food came with empanadas, french fries, beef with peppers/onions and soaked french fries, and crispy chicken. All the food was good and the empanadas came with this delicious amarillo sauce. 

For the main course, we just got a bunch of chicken and white rice with the amarillo sauce, which is such an amazing sauce. It was a lot of chicken and I'm definitely chicken-ed out for a while.

My main complaint is that I don't think the amount of food we got was proportional to what we paid. We each had to pay $34 (pre tax, tip and surchage) for the #2 premixed menu, but they only brought us 3 plates of each food. I'm very certain that if we were 12 people instead of 15 people, we would have each paid the same price and they would have brought us the same amount of food (but we would have gotten more food). We got 1/2 an empanada a person and I got one square of beef from the second round. If we had 3 less people, I would have paid $34 but probably gotten a full empanada and 2 or 3 squares of beef.

Overall, if you love chicken then come here. It's also pretty good for a big group, if you are okay with paying a lot of money (ended up being $45 total and I didn't even get alcohol).
author: Jenna G.

description:
Limon over Fresca any day.

My company sometimes gets Limon catering and it's definitely one of the best lunches. I tried Fresca (another Peruvian tapas place) and I had a terrible experience. So when I got here, I found out the food really doesn't even compare. Everything we ordered was well worth the money and we were excruciatingly full afterward. Best part? We ordered two entrees and an appetizer here during dinner time for less than I had paid at Fresca for brunch with two entrees and an appetizer.

We ordered chicken empanadas--very crispy and flaky and once bitten the juices from the chicken leaked out. YUM. We also got the steak plate which was, for that quality, SO WORTH. They also give you a very big portion which is a plus. I'd say even better than some top notch places I frequent. We also got some other meat dish that came with fries. 

Service was also spectacular. And ambiance was great--they have so much room with the bottom floor!

All in all--can't wait to come again.
author: Sheri N.

description: We came here after a recommendation but it was a pretty disappointing experience. The dishes weren't anything special and the staff forgot my drink order AND one of my appetizers. They didn't even apologize and I had to ask them to take it off the bill. When I got the bill, the drink was STILL on it. Honestly, I won't ever come back to this place. The food was average and the service was lackluster.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Great small plate tapas restaurant.  Excellent service, excellent menu.  We ordered several small plates and margarita pitchers.  Ole!

Among the top plates were paella, ceviche, roast chicken(the best), plantains, beef stir fry.  Served quickly and energetically.  

We had a large group and the staff took really great care of us.

Really enjoyed the experience.  Will be back
author: Susan C.

description: Great food and rotisserie chicken but some of the worst service I've ever experienced. We had 4 servers who all forgot what we ordered, messed up our orders, and never checked in on us. If you're okay with a bad dining experience and good food this is your place.
author: Emma K.

description: Good food & HORRIBLE dining experience. Their appitizers are fantastic   The chicken and steak is a party on your palette.  The noise level is disturbingly loud and makes it difficult to converse (good spot if you dont want to talk to your dining companion), the wait staff forgot one of our dishes and we didnt see much of him, the value of price and service isnt good.
author: Kenny P.

description: Came with a giant party for friend's birthday. We were seated on time. We opted for the price fix, the food was delicious, the waiter was sooooo friendly and helpful. Sangria, yucca, mushrooms, and the beet/yucca salad stood out. They provided two giant tequila shots for the birthday boy and had quite a fanfare doing the happy birthday song. Will definitely come back here.
author: Long C.

description:
This place is a bit loud, so good for groups who don't mind that. If you want to hear every word of the conversation, maybe not the place. 

Food: 

it's good. Portions are ok. For four people we ordered the 
+ chicken w two sides:swt potato fries, rice and beans. 
- Mac and cheese (don't do it)
= beef tongue 
+ steak 

(No drinks)

Four ppl w tax n tip $18 each, very reasonable. Note we all had big lunches, or was small appetite

Service was good, very friendly. Food came out relatively fast.
author: Heidi C.

description: I love coming to Limon, the food is amazing. I usually go for the Ceviche Trio, Tacu Tacu, Yuca Fries for appetizers when i'm with friends. They all have a very good taste. The Tacu Tacu has a slight kick to it, but i still recommend it. You do have to wait quite  a while if you come in before 5 as they only sit you upstairs (which can sometimes get crowded and you have to maneuver around people. Everytime i come, the staff/waiter seems to always be rushing us on ordering. Like chillax, let me enjoy my appetizer. I would recommend you telling them that you'd rather order in a few or after the appetizers come, just because if not, they'll bring your food and the appetizers together. The drinks are pretty strong as well (which if you like it, its a +). Other than that the food is great, and its one of the only reasons i keep coming back.
author: Veronica N.

description:
If you like Costco chicken, or KFC's rotisserie chicken, you're going to enjoy the rotisserie chicken here at Limón. While it's a bit pricier than Costco or KFC, it's 1000 times better.

I came here with a buddy of mine who was visiting SF. I had heard great things about Limón, but had never gotten around to trying it. My friend and I were in the Mission and were looking for places to eat, and Limón popped up. I was in the mood for Peruvian food and my friend had never tried Peruvian... So this place definitely hit the spot! 

We ordered the lomo saltado, chicharron de pollo and half rotisserie chicken with sides of yucca and rice/beans mix. The chicken also comes with a side of three dipping sauces, which are great to dip with just about anything-- the chicharron, the lomo saltado beef, and the rotisserie chicken, and best of all -- great for dipping fries and yucca fries in!  My favorite dish was the rotisserie chicken-- the meat was perfectly tender and seasoned inside, which was a whole lot more flavorful than Costco chicken! 

Parking here can be kind of tough, so I recommend taking Bart if you can.  Service is pretty good here as well.

If you love Peruvian food, definitely come by here and check out Limón! (try the chicken!)
author: Matthew L.

description:
Heads up: make a reservation! This place is always packed, once you try the food you'll know why! Octopus and shrimp ceviche: to die for! Try also the meat, mouthwatering! Is a must place to try. 
Bonus: Van Ness location has a downstairs bar, didn't try it but hey, now you have another reason to  go and find out about this amazing place.
author: Florence D.

description:
I see you roasted chicken.

I had a friend in from Austin (Edison) and we decided to check out Limon Rotisserie. We ordered the full roasted chicken, veggies and a side of rice. The roasted chicken had perfectly crisp skin and super juicy on the bone chicken meat. I didn't even need to try any of the dipping sauces...it was that good on it's own.

The veggies were super varied and perfectly cooked. Sometimes eating something so simple and having it be so perfect is just....really nice. We were happy to see that there was a full bar.

When the bill came I was so impressed that it was so affordable as well.

My only complaint is how loud it gets when it's packed. I think that's due to all the hard surfaces - concrete floor, steel cladding, etc.
author: Tara H.

description:
Peruvian food is bleeping delicious. At Limón Rotisserie, I left with a massive food baby having eaten the best rotisserie chicken of my life. Dinner here almost felt like a dream.  I really don't remember much, but I remember Limon being one of my favorite dining experiences in San Francisco. We came in with a reservation and were led down a mysterious staircase into a loud cellar-like basement, the smell of delicious roasted goodness in the air. People were yelling, laughing and having fun. It completely felt like a perfect night out. I only wish I was hungier that night so I could enjoy the food even more. 

I've never had Peruvian food before coming in, and I can confidently say that Limon was the perfect introduction. Limon had the perfect mix of savory, peppery and umami and I loved every bite.  

----
*Pollo a la Brasa (Rotisserie Chicken) - These guys are known for their chicken, so this is an absolute must have. The chicken was nothing like anything I have tasted before. Very well seasoned in all sort of savory Peruvian spices, and cooked to perfection. The meat was incredibly moist with all the juices trapped inside. It comes with aji sauces, which added another layer of flavor to the chicken.

*Ceviche Mixto (Fish, Calamari, Shrimp Ceviche) - I was a little hesitant to try this one because I'm not really into raw dishes  but this came as a pleasant surprise. The lime marination really disguises the dish from tasting too raw, but maintains freshness. Had a slight crunch too.

*Pulpo a la Parilla (Octopus, Mashed Potatoes) - Probably my least favorite of the lot, but still downright delicious. I wish this one had more flavor, but then again, maybe I'm just not into octopus....

Lomo Saltado (Beef Stir Fry, Fries) - I loved this one so much. The beef and vegetables together were burst of so much flavor, it almost felt like my tastebuds were about to explode. Pair that up with french fries, and you got one of my favorite dishes of all time! I really enjoyed coating the french fries in that delicious sauce. Good lord...
----

With food that delicious and unique, Limón definitely holds a seat at my list of top food recommendations.
author: Mari U.

description: Really good ceviche, fries, and sangria. Will be back to try the rest. The service was also good, even though it was just me at the bar.
author: Seth C.

description: Chicken chicken chicken chicken chicken chicken chicken chicken chicken. Get that, half or whole, get all the sauces, go with the beans n rice, maybe the yuca fries, and also try a couple ceviche.
author: Alexis O.

description:
Food was pretty tasty. The rotisserie chicken, beans and rice filled me up and made me leave happy and full. Not the best restaurant in the mission, but if you are in the area I recommend. The drinks are pretty good, but a bit overpriced. 

That's all
author: Ross S.

description:
I came here for the first time yesterday. 
We were celebrating a friends promotion. 
We had such a great time, I was really happy with the suggestion to come here! 

We were a party of 10, and we had excellent customer service. I wish I knew our servers name, I was everywhere with conversations amongst my friends 

Food wise, we chose to go with the Pre-fix, which is recommended for larger parties. It's easier on the kitchen too 
We ate empanadas, sangria, ceviche, lomo saltado, etc..it was all amazing. And whatever I didn't like, my friends sure did, so it worked out for everyone. 

Food was also served at great time, we didn't wait too long at all for it to come out. So awesome. 
In my opinion though food was a little pricey but it was worth it. Our bill came out to near $700 

I also liked how we made a reservation at 6 and actually got seated at 6. So they were very prompt 
Thank you!
author: Valerie G.

description: My girlfriend is from Peru and she said that this was the best Peruvian food she's had outside of Peru. Actually my girlfriend is not from prove she just live there for a few years but loves food. She sometimes says that food is a key to her heart and this place was a locksmith!
author: Kaison T.

description:
THE HOST who has a long blonde hair was pretty IMPOLITE. She has a racist personality. 

We didnt made any reservation and we asked to sit at the table and she said go wait at the bar coz the wait was 25mins long. After we waited at the bar we decided to order food first and i told one of the waitress that can we moved to sit at the table when the seat was available. The waitress went to ask the host and disappear. He never came back to tell us or even check up on us.

The other waitress was good and the food was great too but some workers there were pretty rude and inconsiderate. 

I wouldnt come back for this location. The other location way much nicer.
author: Telsa K.

description: Truly professional place. They're famous for their rotisserie chicken, which was of course cooked and seasoned to perfection! Great cocktails as well. I love food of Peru! :)
author: Jayden G.

description: Came here for lunch the other day and was super impressed. All the food was amazing. We got a whole chicken, paella, beet salad, ceviche, and some fries. It was all delicious and they had pretty quick service as well.
author: Olivia P.

description:
Very yummy, but currently annoyed. 

Came here for a bday dinner and my sister and I shared the Half Chicken wihich came with 2 sides and  2 sauces.  We also ordered truffle mac and cheese for the table and it was so good. 

Im upset though. I had leftovers  and brought them out 2 days later to have for lunch and i look in the box, and the sauces that came with my meal, werent in there? Why didnt you pack them in my to go box, waiter?  Was really looking forward to having the leftovers. Now if I even come back, I will have to open the to go box before I leave to make sure all items are there. Annoying!!!!!! Subtract 2 stars for that.
author: Sarra E.

description:
Had a wonderful lunch with my family. They got a couple things wrong on our order but fixed it promptly.

Pros:
- OMG chicken rotisserie and the French fries
- Mango Lemonade was not to sweet and not too sour
- very friendly staff
- had high chairs and a kids cup with water

Cons:
- one bathroom with no baby changing table
author: Allan T.

description:
Limon-
Everything at limon was consistent and delicious. We had a pitcher of sangria, and pisco sours. The sangria was a perfect blend of just right and not overly sweet. The pisco Sours on the other hand were not the same as they are in Peru, which I was so hopeful for. They were very sour a bit sweet. Wish I could have the authentic pisco sours again!

Yucca fries- I don't even like yucca fries and these were delicious
Tuna poke- just as good if not better then Latitudes restaurant in key west. The crackers/ chips that came with them was like a light sesame chip, with no flavor but so much flavor....hard to explain but know I would get it again.
Ceviche mixto- was seriously also extremely delicious and highly recommended.
author: Lillian L.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Peruvian food!

We don't have any Peruvian spots in San Diego, so whenever I'm home in the Bay Area, I always make it a point to satisfy my craving.

I usually eat at Fresca, but when I discovered Limon, I had to give em a try- and I'm so happy I did! 

Our usual order consists of:
-Ceviche de Pescado
-Lomito Saltado
-Empanadas (a few of each!)
-Arroz con mariscos
-Quarter chicken (dark meat)

Oh and the pisco sours! Just keep those comin! 

Everything was really good! My favorite is definitely the arroz con mariscos and the ceviche. 

It's a very casual spot- and totally perfect for dropping in for a pisco (or two!) and a snack.  

The service is fast, the staff is friendly, and the food is great and always consistent!
author: Lainey L.

description:
I love Peruvian food so when my friend suggested we come here, I was all in. The place is quite small, I can see why reservations are highly recommended.

Sangria - good but a little on the too sweet side. After two glasses it became a little difficult to drink but it does give you a very nice buzz.

White truffle Mac n cheese - doesn't sound Peruvian ... it's okay! It's very good! Must try!

Carne empanadas - it was good but I've had better. The filling I felt was a little too dry. 

Chicharron de Pollo - pieces of fries chicken marinated in soy sauce, garlic, and some other flavors.  Tasty but I expected more for the price.

Special Lomo Saltado - its with risotto instead of rice and no fries. They wanted to try something new and the waiter suggested I get that instead of the traditional dish. The beef was tender, sauce was flavorful, but the risotto was okay.

Overall, the place is good. Their dishes are pricey and on the smaller side but it wouldn't stop me from coming back.
author: T P.

description: Limon Rotisserie on Van Ness in San Francisco has delicioso food they like to NOT serve to dark skin Blacks! Such a disappointment since we  as San Franciscans usually choose our food from here for family birthday parties (dining in and out). Not a micro, but a macro-aggression especially from the bartender!
author: Lezlee W.

description: Best chicken I've ever had. The food is so flipping good. Drinks excellent. Just high quality Peruvian comfort food at its best. Delish and a true treat!
author: K T.

description:
Price : standard
Atmosphere: great and unique 
Drinks:
- (craveable) maracuya sour: sweet but unique 
- Pisco sour: perfect
Food:
- chicken: moist and amazing flavor 
- yucca fries: have with the ceviche it is worth the wait
- (craveable) pescado ceviche: top notch
author: Cameron M.

description:
Wow this place is way overrated. Costco's $5 chicken is cooked better than Limón's. (read: Limón's chicken was bland and dry, Costco's is always tender and juicy).

The beef tongue was tasty and tender and the mashed potatoes that came with it were really rich (must be loaded with butter); I would also recommend the truffle mac & cheese. 
The Lomo Saltado looked good but I didn't get a chance to order it. Maybe if I come a third time (unlikely). However the rest of the items (ceviche, empanadas, etc) are nothing special.
author: Tom P.

description:
3.5 STARS for the food (for the ceviche mixto and the chicken)
ZERO STARS for take out and the 45min wait (we ordered ahead)


3:50pm: Ordered takeout on the phone, was told that my order will take 30mins. Arrived and signed the check by 4:30pm.

4:50pm: My boyfriend came in 20 mins later, to ask what's with the wait. ONLY AFTER WE ASKED did the bartender said it'd be 5 more mins, and that the kitchen was backed up.

We received our food 5:15pm, 1 hr and 25 mins after we placed our order. UNACCEPTABLE. And we received AFTER another customer who ordered to go after I paid. 

If they had told me there would be at least a 30 min delay, I would understand. But they didn't. We had to seek them out after waiting for so long. This is UNACCEPTABLE. If I hadn't already paid $106, I would've left. 


THE FOOD: We ordered ceviche, a whole chicken, and lomo saltado. The first two were amazing, the chicken was very juicy. But for the lomo saltado, they only gave us FOUR small pieces of beef and they were completely dry! My boyfriend and I LOVE this place, but we are now reconsidering coming here in the future because of the long wait and the lack of help. 

Please find an efficient way of clearing out your takeout orders.
author: Caroline P.

description: This place probably serves the best chicken in the Bay Area. Food and drinks are served in generous quantities and yet still affordable. I never left this place hungry or with a hole in my wallet. The sangria is great by the way.
author: Erik E.

description:
Truffle mac n' cheese?  At a Peruvian restaurant? Sure!  I can never resist mac n' cheese when it's on the menu.  Theirs comes in a skillet, and it's good - cheezy, creamy, truffle'y with toasted breadcrumbs on top.

Also a huge plus for getting same day reservations for a Saturday night at 8:30pm for our group of 8.  There were a lot of birthday groups around us too.

Yucca fries - delicious & fluffy thick fries.
Ceviche mixto - nicely done, slightly spicy
Cheese empanada - can't go wrong with fried cheese!!
Rotisserie chicken - it's chicken.  It's moist & seasoned well.  Don't expect too much beyond that.
I ordered the beef tongue, but they must have missed it on the order.  Tried another beef dish that had soy sauce & onions - very Chinese tasting.

There is a table at the bottom of the stairs - it's terrible functionally & bothers me more than it should from a feng shui perspective. Yeah, IKR?  Whatever.
author: Janice F.

description:
I'm really sad to give a one star review since the food was delicious, but I got food poisoning from their ceviche. My husband and I ordered a couple of items off the menu (all tasty) and shared everything. The only thing my husband didn't eat that I did was the shrimp in the ceviche, and the next morning I threw everything up. My stomach was a mess until I went to the doctor later that day, whatever was in that shrimp really took a tool on my stomach.

We called them the next day to let them know, they told my husband that their fish was fresh so it might have been something else that got me sick. However, I work at a company that has food made in house by a culinary team, and none of my coworkers got sick so it couldn't have been something I ate earlier that day.

I was fairly confident it was the ceviche but didn't think much of it, that was a couple of months ago. However, my friend ate there last night (need to confirm if it was the Van Ness or Valencia location) and also ordered the ceviche and has just come down with food poisoning, so now I'm convinced it's what got me sick as well. 

If you must go here, just avoid the ceviche at all costs.
author: Daniah D.

description: I really enjoyed this place. From the moment you walk in to the time you leave, you are greeted and served with the upmost respect. I loved the fact that they have an upstairs and a downstairs which is equally as comfortable. I could see myself spending time just watching the game at the bar. I may do that! I was waiting for my friend at the bar downstairs and the gentleman came and insisted I have a seat at the bar, where he proceeded to get me water. That is service. When my friends finally met me at the table we were instantly greeted, and checked in twice before our third person even got there. It was excellent. We ordered the full chicken to split along with the yuca fries and papas fritas. The chicken was exemplary; the skin was the crunchiest and most edible I've ever eaten before and inside moist. The yuca fries were crisp and the sauce they serve with both items was delicious and unique. I still can't figure out what it consisted of but it was different! That's what slows businesses to succeed is unique food items. I loved it.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I left the restaurant with a very happy stomach. 
The rotisserie chicken is really well flavoured and juicy, surprised the skin is crispy too! 
The special of the day, which was a fried white fish, went beyond my expectation. For a fish lover, it satisfied my craving. 
Had a sangria and tres leche cake too.. 
Dinner couldnt have been better.. I'm in love!
author: Carven H.

description: This is my favorite Peruvian restaurant in SF the food is just amazing! Try the Yuca fries, the ceviche clássico and the chicken!!!
author: Júlia F.

description: Limón always satisfies. When I come in I usually order the quarter white rotisserie chicken with their side of beans and rice and whatever veggie option they have (right now, green beans, and they are awesome). It's filling and delicious food, and the price is right. I've tried their cocktails and ceviches and these are great, too.
author: Galen P.

description:
Review for reservation (phone) staff -unprofessional, inefficient, error prone, not understanding customer requests, time consuming, and scattered staff. 

They put me on hold and transfer aimlessly/rotate 4 ppl to talk to you, none of whom know what is going on or what was said prior. Very time consuming.

Within one-two hours they had apparently lost my reservation and vehemently told me it didn't exist. It was laughable! 

I only happened to call back to change the time and they--3 or 4 different people-gave me such the run around, had serious miscommunication and language barriers/just didn't get what the customer was asking or saying, and claimed (somewhat rudely) that my name wasn't there---Even though she took my credit card info an hour before and had a full conversation with me! (And this was before opening time so it wasn't busy). 

After being shuffled around and given attitude, I asked if I could speak to the person who took it since they themselves suggested that, but I got put on hold with 3 different ppl picking up the phone giving me useless, confused answers and them saying she was busy but would get back to me, put me on hold, she will call you back, and more of the same continues...never getting that person on the phone. It was a TRUE CIRCUS. 

Finally after keeping me on the phone far too long, she came back saying it was downstairs in the office. I seriously wanted to cancel my reservation at this point. Instead I tried to politely let her know it's a little difficult to deal with their system (give constructive criticism) but she was blasé and made excuses saying, 'that's what happens when so many people are working.' 


The next day I called to cancel my reservation (wherein I was put on hold and transferred 3 times as well, having to explain 3 times--all to JUST CANCEL A RESERVATION !) I have never experienced this before. I had no interest in going here anymore. It was an exhausting experience before even getting there. And it was for my birthday to boot. 

Anyway, I write this only because it was actually embarrassing to witness and no doubt they're losing money if this continues-I'm hoping the managers for their own sake can be aware of it because it was a complete turn off. And I'm not judgmental. I also understand cultural/international differences in hospitality norms (incl in peru) but I had to speak up. They need to streamline, be cohesive, improve service, and have less people picking up the phone! I went to the Valencia location instead.
author: s t.

description:
Tiny portions for the price. No Peruvian could  survive on them. 
They took over an hour to serve our food.
Not impressed with the flavors either.
author: C B.

description:
AMBIANCE: 4 stars
Comfy booths and pretty good crowd at 9-10 pm.

SERVICE: 2 stars for our waitress...the bus boy was more helpful! She was just not that friendly, didn't bring anything we asked, and put the food down crooked on the table so it was sliding down. Hostess was great also, she prepared a booth for us in just a few minutes.

FOOD: 4 stars! For a late night dinner we really enjoyed our food. Lots of great flavors and they have these cool dipping sauces that were very good. I'd come back for the food! Menu has lots of options to choose from. A bit on the pricier side for the size of the portions but it's fun to try Peruvian cuisine.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Had an incredible experience fueled by outstanding service and oh-so-fresh and carefully made food. 
Do not miss any of the chicken offerings or the Limon Ceviche Trio. 
Start with a pisco sour!
author: Emiliano A.

description: Tasty comfort food. Make a reservation! Gets super busy and very loud. They have additional seating in the basement, which I prefer as the tables are more spaced out.
author: Dejana B.

description:
My family had a reservation for 6 people at 5:00 but we got there early and got seated immediately. It took the servers a little while to bring us drinks and take our order but once we ordered the food came our pretty fast
We ordered the tuna tartar, ceviche mixto, truffle Mac and cheese, beef tongue, paella, skirt steak and a whole chicken with vegetables and yuca fries.
I was most excited for the truffle Mac and cheese but I could find no trace of truffle flavor. It was still good but didn't live up to my expectations. 
My favorite dish was the lengua. It was so smooth and tender and the sauce was delicious. 
The food was really good but a bit overpriced for what you get. I would come back specifically for the lengua.
author: Dana T.

description:
I absolutely love Peruvian food and was excited to try this place out. We ordered the half chicken (four pieces), Ceviche Mixto, a side of mixed rice and beans, and sweet potato fries. 

The ceviche was pretty good - what you would normally expect ceviche to taste like. My favorite was definitely the rice and beans with the onion - I couldn't get enough. I'm a huge fry person and the sweet potato fries were perfect. My only complaint is the chicken was a bit too dry for me. I had to wash it down with water.

I'm giving this place three stars because the service was terrible. Our waiter came to us only to take our order and drop off the food. We had to flag him down any time we needed anything else and the check. The place we a bit busy but it's not so big that it should've taken away from the customer service. 

Good place to eat but nothing that I am dying to go back to.
author: Ana A.

description: The drinks are perfect, beautifully hand crafted a little pricey. Excellent service. The staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Alexia M.

description:
Alas, I finally tried Limon Rotisserie!

I'm not a huge fan of ordering chicken at a restaurant because it's such a simple and occasionally bland protein. However, Limon cooks theirs nicely, at least for the skin's seasoning. The crispy skin was delicious, salty with a hint of smokey flavor. For the meat itself, dark was very most and white a tad bit dry. But that's when Limon's sauces come in; with the choice of four different sauces, you're bound to find one you like -- aji amarillo huacatay (yellow chili pepper and herb), aji amarillo mustard (yellow chili pepper and mustard), spicy rocoto molido (red hot chili pepper), or chimichurri (chopped parsley and oil).

With the chicken entrees, you also get two sides. We opted for the tacu-tacu, which is sautéed rice and beans, and the sweet potato fries. The rice was very moist and mild, but a bit mushy. And the sweet potato fries were just okay. Portion-wise, Limon's chicken is the best value on their menu, and perfect for sharing too.

Another Peruvian staple is Lomo Saltado: sautéed beef, onions, tomatoes, and fries in a soy sauce-vinegar-spices blend. But Limon calls their version "Lomito" instead, as it's a smaller portion and without the side of rice. The beef cubes here were a little too chewy, and the fries were obviously too mushy from soaking in the sauce. But the sauce itself was delicious, salty and a hint of tart.

Service was quick, as food arrived within five minutes of ordering. The restaurant isn't that large, but there are two other Limon's in the city: another one in the Mission and one in Bayview. Limon gets busy quickly, so prepare for a long wait during peak lunch/dinner hours; otherwise, make reservations ahead of time.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Love this place!!! Ceviche is great, chicken is incredible, flavors and portions all amazing! Perfect place to take a group and do family style!

Eaten most everything on the menu here, only thing I was not a fan of was the carne empanada, the egg and raisin just was not for my palate. 

Perfect dinner for four that we almost always get:
a ceviche (any of them)
ensalada
whole chicken
truffle mac n cheese 
yucca fries
queso or pollo empanada 

I love sauces and am IN LOVE WITH ALL THEIR SAUCES!!!!!
author: Morgan S.

description:
This is my 4th or 5th time at this location of Limon, and I can't say enough about it! Food is incredible, service is excellent -- it's an all around great experience. Pro tip - if their reservations seem full booking online, just call! Have gotten in with groups of 4 - 8 pretty last minute by calling directly.

Pros:
- Chicken! If you come here and don't order the chicken, you're doing yourself a disservice. Favorite sides are yucca frites and green beans. 
- Service! They are generally quite crowded, and yet I've never waited long to have drink or dinner orders taken. Food comes out fast, and yet I don't feel like they're trying to rush us out of there. 

Cons:
- Margaritas are a little sweet for my taste
- Downstairs can be quite noisy when it's a packed house

During our most recent visit, we ordered and whole and a half chicken plus the ceviche trio for 4 (hungry) adults. Right amount of chicken and sides, we probably didn't need (but also didn't regret!) the ceviche. With drinks and tip came to about $150. If you're looking to do this dinner on a budget, skip on cocktails not on food :) So excited for the Bayview location to open closer to my house!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Paella skirt stea, truffle mac n cheese, short rib steak, salad.

Delicious food! Highly recommend. I would order the truffle Mac any day of the week. Their sangria is De-LIC-CIOUS.
author: Amanda D.

description: This place is absolutely amazing. Not too fancy just good food done right. We were here for 3 days and ate here twice. The rotisserie chicken is perfectly seasoned and cooked. We also had the ceviche mixto appetiser both times and it is the best I have ever had. I recommend this place to anyone who who is looking for an outstanding meal and some great service. May want to consider a reservation if going for dinner as the place is not real big.  Will definitely come back when in town.
author: Carlee C.

description:
I've had this placed booked marked for the longest time and finally gave it a try this past Father's Day.  The servers were awesome with taking our orders and letting us know the drink specials.  This was the night that the Warriors were playing so it was cool that the servers were more attentive cause they were watching the game with us.

On with the food.  We ordered the full chicken to share.  We also ordered the carne empanadas, arroz con mariscos, lomito Saltado, yucca Frita, sweet potato fries and the short rib dish.  They also had a margarita special in honor of the Warriors game, we got that as well.  All in all the food and service was amazing that we will definitely be back to try the other dishes that they serve.
author: Shana W.

description:
I came here with a bunch of friends and we had a great time. We were a large group and the waiter recommended us to order family style. Most of the dishes looked really appealing so we took his advice and went for it. This pre-set menu comes with salad, empanadas and 2 roasted chickens as well as several sides (we got fries, rice, peppers and another side that I can't recall). The quality of the food was excellent, all of us liked it a lot. Service was good too, since we got family style we did not need much help though. Anyway, our dinner was not cheap, but the quality of food justified it. We had enough to feed a large group of starving bodies and nobody left hungry. All of us were more than satisfied.

I'll come back. I do not know whether I'll get the preset menu again but I'll come back, that's for sure.
author: Noah T.

description: Great place for a larger group. We decided to try a few empanadas (beef was my fave), chicharones, pollo a la brasa (also my fave), mac n cheese and ceviche. Paired that with a few pitchers of sangria and had a great night full of laughter and stories. Bring good friends or family and enjoy!
author: Ricardo C.

description:
The rotisserie chicken is AMAZING! and the ceviche. and sides. everything was good!

I had the quarter chicken (dark) with sweet potato fries and tuca tuca (beans and rice) and was surprisingly full after. I was actually pretty full during lol but it was so good and just sitting in front of me so I kept picking at it till it was completely gone.

I liked that they had a downstairs dining area, cause the floor that you enter on seems a bit small. I think I liked the downstairs dining area better too "atmosphere"-wise lol. The whole place gets packed though and there was a long line at the door when I walked in. Luckily one of my friends made a ressie... seems like a place where you would need to make a ressie.
author: Terra C.

description: I might get a lot of hate on this, but I definitely expected more from this place, granted the stellar reviews on Yelp along with the hype from my friends. We ordered the chicken, ceviche, and yucca. While the food was decent and I have nothing apparent to complain about, it was honestly just OK. The chicken wasn't anything special in terms of flavor and the ceviche portion was small. The fried yucca was probably the best thing that we ordered. It had a nice texture and wasn't too thick or dry. This place is very Americanized and modern so I understand its appeal in that sense. As far as Peruvian food goes, I have my go-to, hole-in-the-wall restaurants in my hometown so I guess I'm biased to those. Again, not at all bad food, but the flavors were just average in my opinion.
author: Justine S.

description:
Great place to dine at with a group of friends! We had reservations and were pretty much seated immediately on arrival. Since my friends had already been here, they pretty much ordered for the group and everything was delicious. From the cocktails and sangria to the ceviche and most importantly the rotisserie chicken, everything was just SO DANG GOOD. 

This location looks small on the outside, but they also have a lower level to seat bigger groups. It can get quite loud in here as they do show games on TV and the room echos a bit. Great place if you wanted to come for a dinner for 2, 4 or more. highly recommend making a reservation before heading here though - there were pretty waiting for tables since it can get quite popular.
author: Kim N.

description: I hadn't eaten Peruvian before so I took the recommendation of the waiter and was very pleased. It was the chicken dish with string beans delicious. Coffee, water, desert all good. SERVICE was excellent. Even though we didn't have reservations they were able to seat us right away. I RECOMMEND GETTING RESERVATIONS. IT'S NOT EXPENSIVE
author: Ken P.

description:
2.5 stars. 

If you want to have any sort of conversation with your dining partners do not go here. I couldn't even hear myself think and it partially ruined the experience for me. 

Onto the food, it was just okay! The ceviche was cut with no regards to the fish in a long string not even separated into pieces. Otherwise it tasted nice, but the knife cuts were atrocious. How embarrassing. 

The lomo saltado was just okay as well. Delicious rice, but had tough meat and not enough sauce. The worst crime of all is their terrible French fries! We also tried a chicken dish with French fries that was also awful. It contained fried chicken bits, fries, a sauce, and cheese. It sounded amazing on the menu, but the chicken was so over cooked and again the fries are terrible. 

Overall the experience was okay, but I would not come back.
author: Jen B.

description:
My parents and I checked out Limon for dinner on a rainy night. The service was excellent from the very start. I called as were about to miss our reservation and the hostess was able to accommodate us for a slightly later arrival.

We were seated downstairs and were served by the sweetest server. The three of us shared half a chicken, truffle mac n cheese, and lomo saltado. The chicken was very flavorful and I enjoyed the aji sauces that accompanied it. The mac n cheese was the best item of the night; it was rich without being overpowering. The lomo saltado was seasoned well but we all agreed that the beef was a tad overcooked.

We finished the meal with a delightful bread pudding.
author: Yi Z.

description: The.Food. Is. AMAZING. Only reason why this particular Limón didn't get five stars is because of it's distasteful service. The waiters (all men, mind you) have awful manners and are almost cumbersome whilst serving. Other than that, you have GOT to get the Peruvian fried chicken with taccu taccu. It is A MUST. Along with the mango lemonade
author: Peter B.

description:
I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to try something new. This restaurant uses it's food to showcase its Peruvian roots in the creative neighborhood that is The Mission in San Francisco. The Restaurant itself is small, therefore, a reservation is always encouraged. Thankfully, I have always had luck when I have gone on Saturday afternoons. 
The food is obviously Peruvian and IT'S GOOD! Every single time I go I have the Ceviche de Camaron y Pescado (Fish and Shrimp Ceviche.) It's one of the best ceviches that I have ever had.
I bring people here all the time and I've never had someone not like it. In fact, most people like it so much that they invite other people. This last visit I brought along some friends. One of which had the Carne a la Parrilla (Grilled Steak.) Medium rare, seasoned amazingly and presented beautifully.  

Do yourself a favor and try it!

Pros: Constancy, flavor, friendly staff.
Cons: PARKING

MEAL & PRICE (Party of 3)

Truffle Mac & Cheese $8.95
Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron $14.95
Carne a la Parrilla $17.95
Arroz con Mariscos $17.95
Two Alcoholic Drinks ($ ?)

Total Price: $94.77 (Tip $20.00)
author: Miguel M.

description:
I love Limón. It's always kind of loud inside, but the food is great and it's always relatively easy to accommodate a large group. 

My favorites: lomo saltado, octopus, ceviche de pescado, and the empanadas de carne.
author: Marta F.

description: Food was great. Quick service. Flavorful ceviche, chicken is awesome, Yuka fries are a must. Definitely will be back if in the area.
author: Arik H.

description:
We had a reservation on Saturday night, but had to wait about 30 minutes longer until our table was ready. 

Pisco sour is great. The bartender was so nice and personable. 

Our server was not nice, was impatient and unattentive. 

Yucca fries. They are just ok. 
Sweet potatoes were great. 
Sauté veggies- pretty standard. 
Ceviche mixto- decent but with really large chunks of seafood (shrimp, fish and calamari)
Beet salad - well dressed and fresh 
Roasted chicken - white meat is amazing! SO JUICY and tender. 
Lomito saltado- medium rare. So tasty. One of my favorites. I even like the regular fries underneath. Perfectly cooked. 
Jalea - pretty much is like calamari. It's good 
Truffle mac - yum!
Alfajores- must get for dessert!
author: Jen L.

description:
Limon is delicious! I came in on a Wednesday evening around 6:30pm for a party of 6. Reservations were easy to make a week in advance at this location and the Valencia location. We were able to find street parking after paroling around the streets for about ~10 minutes. However, I would recommend taking public transportation or a lyft/uber to this location if its possible.

There were very few dishes I didn't like. Here's what we ordered:
(Rating system *=poor **=average ***=good ****=excellent)

FOOD
Chicharron de pollo ****
Cerviche Mixto ****
Cerviche de Pulpo y Camarones ****
Empanada Carnes ****
Polli-papas ****
Arroz con Mariscos ****

Lamo Saltado ***
Empanada Veggie ***
Tacu Tacu ***
Camote Fritos ***
Whole Chicken ***
Championesa anticucheros ***

Ensalada Rusa **

DESSERT (All ****)
Chocolate Bandido 
Panna Cotta de Mango
Tres Leches
Bread Pudding

BEVERAGES
Pitcher of Sangria ***
Pisco Sour ***

Overall: Family style, delicious foods, fast service, hard parking.
author: Nicole J.

description:
There's two branches in the mission, one near 16th, the other by 21st (this one) just to clarify. This one has a small upstairs with a bar and a rather dark downstairs area (also available for large parties) for extra dining seating as well as a full bar. 
The service was friendly and they had a well working system of circulating staff, especially helpful since it was common to have large groups or people ordering a trickle of tapas. 
First, it should be noted that the drinks here were excellent. The Carioca (Leblon cachaça) had a Pisco sour taste but was more lime like. The maracuya (passion fruit) Pisco was so easy to drink but can pack a powerful punch. The 
Their chicha morada was quite excellent, a smooth combination of sweet and spicy (cinnamon) that made it so delicious. 
The octopus starter has a slightly spicy sauce and a delicious side of mashed potato with chimichurri sauce. 
You can't go wrong with a ceviche, either fish or even a tuna tartare style (tastes like poke). Remember that Peruvian ceviche doesn't usually come with chips, so don't forget to ask if you want them. 
Macaroni and cheese with truffle oil is pretty delicious too if you don't want seafood. 
Overall I really enjoyed this place, atmosphere and food. They do a good combination of authentic Peruvian and modern fusion.
author: Naomi K.

description:
This place is as good as the reviews state. The BEST rotisserie chicken I have ever had and the sauce was incredible. My friends had paella and the beet salad. I'd recommend both to future guests. 

I was expecting it to be more expensive. It was worth every penny and I will be coming back ASAP.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
This place is really good.  I want to eat here again!  The GF and I ordered the Pollo A Las Brasa which came with a quarter chicken and two sides.  The sides we chose were rice and sweet potato fries.  We also ordered a veggie empanada and of course, the truffle mac and cheese.  

The food came out in a decent amount of time.  However, they did forget to give us any of the sauces that were included in the order.  We had to ask the server.  When our server brought the sauces to our table,  he did not tell us what the three different types of sauces were.  

The empanada was unsatisfying.  The peas inside were so strange.  It was simply too plain and not worth the price.  The truffle mac and cheese was definitely the star of the night.  It was rich and flavorful, and the pasta was cooked perfectly.  The chicken was moist and fell right off the bone.  The sauces complimented the dish well.  The sweet potato fries were crisp and fresh.  

Nom.  This place is definitely worth trying.  I will be back!
author: Victor L.

description: Ok food, horrible manager. John! Why do you even work there? McDonald is a better place for you. They serve your standards.
author: Maria N.

description: I have been here so many times that it's hard to count. Food is delicious and prices are great for Peruvian place. Quality of food is constant. I love their ceviches and pulpo de la patilla and have them every time we go there.
author: Liene C.

description:
TLDR - good Peruvian food, a little pricey; definitely recommend the ceviche and rotisserie chicken

I've both dined in here and had food from catering. The food dining in was obviously better, but their catering isn't a bad option. Food is generally served family style, so I'd recommend coming with a few people to share several dishes. Portion sizes are on the small side though, especially for the price, so either don't expect to get very full or expect to be paying quite a bit.

From dining in:

-CEVICHE MIXTO ($14.95) - 5/5 
[fish, calamari, tiger shrimp]
Really good and fresh! The ceviche has an ever-so-slight kick to it from the chilis. Not a fan of the texture of the corn though, but I feel that way about all ceviches with that corn. Portion size is really small, unfortunately. I've had this for catering as well and even then it was really fresh!

-POLLO A LA BRASA ($16.95, half chicken) - 4.5/5
[choice of 2 sides]
Their well-known rotisserie chicken. A little greasy, but the chicken is really tender! The half chicken portion comes with 4 pieces of chicken so it's good for sharing between 2 people. For our sides, we got the CAMOTE FRITO (sweet potato fries), which were perfect, and the VEGETALES SALTEADOS, which were too greasy for my liking. The chicken isn't quite as tender with catering and it's a little greasier, but still pretty good

-CARNE EMPANADAS ($8.95) - 4/5
[hand-cut top sirloin, sauteed onions, hard boiled eggs, olives & raisins]
I wasn't a fan of the catered empanadas because the pastry was soft and way too oily, but the ones dining in had a perfect crisp to them. The beef filling is flavorful and a tad bit sweet from the raisins. There's a pretty good bread to filling ratio too.

From catering:

-ENSALADA RUSA ($8.95) - 4/5
[beets, potatoes, carrots, choclo/corn, peas]
Nothing fancy. It's a pretty simple salad really, but I love beets and it was light and refreshing (without the aioli) in comparison to the meat and stir-fried veggie dishes. Some of the roots tasted too earthy though. Probably wouldn't be a go-to item for me dining in but good overall.

-TRUFFLE MAC & CHEESE ($8.95) - 4/5
MMM truffle oil! So heavenly. Rather rich and creamy so I couldn't really manage to eat more than a few bites, but it still didn't feel super heavy and didn't taste as cheesy as most mac and cheese (it was more creamy than cheesy)

-LOMO SALTADO ($16.95) - 4/5
[beef tenderloin stir fry, onions, tomatoes, fries, soy sauce, rice]
A little on the salty side but the beef was cooked pretty well. Not the most tender, but definitely not dry or tough/chewy.

-SECO DE COSTILLAS ($13.95) - 3/5
[braised beef short ribs, huacatay-cilantro broth, potatoes, carrots, peas]
Not bad, but also a little salty. Beef was a little dry

-CHICHARRON DE POLLO ($11.95) - 3/5
[crispy chicken marinated in soy sauce, garlic, aji amarillo, salsa criolla]
Most of the chicken was super dry, tough and overcooked, but some were slightly more tender. I think the chicken was supposed to be crispy but the chicken we got every time we catered was never crispy. Okay flavor but mostly just salty and greasy

-CHAMPINONES ANTICUCHEROS ($10.95) - 3/5
[stir-fried mushrooms, garlic, onions]
Normal stir fry. Salty and greasy like everything else

-VEGGIE EMPANADAS ($8.95) - 2.5/5
[mushroom, spinach, choclo, mascarpone cheese]
The filling was on the salty side and too creamy from the cheese. Not a huge fan.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Good food, especially the ceviche.

However that is cancelled out by the horrible service. We were there on a Sunday with a reservation for 9. Right off the bat we start off on a bad note, because the waiter cards everyone except for my friend who is balding, and basically laughed at him for it.

We get there right on time at 7pm. The whole time the servers were running around so chaotically, almost whacking us in the heads with their stuff. They didn't check in, just had to continually flag them down.

We pay at 8:30 and get promptly kicked out by the waiter.  This was pretty egregious because we didn't get my friend's entree until 75 min in... I understand sometimes large groups linger, but that was the opposite of our situation.

If they wanted to get us out sooner than 90 min in, maybe they should make the food come faster. I don't think I'll be back :\
author: Natalie S.

description:
Walked in at 8 pm on a Saturday night and was seated immediately- 5 stars (we were very lucky)

Ceviche mixto - 5 stars 
Steak and fries - 5 stars
Beef tongue - 3 stars (I really didn't care for it but their mashed potatoes or Yuka was out of this world...delicious)
Bread pudding - 5 (hundred) stars
author: Jessica Z.

description:
I had a new co-worker come in from Germany and we wanted to show him around San Francisco at night.  What restaurant does your Peruvian co-worker Sergio recommend for dinner. Limon acourse.  Limon is located on 16 th street in the Mission district of SF and it was bustling on our Wednesday night visit. For drinks, we all had the Pisco Sours, a Peruvian brandy with lime juice, syrup and other flavors. Wow this drink was fantastic.  Limon has a fully stocked bar plus some nice mixed cocktails.

We ordered the following appetizers:

Yucca Fries: similar to Yams 
Sweet Potato Fries: Strips of sweet potatoes 
Ceviche Mixto: raw fish, shrimp and calamari in the lime & lemon juice 
Tartara de Tuna: raw tuna in lime & lemon juice with spices.

All of the appetizers were flavorful, I love seafood and could eat Ceviche all night.

The main entree to order is the rotisserie chicken. The Pollo ala Brasa is slow roasted over an open flame and it can be order as a whole chicken, half or quarter. Since we were a party of six we ordered the whole chicken. It was so good, the seasoning and the taste were so flavorful. The dish also had three Aji sauces (dipping sauce) for the chicken and appetizers.

After having these dishes I can see why my friend visits this restaurant often. I think I need to plan a trip to Peru in the near future. Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Jim D.

description: So much flavor! My husband ordered the half chicken, tacu tacu (which is a must-have!) and yacu fries. Enjoyed the environment as well.
author: Caroline H.

description: I just had a birthday dinner here. The dim lit basement was cool. It added that private intimate setting like a lot of these new speak easy bars around the city. Also The pisco sours and rotisserie chicken with tacu tacu was dope!!!!!! thanks a lot guys. I'll be back
author: Kyle L.

description:
Dropping a couple of stars due to what is clearly a case of over-booking and poor service. We had a large reservation for 14 at 8pm, but we were not seated till past 8:30pm and we only received enough tables and seats for 12! We had a couple people trying to squeeze in on the end of the table, and there was definitely not enough room for the plates nor our elbows. This is while I see them seating multiple other large parties... it looks like they overbooked and were trying to maximize profits for the night. When a small two-top opened up next to our group, we asked if we could just attach those tables to ours so that we get enough room. Nope, the hostess refused and said those are held for a reservation. Well, they seated two people there immediately, but left open a couple of four-tops right behind us instead, which never got filled.

There were a lot of other service miscues such as not getting any service utensils or any explanation of our menu.
author: Kazu O.

description:
tl;dr: Cake cutting fee $48. I like the food but I'm not a fan, so 3 stars it is.

Alright, here's the story: we came here on Saturday night with reservation at 8:30pm of 20-ish people. The restaurant looked amazing from the outside and there were couple people waiting in line. The parade in downtown slowed everything down so we got here late -- luckily the space wasn't ready for us so we still got to make it to the reservation. It was almost 9pm when everyone got to sit in. By the way, the parking was a nightmare but that's just how it works in San Francisco (don't be surprised). 

We were led to the basement -- nice and loud. The atmosphere was good but it was chilly. We got pints of Sangrias: white was light and red was sweet. Apparently we got a set menu since we have a large group and the set price was $32 per person. Here's what we had: Ensalada Mixta, Ceviche Mixto, Tartara De Tuna, Pollo, Pollo A Las Brasa, Tacu-tacu and fries. There should be one more dish but I had no memories on that.
