Honestly I was starving so everything was yummy. Pollo A Las Brasa was dry but it went well with sauces. Tartara De Tuna was amazing, it was the highlight of the night, I don't have too much Tuna Tartar in my life but this was one of the best yet. I strongly recommend it. The texture was right and it wasn't too sour, ate it with potato chips (not the bagged potato chips) and it was perfect. 

The service was great, servers were very friendly and kept out water glasses filled. It turned out there were multiple birthday groups here on the same night, they were very busy but still got us with everything. The bill came out and it was $53 per person yet I don't feel the food portion match up the price. We had the server to cut the birthday cake and it took about 20 mins to do so, then here's another highlight of the night: $48 for cake cutting. Woah, the cake was like $20 or something from Safeway and it was the first time ever I heard the cake cutting fee was double the cake price. SURPRISE. I'm sure it required skills to cut a round cake into 20 pieces. 

That being said, I love Tartara De Tuna but I couldn't stand for $48 cake cutting fee. It just doesn't make sense.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I've been coming to this place since it opened and their menu has evolved a bit but all the classics are still as delicious as ever. 

I like going to Limon as an alternative to Spanish tapas, they're small plates a great for sharing and everything tastes very fresh. 

I recommend the Chicharron de Poll (crispy chicken) it's very addictive. 
Always get the Yuca fries ( I live dipping them in the Aji sauces which you have to order separately) 

The ceviches are all great as well try fresh and well marinated, I recommend the Leche de Tigre which comes with mixed seafood and is spicy. 

Sangria is great as well fresh fruit flavor and doesn't give you a headache. 

This is a great place for large groups, they offs pre-set menus for parties over 10. 

The have a corkage fee and a cake cutting fee( $2 per plate)
author: Antonio W.

description:
Was one of my favorite places in Bay Area. Unfortunately with bigger demand in last years the quality has gone down and prices have gone up.. We went Saturday and was just Ok...We ordered Pulpo a la Parrilla (Octopus) and they literally gave us 4 mini pieces of Octopus (4) and A LOT of potatoes with it... C'mon!... and they charge $20 for it...
Still food is good, love the Lomo saltado, churrasco, and ambiance is great!
author: Lorena A.

description: BEST ROTISSERIE CHICKEN EVER. Took my mom here and she loved it too. I recommend the ceviche mixto also.
author: Victoria F.

description: Limon catered a meeting I attended yesterday, and the chicharron de pollo was so good we went for dinner tonight. The Chicharron de pollo was even better fresh from the kitchen. The rotisserie chicken was perfectly flavorful, tender and juicy. The salad rusa was a hit. We ordered the fries with cheese, mustard and chicken. It was good, but probably won't get that again. Overall a very enjoyable experience. We will definitely be back!
author: Robert Q.

description: Good Latin food. The Bomba is the way to go for the pregame. The service is fast. It's a mix of fast dining and sit down. Downstairs is another area. We went with the truffle Mac and cheese which is the must for this place, is soft and succulent. Try the traditional beef. A good rendition of typically prepared Spanish meat
author: Redi R.

description:
Going out in Mission, our group of five decided to meet up at Limon Rotisserie for food, tapas style to share and talk over some sangria and catch up. Limon comes highly recommended in the San Francisco area (they're opening more stores across the Bay!), so we had to see what the hype was about of this staple Peruvian restaurant here. 

FOOD: Pollo a La Brasa, Whole Chicken ($24.95) was pretty good. I have to say though, the price does seem steep, but the chicken was pretty tasty. Not dry at all! THe sides we got were the yuca fries and the vegetales salteados. The yuca fries were great, but the vegetales salteados was a bit bland to me. Great to have vegetables, but I wish something more was done to them. We also got the Ceviche Mixto ($14.95), which comes with fish, calamari, and shrimp. I will have to say for the portion size was small for the price of the food. I thought it was pretty good ceviche, but a wee bit more acidity for me would have been nice. In addition, we got the champinones anticucheros ($10.95), which to me were delicious. The adresso anticucheros sauce was the right amount of saltiness and tang that gave the mushrooms great flavor. The Polli-Papas ($11.95) was also ordered, which to me, was pretty good, but mixed feelings at the table. With crispy parts of the chicken, and the aji amarillo/mustard aioli, I am a fan of those bits of chicken. We also got the Truffle Mac & Cheese ($8.95), which plays on everything in California high dining needs truffle oil. I thought it tasted OK, but not really worth ordering again. Finally, we got Lomo Saltado ($16.95), with beef tenderloin, onion, tomatoes, fries, and rice. I have to say, the Lomo Saltado was pretty tasty, but unfortunately, the beef was a bit tougher than I would have liked. 

DRINKS: Sangria. YES. Pitcher for a table of 5 is sufficient (depends on how many drinks you want), but we ended up getting two pitchers. 

OVerall, I found Limon Rotisserie to be pretty pricey for what the portion size. My favorites were the pollo a la brasa, polli papas, aji sauces, and yuca fries. I see that they're coming to East Bay, so maybe I will give it another shot once they hop over the water!
author: Albert H.

description: Incredible all the way around. The drinks are amazing creative and strong! The food is a great deal and bursting with flavor. Loved the dipping sauces so creative and flavorful. We had several drinks and shared the half chicken with yuca fries and sweet potato fries.
author: VANESSA H.

description:
We first first seated downstairs where the bar was. On that Saturday night, there was a Warriors game on and it was UNBEARABLY loud with the screaming and cheering for the game. I immediately went upstairs and asked the hostess for us to be seated upstairs. If there was no available seating, I would've left right there. It was a busy Saturday night, but luckily there were 2 seats at the bar upstairs and the hostess moved us immediately.

The drinks were phenomenal, and the food was delicious. The bartender was very nice and attentive too.

If you're not a fan of really loud noise and don't care for sports games, I don't recommend going here when there's a big game on. The service and the food definitely won me over and I'm glad i stayed.
author: Kelly D.

description: Lomo saltado!! One of my favorite meals. It's so wonderfully salty and the sauce that your rice and fries get drenched it is exquisite. The beef is cooked perfectly, easy to cut and very tender! The resturant is LOUD though. I have to stop here every time I'm in SF.
author: Asma w.

description:
Absolutely delicious food and I had a wonderful experience here. Made reservations at 8pm, came here 20 mins earlier, and we were still instantly seated, given that there were others waiting. 

Food: - they're famous for their rotisserie chicken,  so yes do get that! You get two sides with that and I recommend the yuca fries. It comes with only 4 pieces unfortunately, but those were really good. You get 3 sauces to eat with your chicken and basically everything else you order. 
- TRUFFLE MAC N CHEESE, yes order that. I am a big fan of mac n cheese and this place is off the hook! It wasn't too heavy and you taste the delicious truffle oil.
- lomito saltado was okay to me, their steak was a bit chewy and dried out after sitting out for a bit

Dranks:
- Divina Passion - if you like passionfruit, and the tart aftertaste, you will enjoy this drink
- Pisco Sour - really delicious! I tried their lychee one too, but that didn't have as much of a lychee kick as I would like. 

All in all, make reservations, perfect for a date night, I highly recommend it!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Four stars! Excellent chicken rotisserie and amazing tacu tacu. I actually really like their ceviches because their fish is really fresh and I like the spice in them too. Their hot sauces are also really good. 

Their empanadas are also pretty amazing and we like the approachable aspect of this place. I definitely recommend.
author: Rohan D.

description:
This peruvian place was pretty decent. It seems like they are known for their ceviches, that we did not try. But the sweet potato fries are unlike anything I've ever had before and pretty spectacular. The outside is crispy and the inside was almost gooey, like it melted in your mouth.

We got some rotisserie chicken and it was pretty good, though the skin was not as crispy as I would have liked it to be. The side vegetables that it came with were pretty good though.

I'd be back but when they open one closer to me. Even if just for the sweet potato fries! Magically delicious!
author: Jess A.

description: This is my favorite Peruvian in San Francisco. I cannot get enough of their tasty chicken with their dipping sauces. I suggest making a reservation and giving yourself 30 minutes for parking. Otherwise it can be a long wait.
author: C L.

description: My favorites here was the raw fish ceviche, the seafood ceviche and the roasted chicken. The flavors are very tasty and everything was cooked very well.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Management experience wonderful...very helpful & accommodating. 

Venue is very nice. ...bar is extensive...and they had a TV that they allowed me to watch a game. 

Food was just ok...not bad. ..but, also not memorable. Ordered Cerviche, empanados & the rotisserie chicken.

Parking really bad in the area.
author: Sharine d.

description:
I have been here twice and the food is amazing. The chicken, all the sides, the sauces, are the die for! My coworkers always raved about the tacu tacu, I was skeptical because.. how good can rice and beans be? It is SO good, it's a must and you will not be disappointed. They combine two simple main ingredients into such a flavorful side dish! The ceviche here is also very refreshing and lemon-y, my fav. It's hard to pick, so go for the trio! The tuna tartar is so fresh and delicious. I haven't had anything here that I didn't like.

The reason why I'm giving my overall experience two stars... our waiter, Hector, was awful. It was to the point where I felt discriminated. We were seated few minutes upon arrival without a reservation, awesome. Sat down at our table for quite a while looking over the menu, we were done deciding what we wanted to order for this evening... still no one came over to check on us or to even offer us water on such a hot summer day. FINALLY, Hector came over with a smirk on his face and asked if we were ready to order. There was no  small talk, didn't even ask how we were doing, nothing. Just went and took our order and left, never really came back to check on us, see how we were enjoying to food. NOTHING. But the funny thing was... he went over to other tables and checked how they were doing, asking about the food, smiling, etc. I don't know if Hector has a problem against asian nationalities or what because the service he provided to us was bullshit and no one deserves to be treated like that. I have money, an appetite, just like every other person in that restaurant. I am a very generous tipper, but for the first time in a long time.. I did not want to tip AT ALL because of how horrible Hector made our experience. I will come back for the food, but will make sure Hector is not my waiter. I've been at this same location before and the waiter we had was awesome. Hector should carry a friendlier smile on his face, not a smirk, and treat all his tables with the same respect and service.
author: Jordan D.

description:
Even before I started Yelping, Limón had long been on my list of restaurants to try.  It may not be the best restaurant SF has to offer, but I've been wanting to try them ever since I saw them on Check Please! Bay Area.  In fact, they were actually the first restaurant I ever saw on the show!

Although I actually tried the Limón on Valencia about a year ago, I never wrote a review because our meal wasn't off the regular menu (we had a prix fixed menu for my friend's birthday).  However, what I had was good enough to make me want to come back to write a proper review, even if I actually came to this location instead.

Compared to the one on Valencia, this location has a darker and cozier sort of feel.  Great for a date, but perhaps it was a little too "cozy" during our meal (more on that later).  Still, the menu is exactly the same and the food was just as good.

-- LYCHEE SOUR - Lychee Infused Pisco Porton, Fresh Citrus, Homemade Syrup, Egg Whites and Drops of Peychauds Bitters...$10
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lim%C3%B3n-rotisserie-san-francisco-3?select=UY9BRtPunchWoWLu3E_XUw#yDA_FXIfBCxO1B96pr3RbA)
I may not have had a lot of lychee sours in my life, but I know a tasty cocktail when I try one.  And this one, I liked.  The drink had a decent pour of alcohol while still maintaining a nice balance of sweetness and "sour".

-- CEVICHE MIXTO - Fish, Calamari & Tiger Shrimp...$12.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lim%C3%B3n-rotisserie-san-francisco-3?select=UY9BRtPunchWoWLu3E_XUw#TwYLpU4oW3s-LPkjDR6M2w)
A fine rendition of a pretty classic ceviche that, pleasantly, wasn't too acidic.  The chunks of fish were the best part, but as much as I liked them, I can't say the dish was particularly amazing either.  Not bad, just not amazing.

-- CARNE EMPANADA - Hand-Cut Top Sirloin, Sauteed Onions, Hard Boiled Eggs, Olives & Raisins...$7.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lim%C3%B3n-rotisserie-san-francisco-3?select=UY9BRtPunchWoWLu3E_XUw#28nEWMlloaTV0a-Za8yrgQ)
Now THESE are some legit and tasty empanadas (unlike El Porteño's...).  The crust was perfectly golden and there was a good amount of meat/filling, which was quite savory (albeit a little salty).  A great starter, though the chicken one seems more popular.

-- "LOMITO" SALTADO - Stir-Fried Sirloin Strips, Onions, Tomato, Soy Sauce, & French Fries...$12.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lim%C3%B3n-rotisserie-san-francisco-3?select=UY9BRtPunchWoWLu3E_XUw#ZVwihIBp-7TfzE7581DOoA)
I guess it's "lomito" because it didn't come with rice, but it still tasted the part.  The strips of beef were really tender and I liked the overall flavors and french fries.  It was a bit salty at the bottom, but it was still a pretty solid dish.

-- POLLO A LA BRASA - Marinated Free-Range Rotisserie Chicken with "Aji" sauces and Choice of Two Sides - Yuca Fries and Tacu-Tacu (Sauteed Rice & Beans)...$13.95 (half)
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lim%C3%B3n-rotisserie-san-francisco-3?select=UY9BRtPunchWoWLu3E_XUw#Y4Q5kC4tIQuYzW0tB1tycw)
Surprise, surprise...their signature dish was our favorite.  The breast portion was a touch dry, but the rest of the chicken was really moist.  Plus, the marinade was delicious!  As for the sides, both were great; the Yuca Fries were crisp on the outside and soft on the inside while the Tacu Tacu was delicious yet simple.

As for the restaurant's "cozy" confines, it would have been fine if we were seated elsewhere.  However, being that we were seated by the window next to the hostess stand, it was extremely annoying having people constantly standing and hovering around our table as they waited for theirs.  I get that space is limited, but a waiting area would be nice, or at least for someone to move the crowd towards the bar.

Still, despite that slight damper we had during our dining experience, it's safe to say that my friends and I still enjoyed our meal.  Except for perhaps the ceviche mixto, all of our dishes were worth getting again.  If/when I come back to Limón though, I might head to the Valencia location instead.  Or just not sit anywhere near the front.
author: Mike L.

description:
Ok food, bad staff.... just a regular place...
 Also don't like the downstairs room... 
definitely not coming back
author: Lais A.

description: The veggie empanadas and aioli sauce is OFF THE HOOK! The lady answering taking the takeout orders is ALWAYS EXTREMELY RUDE, so dont let that detour you away from this spot. If they get rid of the rude waitress answering the phones, i'll reurn with five stars because the food really is great. Havent tried one thing i was dissatisfied with. the panna cotta is delicious, the lomo saltado and the empanadas are what ive tried and keep coming back for! The food is five stars, the service sucks. Its irritating you have to get mad before eating such a delicious meal.
author: Noe O.

description:
This place has such flavorful food! And the service was very hospitable. My friends and I happily enjoyed a bottle of sangria and split a chicken and truffle Mac and cheese. It was late when we arrived so there was a lot of seating but we reserved just in case since it was an option. 

If it's your first time here, you can't go wrong with the chicken. It's a must!
author: Janelle S.

description:
Perfect restaurant for a nice meal with friends.
The great thing is that the meal is meant to be shared family style, which means I got to taste everything! My kinda restaurant.

Get:
- The chicken (obviously). I'm not the biggest fan of rotisserie chicken, but theirs was moist and flavorful (even the breast!!). However - note that the skin is VERY salty. We selected their tacu tacu (reminded me of red beans and rice) and yucca fries for sides, and they were both amazing with the dipping sauces.
- The lengua - OK i love beef tongue, so this dish was right up my alley. Flavorful, tender tongue, over a bed of creamy mashed potatoes

The OK:
- Lomito Saltado - sauteed sirloin, onions with french fries. This one was pretty good - the onions were flavorful and the beef tender. However it was missing something.

Pass:
- Truffle mac and cheese - where's the crispy bread crumb layer?? 

Between the 7 of us, we shared a bunch of stuff (plus a pitcher of sangria, obvi) and it was still an extremely affordable and reasonable meal.

I'll definitely be back!!
author: Michelle L.

description: Stopped in here for dinner with my wife. Had the ceviche and roast chicken meal. The roasted chicken as expected was the star. Well seasoned and probably one of the best roasted chickens I have ever had. Ceviche was fresh- good but not as memorable as the chicken. Overall a great dinner place. I will return next time I am in the mission.
author: Daniel L.

description: Such a great place with amazing food !!!!the Ceviche mixto is delicious. As well as the Chicken ! Love going here as often as I can!
author: Ivette V.

description:
The Sangria was not as great as everyone makes it out to be. In my opinion, it wasn't sweet enough and didn't have all the broken up fruit like you would expect.

The 1/2 chicken I ordered was good, and the fries were delicious. 

The Lomito saltado was to die for! Highly, highly recommend it. It is a bean and rice mixture that you can order as a side item to the chicken.
author: Nadia H.

description: Family style fun yummy food! Roasted chicken, tapas, green beans, ceviche and quinoa salad. Shared with family!
author: Paula S.

description:
This place is amazing! I'm surprised I haven't heard about this place before.

My friend and I shared the half chicken, beef tongue, and the truffle mac n cheese. The half chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly. We got sides of yuca fries and vegetables, which were both mouth watering. The beef tongue was my favorite dish. The pieces were thick cut, and came with a delicious sauce. The truffle mac n cheese was great also. When it came out, we could already smell all the truffle goodness. My only complaint was that it came out lukewarm, instead of piping hot.

The service was great here. We were greeted warmly by the host, and the server took great care of us. Will definitely be back to try more!
author: Derek T.

description:
Let me first off say that - when you make a reservation at a restaurant - and arrive on time with your full party, you do not expect to have to wait an hour before being seated. When I arrived, several individuals came after me without a reservation and they were told the wait was an hour and a half and that's pretty much how long my group waited, with a reservation. That totally defeats the purpose of having to make a reservation. Our server told us that this is normal for Limon -  but I really have to say that in no restaurant is this ok. There should be a system in place that ensures that those with a reservation are seated before those that do not. Needless to say, we complained about this. 

That being said - our server did apologize for the long wait, said that he would get his manager to speak with us, and would rush our order (it was almost 9pm when we were seated when our reservation was at 7:45pm and we had plans after - this really was wasteful of our time and it was upsetting). True to his word, the moment we ordered - it was like the food appeared in front of us instantly. The service was incredibly fast (less than 10 minutes) and I almost want to say that we waited longer than we actually ate there. 

The food was in fact, really great - we had a whole rotisserie chicken (very tender with great usage of herbs), sweet potato fries (crispy, salted appropriately to bring out the flavor), tacu tacu (rice and beans in almost a mash form, a little salty, but I really enjoyed it), empanadas, and lengua (beautiful presentation, maybe 3 -4 pieces so a little expensive for what you get, but worth a try imo). It doesn't seem like a lot, but it actually put everyone (table of 5) in a comfortable spot. The sangria is also complements the food wonderfully and has little chopped fruit in it. Once we started eating, it was easy to forget why we had been upset in the first place (I'm sure this was a previously concocted plan by the manager - very smart haha). We actually never spoke to him/her, BUT the manager did treat us to some desserts to make up for the time that we waited (mango panna cotta and what seemed like chocolate ice cream in a sundae type cup). I would have loved to give Limon a higher rating - but I already think that 3 is pushing it - the wait was a really terrible start, but I do like that staff tried to make the experience better for unhappy customers. I think that effort does go a long way - but it doesn't justify that kind of wait with a reservation. I would love to try Limon again - as they definitely have a lot to offer - but I just hope I won't run into the same issue!
author: Deanna S.

description:
Mmmmmm chicken! This reminds me of a fancier Spinnerie except Peruvian. I got a quarter chicken with white meat, and it was pretty moist. Got yuca fries and vegetales salteados. The vegetables were pretty oily. I think this may have been my first time having yuca fries. They paired well with the sauces they provided for your chicken. Arroz con Mariscos is a must get. Such good paella!

Surprisingly, the sangrias weren't very strong. Got the white wine one. Taste was pretty good but I think my drink had more fruit peels rather than the actual fruit...
author: Denise L.

description:
We went on a Sunday evening, the service was great.
The chicken here is amazing! You must order it and dip it in aji. Yum!
The ceviche was very delicious, I do wish the portion was larger.
The rice with seafood was good.
My only complaint was the empanadas, they were left in the fryer too long and they were really small. $8.95 for 2 small empanadas seems overpriced.
author: Mendy M.

description:
My group of friends, being spur-of-the-moment types, decided to hit up Limon without a reservation. What we were told would be a "30-minute wait at most" ballooned into almost an hour. Perhaps our hostess was overly optimistic, but twice she told us that our table would be ready after some table was done paying, only to have that not pan out. (What is going onnnn??)

So yeah, don't be like this group of dudes that decides on things at the last minute.

Once we'd ordered though, the food came really quickly. And everything was seriously ah-mazing! We had:

Whole Rotisserie Chicken ($23.95) - 4 stars:
Came with three types of sauces which were all great. The chicken was flavorful and not dry. This also comes with two sides; we chose the salad and tacu tacu (sauteed rice and beans which are mixed together and quite tasty!).

Lomito Saltado ($13.95) - 4.5 stars:
Stir-fried sirloin strips, onions, tomatoes and French fries. Everything was sauteed well and the sirloin was flavorful though just a bit tough. The fries were mixed into the dish but were not soggy.

Champinones ($10.25) - 5 stars:
An excellent dish with sauteed mushrooms, onions and garlic. The mushrooms were firm and cooked perfectly!

Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron ($13.95) - 5 stars:
Fish and shrimp ceviche. The fish was raw and marinated in lemon, which means maximum flavor! Came with garlic and corn garnishings.

Taro Chips ($4) - 4 stars:
Yum! Perfect as a delivery mechanism for ceviche.

Chicha Morada ($4) - 3.5 stars:
Purple corn-based drink not made in house; poured from a bottle. It was decent, but tasted like any other fruity tea. I did like how the waiter flipped the bottle in the air to shake it up before pouring it for me.

Limon's portion sizes ventured on the small side, but the food to dollar ratio was pretty typical compared to other places in the Mission. Overall, this place is a definite crowd pleaser!
author: Anson W.

description:
Made reservations here on a Tuesday at 7:15pm. Arrived a little early and was able to be seated... SCORE! 

FOOD:
We ordered the tuna tar tar for starters which was very fresh and tender. I do wish it was a little more on the serving size. We ordered the half chicken with sweet potato fries and tuca tuca (sp?) which is essentially mashed rice and beans. The chicken was juicy and seasoned flawlessly. The trio sauces were a perfect compliment. My fave was the habanero mango sauce which I assumed was going to unbelievably spicy, but surprisingly it was not. I wish there could have been more tuca tuca to match the amount of fries. The fries were cooked differently than I had them before - crunchy on the outside but still soft in the middle. It was nothing less than perfect. The sauteed mushrooms we ordered were so soft that one slice with your fork would cut it in half. The sauce was to die for as well. 
The dessert menu was limited and we went to to try the favorite: chocolate molten cake. It wasn't the best (hence the minus star)

SERVICE:
Everyone was very friendly and I love when they ask if you've been there before. They are welcoming to any questions you may have and can answer them without hesitation. Everything came out very quickly and our waiter was very prompt despite how busy he was. Our service was so fast, our dinner was literally done in less than a hour! LOL. 

Overall, I would LOOOOVVEEEE to come back and try more of their menu items. Everything is tasty, cooked effortlessly, and delightful. I would definitely recommend this place and make reservations!  By 8pm there was a crowd out the door.
author: Jenna T.

description: Went there last night and food was delicious! Had the steak w/ mash (huge steak + so tender), Beef empanadas (definitely get) and Crispy Chicken w/ fries. Probably could skip the Chicken w/ fries and try something else as everything looked really good. Food was great, people were cool. Definitely am going again.
author: Michael A.

description: We always go to this restaurant, the food is always great . My only concern is that everything is very small portions and it is kinda expensive . But overall it is a good spot!
author: Steve M.

description:
Absolutely love this place. Came here last week for the first time since it seemed like one of the healthier choices in the Mission. For lunch, there was no line on a Sunday at around 1pm. 

For two people, we ordered a half rotisserie chicken and the ceviche mixto. Both were excellent. The rotisserie chicken was incredibly juicy, tender, and not overly greasy. It came with three dipping sauces - one chimichurri sauce and two other creamy sauces with a mint flavor and mustard flavor if I heard/remember correctly. I liked all three but I preferred the chimichurri. The ceviche was also delicious with fresh shrimp, fish and calimari. There were bits of roasted corn that provided additional texture to the fish. 

Not cheap (around 3x the cost of the chicken at Safeway or Whole Foods) but not expensive compared to other places you could go on a date. I would definitely come back!
author: Sally C.

description:
Although the small bite of rotisserie chicken ranked as one of my top two, my entree let me down; the Arroz con mariscos (a contemporary of the Paella) was a trifle disappointing after the delicious empanada appetizers and the amazing dips set the stage for what I thought would be a dinner where all expectations were met.

My friend and I had the Veggie (mushrooms and herbs filled) and the Pollo (shredded seasoned chicken) empanada to whet our respective appetites. I have no idea what the accompanying sauces were called (save for the chimichurri) but they were fantastic. Especially the one that also came on the empanadas plates. The mushroom and veggies empanada was delicious, but faded in comparison to it's chicken counterpart which blew it away. And the sauce made what was a lovely dish, wonderful!

After a little while, our main course arrived and I could tell that my dish didn't look quite as delectable as it could. The rice was ... wet. It's different from being glistening with the sauce. It's the kind where it is cooked but still could have used a little more time in the pan so as to thicken and enhance every grain of rice. The dish seemed overly dependent on the essence of saffron to protect it's integrity and reputation, with the sofrito seemingly having taken a back seat.

But I must admit that when friends told me that their rotisserie chicken (Pollo a la Brassa) was the best; they weren't kidding. It's one of my top two rotisserie chicken in the Bay Area --- the other being that at the inimitable Zaki Kabab House in Albany. 

But with the uninspired entree I had, I couldn't possibly give it more than 3 stars.

(Oh Shoot! I just found out that Zaki closed in June. That's terrible!!!)
I guess Limon is now my number one place for rotisserie chicken.
author: Umesh T.

description:
A great sit down place for large groups. I usually come here with last minute out of town guests. It's hip without being overly SF yuppie. No offense to any of my fellow yelpers, I can be overly yuppie sometimes as well. 

The chicken is great (thank you for always eating the drier white meat, boyfriend) but I think the other dishes are massively underrated! That being said, the portion sizes (aside from the rotisserie chicken) are a bit small for sharing. The ceviche, while bright and delicious, is enough for 4 bites total. The same can be said for the specials (5 pieces of shrimp for $15?!) and other on-menu items. 

Overall, tasty food! Unfortunately, no guinea pig... What's peruvian food without some cuy?!
author: Xinxin W.

description:
AMAZING!!!

You gotta go to this place, it was so amazing on every level. The food was great, the service was great, the atmosphere was great! It was so nice to go out to eat and everything was perfect! Try it all, drinks included, ENJOY!!!
author: Scott D.

description: Picked this place for lunch with a friend. Located near a Bart station with plenty of street parking as well. Menu was very appetizing and food was good as well. Service is a bit slow but the well made cocktails made up for it.
author: Adi R.

description:
I've been to Limon now around three times and every time is exceptional. I go looking for some delicious chicken but I always end up getting the steak, The seasoning as always and I repeat always on point. It blows my mind how such a small serving of food gets my taste buds bouncing all over the place and I always end up full. Maybe it's the amazing sangria that I get that I find no other restaurant so far in the city can compete with. Yeah it is always packed and sometimes the weight can be a little bit on the long side but it definitely is great for a date whether it's with friends or family and even that special someone. Which is why I'm smart enough to always make a reservation! Now let's not get started on the chicharron as an appetizer and the sweet potato fries OOOOOWWWWEEE!! Overall I give Limon a five star rating when combining atmosphere, food, service and overall hunger being satisfied!

If you're looking for something that will be a great experience I highly recommend Limon!
author: Juan P.

description: This was recommended by a friend and I have to say it was likely the best meal of our trip, if not many trips to SF. The roast chicken is their speciality. It's a must. The green beans side are superb. We also had the truffle Mac& cheese, excellent! Highly recommended.
author: w e.

description:
Coming here is always exciting and last experience was delightful. 
Last time I went was with my boyfriend who hasn't been exposed to Latin American cuisine. 
We ordered Lomo salteado for him and Carne azada for me and for both Ceviche de pescado. More for him to taste and get exposed to new flavors. He not only liked it now he wants to try new places! 

The drinks here are BOMB!! The bartender is probably the best at making all drinks. He puts just the right amount of alcohol. 

The only reason why I didn't score it 5-star it's because my ordered came super late. And we had to keep calling the server for drinks. It was quite annoying. We get it it's busy but we were next to a big party about 10 people and servers would always come to them but never to us. It needs improvement.
author: Pam S.

description:
Seating here at the moment. 

What an amazing service.  Food is great.   The place is very clean.  The 
crowd very nice.   Good place
author: Ford T.

description: Not as authentic as i thought it would be (coming from a born and raised peruvian)  but the food was still good! The arroz con mariscos lacked that "sasón" that comes with a traditional peruvian meal but still tasty. The pollo a la brasa and yuca were also good! The service was also very attentive and helpful
author: Gustavo R.

description:
Food- I don't know is Peruvian food salty or just Limon's  food? The chicken was very good but the sides and rice dish we ordered were quite salty. 

Cocktails- Very good

Service- Very goo. 

We will check them out again but aren't in any rush.
author: Susan S.

description:
Really good food and great for sharing. Everything was cooked perfectly. Nothing to complain about. 

Boring review over.
author: Marc F.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Get the chicken with side of vegetables. They have a secret hot sauce only served on special request. Enjoy!
author: Jason G.

description: Went late night and still received great service. I was hungry and tired and the girl that helped us was great.
author: Will L.

description:
This place had more of a sports bar feel to me then a hip restaurant. Maybe because we were sat at the front of the restaurant instead of in the back - there were TV screens everywhere.

We got the ceviche which was decent. Tasted good but portion size was tiny for the price.

Service was good - got our sangria order wrong but changed it straight away with a smile which was great. 

Location is great - right next to the other bars and shops in Mission. Would go again to try other dishes.
author: Darryl I.

description:
A hot Sunday in SF got us craving for some ceviche. Lolo's nearby was out, so we hopped on over to Limon to see what they have to offer! This place has great tapas to choose to from!

WE ORDERED:
---------------

- Lychee Sour - (mixed with Peruvian alcohol) Not really a big fan of this one, and no it wasn't the egg whites that turned me off. I think it was because the drink was somewhat warm. My friend had the Passion Fruit drink and hers was refreshing and cool. Get the passion fruit one instead, the flavor was so much better also!

- Ceviche Mixto - We love variety and this came with fish, calamari, and shrimp. It was delicious except the cuts of the fish was pretty big for some reason.... lol. Nonetheless we got our ceviche fix on a hot Sunday!!! *Still dreaming of the delicious Peruvian ceviche we had in Puerto Rico though*

- Pulo a la Parilla - I'd recommend getting this grilled octopus with mash dish! Every bite was so good and the sauce is a bonus!

- Lengua a la Parilla - The marinade of their beef tongue is sooo good! I'd come back here just for this dish! The beef tongue is not chewy and dry so the flavor really stood out at every bite!

Overall, Limon did not disappoint with their tapas/small plates offerings! I wish we had tried more dishes, but seriously eating and drinking at three other places *and all the walking*  before coming here really took a toll on us and our appetite. 

* FOUR STARS, WILL RETURN*
author: Glenn L.

description:
Ordered a carry out order of 1/4 dark chicken with two sides: rice & three yucca strips. So weird, Peruvian restaurants usually load ya up with yucca but this place is all about moderation? Three yucca fries! Ok, I'll get over it! Decently flavored chicken, but missed any sort of crisp skin. Lame. 

For the price, I was expecting more. Btw, $3 for one can of Inca Cola. Really?! I guess I was expecting it to be more DC, Miami or NYC from the reviews. This Peruvian feels kinda "meh". 

Three yucca fries! Bah.
author: Sara C.

description: I have to say I love San Francisco and everything about it. I come here once in a while and I love hunting for new spots. This I have to say it's the best Peruvian food I've ever had in my life. I come from LA and I hate to compare but this out rule LA 100 times. So delicious!!!
author: Shully M.

description:
Rotisserie chicken was AMAZING.  Super delicious skin and moist chicken.  Tuna tartar was excellent.  Wait staff was friendly, engaging, and took good care of us.

The environment is a little loud (we ate between 7-9pm) so just be aware.  It's lively.

Would come back here for the chicken and to try the ceviche next time.
author: Leland F.

description:
We stopped by on a Wednesday evening around 9pm (so right after the Warriors game). Glad we were able to get a table right away. The place wasn't too crowded so it was nice actually being able to converse with each other. And service was quick.

For appetizers, we tried the Ceviche Mixto which was amazing. I definitely agree with everyone else because it's super yummy so definitely recommend it. We also got their chicken (Pollo A La Brasa). There was just two of us, so the whole chicken was too much. A half order would've been enough. But it was very good, and the sauces were good also. For sides, we just got vegetales salteados and rice. The vegetables were a perfect side for the chicken. But we barely ate the rice since we were getting so full.

I definitely would like to come back and next time I'll try the sangria. Since it was a weekday, I didn't want to drink alcohol. So decided to get an Inca Blu Mango Lemonade drink which was refreshing.
author: Thao D.

description: The food was great the only bad thing is that the place it's too crowded so, you should do a reservation before going there
author: Angie R.

description:
I was in the mood for tapas and sangria so I made early dinner resis here for my first visit at any Limon locations. My bf and I came in around 6:30 and upon entrance the tables looked pretty filled, but the host took us downstairs to be seated where there were plenty additional tables. We were the only ones down there at the time which was a little weird at first cuz it felt kinda like a basement, but our server approached us quickly with water and took our order right away once we were ready. By then it slowly started to fill up.

The fish and shrimp ceviche was the first to come out, which was very flavorful. It's a little different than what I'm used to since it wasn't all chopped up, but rather thinly cut slices of the fish and half slices of the shrimp. It was in a tangy/citrusy sauce that I really liked. A while after the rest of our order all came at once.

Quarter dark meat chicken: the meat was moist and flavorful, comes with 3 dipping sauces but the chicken is tasty enough to eat alone too. Any portion size comes with 2 sides so we chose the tacu tacu and sautéed veggies. The tacu tacu was the sautéed rice with beans mixed in, it didn't really have any outstanding flavor, but it was a good side to eat with the chicken. 

Lomito Saltado: the stir-fried sirlon strips was probably one of our fave dishes. It was well marinated and too salty for me as other people mentioned it to be. I'd only want the meat to be a little more tender next time, but other than that it was very flavorful. I also asked to have the fries separated so that they didn't get soggy

Truffle mac and cheese: this was very rich, creamy and decadent. The noodles were perfectly cooked so that the texture was just right. The serving size was pretty big for just the two of us...or maybe we were getting full but we had some left over.

And lastly, we  had a sangria each to wash it down. It's more on the cinnamon/nutmeg side, I wish it was a little stronger heh. The service was so-so. Our waiter was very friendly, but as it got filled up downstairs he checked on us less but there was always someone else making sure our waters were filled. It's also pretty loud downstairs as there are no windows so it's like the noise just bounces off the walls. I would recommend making reservations here esp around dinner time. I did enjoy it better than Fresca even though their portions here are a little smaller, but I would come back again when I'm craving tapas!
author: Georgina G.

description:
Loved this place. The service is excellent and the food is great. The lomo saltado is definitely always my favorite dish here, but their chicken is also bomb. 

Sangria is on the sweeter side, but I still get it every time. Love the ambience and the lower dining section.
author: Mon J.

description: I came here by yelping from Dolores park and I'm glad I did. Amazing food and service.  I ordered the rib eye and the whole chicken with the taca taca and it truly was amazing.  Recommend 100%
author: Michael R.

description: Came here yesterday got the chicharon chicken and some sweet potatoe fries the service was good food was okay but they didn't have ketchup for the fries 7/10 would eat again
author: Paul E.

description:
Do not take this lightly: THE CHICKEN IS AMAZING.

So good I could have eaten a 1/2 to myself. Ceviche was fresh and tasty, too.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Second time back and just as good as I remember! My daughter ate a fortune in the chicken, sweet potato fries and yucca fries. It's so nice to be able to take her to places and she can just eat whatever the rest of the party is having for dinner.

I had the pulpo, empanadas (steak and veggie), chicken, rice bean thing, and ceviche. It's better with a group so you can try a bunch of food without getting stuffed.
author: Betty Y.

description:
We love Limon!  It's delicious, healthy, and pretty inexpensive.

My husband and I head to Limon when we're craving a healthy yet super flavorful meal!  Our go to meal is the half rotisserie chicken (or whole chicken, if we want leftovers to take home) with the vegetales salteados (sautéed veggies) and ensalada (mixed greens with beets, cucumbers, and carrots).

It's pretty cheap - about $15 for the half chicken meal for two, and $30 for a whole chicken meal that will feed 3-4 (depending on how hungry you are).

Quick, friendly service, and a cool, trendy vibe are also plus points.

Limon is awesome.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Although the food is good, the service is terrible. I've been to Limon a couple of times in the past and the service has always been ok but not great. Whenever I'm in SF with my friends we used to love coming here because of the food, but after today we won't anymore. Not only was the server rude, he messed up our orders twice! First, he messed up our drinks and then our food orders. However, since we had our food to go we didn't realize the error until we got home. We were only given one portion of the food and were charged for the full amount. 
They really need to improve their waiters' customer service skills! There are so many great restaurants around the area with amazing Peruvian food and much better customer service. 
We gave Limon more than one chance, this place is just not worth your money!
author: Denise L.

description:
3.5 stars.

A small Peruvian restaurant.  There's a huge grill in the back where you can see the chefs cooking.  My family came here for lunch on a Friday and were seated immediately.

This place has a full bar and various cocktails like old fashioned and type of whiskey sour drink (Pisco Sour).   I enjoyed the old fashioned and it was pretty solid.

Whole chicken - $26 - decent, 3.5/5
The whole chicken was enjoyable but it wasn't amazing.  While moist & tender, it felt like it was missing something.  It comes w/ 3 dipping sauces which were really good.  The outside has a nice char to it. Comes w/ 2 sides (we picked Tacu Tacu (rice/beans) and Fries; both of these items tasted whatever).

Lomito Saltado - pretty good 4/5
The meat was pretty good.  Also moist & tender.  I wish they gave more rice tho.

Lengua a la Parilla (beef tongue) - average 3.5/5
Same as above, the tongue enjoyable.  Moist  & tender.

Steak empanadas - average 3/5
Enjoyable but nothing memorable.

TIPS:
-Dishes are kind of small.
author: Mike T.

description:
Best food in SF. Period. Their sauces are out of this world. The locations are a little busy and loud, but that's the price of a popular restaurant which is not over the top expensive

Try the 
Carne a la parilla 
Lomito Soltado 
All the empanadas 
Tacu Tacu

and go with a few friends and try all the deserts.
author: Eren B.

description: Words aren't sufficient for this modern yet traditional fusion of Latin cuisine. I'll say this, I want to move to San Francisco just to be able to frequent this spot. Absolutely delicious.
author: Erasmo F.

description:
After spending most of my day in The Haight area, I was starving and wanted plenty of food. I had this restaurant bookmarked and decided I would head to the Mission area. The place was cute, clean, and had plenty seating available. 

We were seated right away and I started off with their Límon Punch cocktail-delicious and strong. I ordered the Polla a La Brasa- half chicken (And I wasn't sharing!) it comes with 2 sides so I went with the yuca fries and rice of course. It comes with 3 Aji sauces. All three were equally amazing and went perfect with the chicken-which was flavored and cooked just right. My friend was trying to be sneaky during dinner and steal my chicken and sauce. I think she was jealous because she went with the empanadas and it only came with 2. The prices are reasonable considering the portion/sides you get. 

Okay I'm not done, we had dessert and it blew my mind. I had the chocolate bandido- warm chocolate cake with chocolate sauce and vanilla cream anglaise. It was topped with some kind of cookie. My friend had the Profiteroles Puff Pastry filled with pastry cream, served over Vanilla cream anglaise cream, drizzled with chocolate sauce & candied walnuts. She loved it so much,  it's one of the highlights of our trip.

The place started filling up quickly  but it didn't excuse our two different waiters from disappearing throughout the night. We waited too long to get the dessert menu and even longer to get our check.
author: Yeraldine S.

description:
I don't usually order chicken at restaurants so I was hesitant to try it. But I'm glad I did! It was great. 4 stars for the chicken. 

All of the ceviches are really good (if you like raw fish). 4 stars for the ceviche. 

The paella was VERY salty, we couldn't finish it. 2 stars. 

Last but not least, the TRUFFLE MAC AND CHEESE! Easily 5 stars. Sooo good!!
author: Susanna K.

description:
So to start, there is a reason for the three stars instead of 5. Below is my experience: 

Food taste/quality: 5 stars for the food quality and taste! It was delicious! The chicken was juicy and flavorful; especially with the sauce! 

Service: I would say 1 star for this. To be fair, I did not dine in, so I cannot emphasize on how the dine in experience is. However, the call in to pick up experience was absolutely bull crap.  Called at 11:30 am on a slow weekday to order for pick up at 12:10 pm. Arrived at 12:10 pm, food was not ready, matter fact, they did not even put my order in and was lost somewhere in the bottom of the ocean. It took about 5 minutes for 2 different workers to confirm that indeed I did call the correct Limon, and no I was not an insane lunatic that walked in to claim that I ordered food to go. I even had to show the worker my phone log to prove that indeed I did call the correct number. Finally got my food around 12:25, and I get to indulge in the food. To think that a restaurant sometimes would compensate your lost time and their mistakes by giving a discount and/or some kind of courteous gesture, this was not the case, nor do I care much about that. What I am infuriated about is that they did not even put any utensils or napkins... Sureeeeee, not a problem, I'll just be a caveman and eat with god damn hands. Mind I say, I was there during my lunch break, and that 15 minutes waiting for the food during my lunch break will not return. 

Overall experience rating: 2.5 - 3 stars. 

Would I come back? 

Yes, I would come back and dine in for a change, and see if their service is any better. I would probably never calling in advance for pick up here again, or maybe even pick up to go here again. 

My advice, don't bother in order for pick up here. If you do, and you do not want to be a caveman, remember to ask for utensils.
author: Joe Y.

description: My experience here was far from pleasant. We had a deposit down for a reservation at 6:45pm for a party of 16. We were seated downstairs, crammed around a table, and waited about an hour for our food. To me that is ridiculous especially since we had a reservation. Although we were sat almost immediately, we were not acknowledged whatsoever. Our waitress was almost nonexistent. 15 minutes after being seated, we asked that our food be brought out because we had a prix fixed menu. We continuously asked for water while we waited but it was not brought to us. When the waitress came around and asked for our drink orders, it seemed as if things were going to pick up. Our drinks took about 30+ minutes to be brought out and came out all at different times. By the time the last drink was brought out, everyone else had already placed their drink orders for the second round. We had to ask the waitress 3 times for the mango lemonade before she finally remembered. The time it took for food to come out was so inconsistent. We would get one dish, then a long pause. Then another dish was brought out. It was such a tease.  I understand that we are a large party but it was ridiculous because we had a reservation and was told the food would be brought out within 15 minutes of us asking. The food itself was hit or miss. Some dishes were more burnt than others while other plates seemed to have more. I understand it's a popular restaurant and we had a large party but it was just by far one of the worst dining experiences that I've had in a while. I don't blame the restaurant for being busy but had the service been a bit better then it would have been a different story. It felt as if we were forgotten. How can such a large party be basically ignored?? The service def needs improvement because our waitress seemed like she hated her job and was completely checked out.
author: Joanne C.

description:
I HAVE BEEN CONVERTED. Limon has left a permanent footprint on my moon heart.

Since trying this place for the first time in late April, I think I've been back about once every other week... 

I make a reservation online (through the Yelp app! So easy), and turn up to order the same thing every time. Say what you want, but I'll branch out once I get bored fo something. 

The first time I went here, the service was off. Our waitress was nice, but it was odd. Every time since then has been PERFECT. Service has been fast, they always hold a table, and the food has always been literally perfect.

Anyway...  let me share my secret order with y'all (praise be the Yelpers who came before me for helping me narrow it down and nail it early):

---- Pitcher of Sangria (get 2 cups if you're 2 people)
---- Veggie Empanadas (2 on a plate, so if you're 4 people, get 2
---- 1/2 a Chicken, both sides = Tacu Tacu
---- Truffle Mac & Cheese 

That's it. That's all you need to live life to the fullest.  

Also, just sayin', if you want to play mini golf after, there's a spot nearby and it makes a great evening. 


PS: This place gets extra points for first date people watching. Own it homies.
author: Andrea D.

description:
If this place didn't have such great food, I would be complaining.  Friends and I were super tired from a long day in SF and were dying for a nice meal.  When putting our name down, we were told that the wait would be 25-30 min.  Which is borderline long, but still wait-able.  We didn't get seated until it was close to an hour.  The hostess that took our name didn't seem like this gross under estimate of our wait-time was that huge of a deal.  I understand that it's a popular restaurant that isn't too big, but I would like an accurate eta to our seats. 

Once seated, we ordered immediately.  Our waiter was very friendly, despite the lack of concern from our hostesses.  The ceviche was absolutely amazing - the flavoring and the quality of the fish were perfect.  We also got two dishes with beef.  The saltado is a staple in Peruvian food and this place didn't disappoint.  The meat was tender and the fries, dripping in oil and amazing sauce.  The other beef dish was a bit drier but also had a great flavor.  For the chicken, we were a bit hesitant to order this at first, afraid that it would be dry. However, every yelp review raved about the chicken and its glory.  They were right.  The chicken was so thick, juicy and tasty.  There are sauces that come with the order, but the chicken also tastes great on its own.  It comes with two sides.  We got the yucca fries and the taku taku beans and lentils.  We didn't expect much from the taku taku, but also we decided to go on the reviews from yelp.  Also again, yelp reviewers were correct and the lentils were a winner. 

To go with dinner, we also ordered a pitcher of the white sangria, which was also delicious like the food.  

I didn't get a chance to see the downstairs, but the upstairs portion was classy and open.  I liked the casual/relaxed yet up-scale feel (contradictory I know, but I don't know how else to describe it).

Every dish was amazing and I'm so glad we waited it out.  The service here is not the best, but it's worth the food.

Ambiance: 4/5
Food and drink: 5/5
Service: 2/5
Overall Experience: 3.75/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I took my family of 8 here for my daughter's birthday. The food is good and the prices are reasonable. We have eaten at their sister restaurants on Valencia and in Burlingame. Our waiter had some "attitude" after we weren't ready to order when he came to our table, not sure what that was about. The reason I am writing this review is twofold...first, don't order the pitcher of margaritas. At $40 per pitcher, you would expect to be able to fill 4 small glasses 3 inches tall - NOT. Not only did it taste like a pre-mix, it was really not a true pitcher. It is a rip off! Second, our individual entrees came out sporadically. I was finished eating my entree by the time my daughter received her entree...it was obvious we were not doing "family style" when we ordered. The waiter/kitchen were not very professional. To cap off the night....since we had a party of 8, a 20% gratuity was automatically added which left us no option to express our disappointment.
author: Doug B.

description:
Really like this place. Great Peruvian rotisserie. Their chicken is pretty amazing, as well as the other dishes. I normally go there with a large group so we get a menu for groups which brings a bunch of different types of food. 

Beware of long wait if you don't have a reservation though. Other than that highly recommended for meats (not sure about fish / ceviche)!
author: Nuno S.

description:
This place is fine! :) good food as advertised and friendly and helpful servers.

My friends and I felt a bit bad for our vegan friend though - there isn't a vegan option that's a full meal, you have to order a bunch of small dishes to fill up. He still liked it but the price was higher as a result. I wouldn't come here with a hungry vegan.
author: Sal F.

description:
OMG! Amazing! I have been meaning to eat at this place, and finally got the chance. 

My friend and I came to have a nice dinner and catch up after so long. 

We got the empanadas de vegetables, cevice de pesacado, arroz con mariscos, lychee martini. All were spot on!

The service was amazing, the treated us like queens:) 

I had just gotten back from Miami, and this place reminded of an awesome, sexy place to have South American dinner in Miami. Love Miami, and love that food....so love, loved this place.

I will be back, and so should you:)
author: Sonia A.

description:
The food is okay, but the noise level so sky high we couldn't wait to get out of there. The ambience doesn't compensate -- it's a dark unpleasant basement with no windows. 

It's very popular though, and cheaper than most restaurants, so if you do go, try to make a reservation
author: Alice F.

description:
My Peruvian friend finally brought me here and it was definitely a dinner to remember! My friend lived in Peru up til she was 15 and constantly visits her parents yearly and this restaurant is by far the best peruvian food she's found here in the bay she says. We started out with the pisco sour which was delicious. We then shared:

Lomo Saltado 4/5: The beef was tender and very flavorful
1/2 Rotisserie chicken 4/5: The chicken skin was crisp and even the chicken breast was juicy 
Sides: Yucca fries 5/5 and Tacu Tacu 5/5!! 
Ceviche mixto 5/5: Definitely a must for everyone!! 

The service was good, the place was cute and i believe they have a downstairs room as well. Honestly, can't go wrong with this place... even though it is a bit pricey!!
author: Meemee T.

description: Delicious food. We ordered tuna tartare and ceviche micro.. Then the whole signature rotisserie chicken with veggies and sweet potato fries...everything was very delicious but I thought ceviche was pretty average.. Usually the fish is thinly Sliced but this one came in bigger pieces and was rather chewy.. Overall I had a great meal though and they were very friendly and accommodating for me and my 10 months old son!
author: Natalia M.

description: AA! - Absolutely Amazing! I had dinner here with the girls for my birthday and we literally loved every dish! Everything had a hint of lime, hence the name of the restaurant! The rotisserie chicken was tender and the skin was seasoned really well (maybe slightly salty, but I can deal). The mac n cheese, chicharrone chicken, beans+rice, the fries, paella rice, literally everything was delicious!!! The only thing I didn't like was my cocktail. I have more of a bold tastebud, so I rarely do fruity cocktails. BUT! I freakin love lychee martinis. They had a lychee cocktail here and the server recommended it. Sadly, it wasn't for me. There was tequila in it, which was overpowering and lacked my lychee flavor. I ended up giving it away! But the sweet part was, the entire staff surprised me with a dessert + candle and all sang to me really loudly! Totally caught me off guard. I love the food + ambience here and can't wait to return!!!!!
author: Kath N.

description: Solid food, a bit loud and hot at times in the downstairs seating area.
author: Nikhil J.

description: I go to the limon on Valencia atleast once a week.  Tonight they had a 30-45 min wait and I was starving and didn't want to wait that long. So we checked the van ness location(which we have never been to before) and they didn't have a wait.  So we head over to van ness full of excitement.  We ordered the same thing we have ordered atleast 30 times in the past(from the Valencia location). Sad to say, but I was really disappointed.  The ceviche just didn't have the same punch to it.  The polli papas was on point but then the lomo soltado was just boring( and this is my favorite dish normally).  Looks like the cooks at the Valencia location need to give these guys a lesson or two.
author: David S.

description:
Want to feast? Limon's the place to go.

Empanadas, whole chickens, ceviche, and papas fritas (french fries for the gringos) all make for a stellar meal. Everything is seasoned quite well, and the sauces/spices are excellent. Note that things can get a little pricy here, so make sure you're prepared.
author: Casey S.

description:
Margarita was very good. Chicken was smoky and delicious.
I liked juicy octopus and cheesy macaroni as well. I enjoyed the vibe here with my friends.
author: Abigail L.

description: Yum! Yum! Great drinks, awesome main courses, good service in a bright, local space. (Make your reservation in advance or prepare to wait) Good surprises were the inspired quinoa and chicories salad and the Pisco sours! I feel this place is an amazing bargain. The food is more distinctive, healthy and delicious than you would expect. It's a fun place with great food.
author: Susan R.

description:
Excellent service! The place was very busy (dinner rush), but the server still made sure to ask if everything was okay several times. 

Half chicken - So flavorful I only used the sauce trio on parts of the chicken breast.
Sweet potato fries - really good, especially with the sauces.
Yuca fries - burned my mouth on these and didn't really have any flavor. Oh well, the sauces fix everything :)
Tacu tacu - mildly flavored and very filling (it is rice & beans, after all).
Pisco sour - oh my god. so so strong.
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description:
When my cousins visited me last weekend, I decided we should go to Limon, based off of Nikita K's suggestion. Good thing I listened to him because this place was bomb!

We were planning on having an epic food day, so we didn't order that much. Between the three of us, we split the ceviche mixto, truffle mac and cheese, and chicarron de pollo.

I had gone to La Fusion the night before eating here and ordered the truffle mac and cheese there, so I actually had something to compare the mac and cheese to and...Limon's mac and cheese is superior! It comes in a cast iron skillet and has the perfect amount of truffle. It's also a bigger serving than the one served at La Fusion. Not sure if I would get it again, but if you're into truffle, you won't be disappointed.

The Chicarron de Pollo was delicious! Some pieces were super moist, though my older cousin commented that one of his pieces were dry.

Best thing we ordered by far was the ceviche mixto though! The fish in it is of substantial size so it's not mushy at all and overall, the flavors are amazing. Words cannot describe how much I loved this dish. Must have if you come by!

My cousin also ordered a lychee drink (can't remember what exactly), but he thought it was really good. Service was excellent as well and the music was popping haha!

Definitely recommend coming here! Parking is a pain in the butt, but Limon is worth it!
author: Trisha V.

description:
Seriously, one of the best places in the city. Hidden in front of your eyes, with a flavor and zest that could be confused with a more expensive venue. Portions are appropriate yet balanced and tasteful. Service, impecable, the manager or owner made sure to follow up at all the tables. The ambience, bueno papá, para que te cuento! The abundance of Latin Americans and English speaking patrons validates its authenticity. I highly recommend the Carne a la braza, but my over all favorite was the pulpo a la parrilla. A pero mira, you have to try their Don Carlitos drink. 

Will I be back? Pero claro!
author: Carlos D.

description:
This place is one of those old-time San Francisco staples that doesn't seem to get a whole lot of love or attention as the new restaurants, but it's consistently good and reasonably priced. My parents were born in Peru and lived there until their 20's, and really love the food here and think it's one of the better Peruvian restaurants in the Bay Area so you can use that as a baseline for comparison. I also grew up eating homemade Peruvian food and also dined at some of the other Peruvian places in the city (Fresca, Cholo Soy) and this one is my go-to, especially for the rotisserie chicken.

Come with a group of 3-4 people and share a bunch of plates so that you can try a little bit of everything. 

Pollo a la Brasa - You can get a whole, half, or quarter of a rotisserie chicken - they come with 2 sides and 3 different kind of sauces that are all delicious. They are known for their chicken and it's well-marinated, seasoned, and juicy, so don't leave without trying this.

For the sides, the yuca fries are delicious but the portion is a bit small (4 pieces) and will probably have you wanting more. Yuca is similar to a potato but starchier - the yuca fries here are done really well and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. The sweet potato fries are also delicious and highly recommended but not anything different than sweet potato fries you can get elsewhere or at a burger joint. The vegetales salteados is a good, healthy option for a side with a mixture of vegetables (onions, zucchini, peppers)

Ceviche Mixto - With fish, calamari, and shrimp, this is a typical Peruvian dish. The fish is raw and cured / marinated in lime. 

Champignones (Mushrooms) - I really liked these mushrooms - they were in a sauce that is a bit on the stronger side, and it overpowers the mushroom taste. But the sauce is actually pretty tasty, not salty, and goes well with the mushrooms, so I actually liked this dish. Otherwise I could just go to the store and sautee mushrooms myself.

Empanadas - These are deep fried and just okay; the proportion of bread to meat / filling is off, and it's a bit heavy on the bread. Save your money and get El Porteno or El Sur empanadas instead of these.

The food comes pretty quickly, it's tasty, and reasonably priced. A lunch for 3 people was around $20 per person including tip and tax (no alcohol). I've come here multiple times and will keep coming back. Not too fancy of a restaurant, and a lot of food options. If you keep a paleo, low-carb diet, this place will have enough choices for you to find something.
author: Christina L.

description:
Three stars because I was disappointed when I got my order of veggie empanadas. Empanadas are supposed to be big... like the size of your hand! What I got was something the size of my index finger! for almost $9.00!!! Excuse me??? Not only that, but there seemed to be minimal filling in each of the two empanadas. The reason why I didn't give 1 or 2 stars was because the waiters and waitresses were very nice. 

Next time let's make some real empanadas. How 'bout that?
author: Maria I.

description:
We went in as a group of 4. The Chicharron de Pollo is a must have and so is the Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron and Lomo Saltado - all exquisite and incredibly delicious!

Service was great too, we will be back!
author: The J.

description: We made a reservation and were seated in the busy aisle at the stairs. I got a stir fried dish with beef and some veggies. It was unremarkable. My date got the Paella. It was luke warm bordering cold. Neither one of us finished our meal. The waiter kept trying to take our plates away before we finished. He came by 4 times to ask if we were finished as we were chatting in between bites. After we were finished he scooped up the plates came by with a dessert menu and when we said we did not want it he was back with the check in a flash. then came by another 2 times grabbing the check folder to see if there was a card in it. I never felt so rushed to get out of a restaurant. It was not even that packed. Bad experience all in all. Won't be returning.
author: Jerry A.

description:
Excellent meal overall! I came here with a friend recently for lunch and we had the following:

Ceviche Mixto
Half Chicken
Seco de Costillas (braised, boneless short ribs with peas, carrots, and potatoes)

When I ordered the Seco de Costillas the waiter said that was his favorite and I can see why. The beef was incredibly tender and the vegetables were cooked just right. The hearty sauce was also a complement to the beef.

The chicken was ok - not as good as I'd expect but still not bad.

We washed down the meal with some beers and all was fine and dandy. This is a great restaurant to patronize if you're on this side of the Mission.
author: Art O.

description:
Limón que delicia verdadera. 

Per recommendation, a friend and I decided to try Limon Rotisserie. The menu was quite interesting, I felt as if I had too many great options to choose from. Being that it was my first time, I decided to try a popular Peruvian dish which was the Lomo Saltado. Delicious. 

The service and food was great. I would definitely recommend and hope to return soon.
author: Karla Emm N.

description: Amazing food with the best atmosphere to have a great time! The manager Fadi is the friendliest person ever. Felt right at home. Definitely coming back every time I'm in the city!
author: Sh. Ashur S.

description: Wow! Being half Peruvian... I KNOW what good Peruvian food tastes like... and wow! Great place to stop and eat. EVERYTHING was excellent. Stellar service ... must try the bread pudding for dessert!!!!
author: Erika A.

description:
Holy chicken......... So I had been eying this place for some time and then a friend suggested it very enthusiastically. Finally went and tried and oh my stars what tender juicy chicken and beautiful flavor all around. We got the half chicken with side of tacu tacu (peruvian rice and beans) and veggies. Even the veggies were perfect, texture and flavor. We also ordered the lomo saltado. Perfect flavor and steak quality. 

Mate said this is the best food he has ever had in san francisco. I do have my loyalties but this place is definitely up there for me too ;)
author: Lisa K.

description: GET THE HALF BAKED CHICKEN with salad and sweet potato fries, PISCO SOUR, octopus, veggie empanadas, and ceviche mixto.
author: Lily T.

description:
Great place for people who have people who have peanut allergies. But note that the desserts have nuts. 

Everything thing we got was really tasty and the chicken was perfect.
author: Iggy H.

description:
This place is fantastic for Peruvian and Latin American food. There is a slight wait even if you have a reservation, but definitely try to make a reservation if you can, as there is barely any place to stand to wait which means you're standing outside in the SF cold. 

Appetizers: I've gotten their ceviche, and it is fantastic but I do think that the portions are small for the price. Their empanadas are super delicious! I got the beef as well as the chicken and each one comes with 2. Personally, I like the chicken more because I thought it was more flavorful, but both are good.

Rotisserie Chicken: The dark meat is SO SO SO GOOD. However, of course it comes with white meat especially if you order the whole chicken. The white meat is not bad, but not as good as the dark meat. The trio of aji sauces is amazing!! Sometimes I wish they gave more sauce because I love that sauce with everything and it helps with the white meat too (if you're a dark meat lover). For the sides I got the tacu tacu and the rice and beans. 

Lomo Saltado: I really like this dish. comes with rice and beef stir fried with onions and french fries!

Dessert: The chocolate cake with espresso ice cream was amazing. It was like a molten lava cake! The panna cotta was super fresh but not my fav. I'd pick the chocolate cake again!
author: Carmen C.

description:
I know this is an unpopular opinion about limon rotisserie but meh \_(ツ)_/¯ 

We book this place in advance for a party of 16 and had the prixfix menu which was going to be prepared "family style" . Since we agreed on the menu and everything in advance , you would think that everything should be ready and come out in a timely manner ... You thought wrong . Our whole party besides 2 people came exactly on time and we waited about 30-40 mins for our first course . They took our drink orders and a lot of people were missing drinks also . After a few plates started coming out , I still gave them the benefit of the doubt and expected everything to flow after . Maybe they just had a slow start . WRONG . Another looooooong pause in the meal ( about another 30 mins ) then food comes out again . Since it was supposed to be family style with every 4 people , they separated the dishes along the table and it was all really inconsistent . There would be a plate with tons of meat and another with no meat just onions when it's supposed to be the same . Food wasn't bad but the dining experience wasn't good either . I don't think it's worth it to come back .
author: Carmen V.

description:
Love the food there. Ensalada russa, empada de carne and 
Carne A La Parilla are my favorite ones. I just removed one start duo to the staff. They always take really long to come to our table. I think they can't handle to many people in the restaurant at the same time.
author: Roberta T.

description: Food had very distinct, excellent flavors. I had braised beef and chicken. The chicken seemed expensive but well worth it!
author: Paul P.

description:
If you are looking for a great spot to eat succulent dishes and try new cocktails, Limon Rotisserie is the place you are looking for. 

The restaurant offers traditional Peruvian food in American style. I've try the roasted chicken which is a very specific plate in Peru and it was fantastic. For only 9-13 dollars per person you can eat a tasty and juicy chicken with a selection of 2 delicious sides : rice, french fries, yucca, sweet potatoes, salads and tacu tacu (classic Peruvian side combining rice and beans). They also have fish (Ceviche, Pulpo) and meat (Lomo saltado, Lengua a la Parilla , Chicharron) on the menu. For the cocktails, even if they are a little expensive, I highly recommend you try their Pisco Sour.

The restaurant is located a 5 min walk from 16th Mission St Bart Station. The dinning room is spacious and comfortable. You may reserve a table because the place is very famous and almost always full at lunch during Business times as it is in evenings. It's a good place to go with your family or friends and even as a couple for a romantic dinner. Moreover, the staff was great. They were helpful and nice. 

My mother is Peruvian so I grew up eating this type of food and I can tell you that Limon Rotisserie is amazing. I'm in SF for 1 month and I will definitely come back there. Add it to your list of things to do in SF.
author: Béatrice B.

description:
I had enjoyed this place when I went here a couple years ago and since my wife had some friends in town who were craving ceviche, we thought this would be a great place for dinner.  The four of us ordered a half of a rotisserie chicken with yuca fries and the beans/rice, the ceviche de camaron y pescado, the chicharron de pollo, the lomo saltado, and the truffle mac and cheese.

The chicken was a winner, just as I remembered it.  The pieces were a bit small, but they were tender and tasty with the dipping sauces making it even more delicious!  I really enjoyed the sides we ordered- the yuca fries were crispy outside and fluffy inside and the tacu tacu (rice/bean mix) was great as well.  I just wish the portion of the yuca fries (4 pieces) was a little larger.

The seafood in our ceviche was fresh and I liked how the flavors were much more balanced (not super tangy) than the ceviche we had at Fresca a few weeks back.  The chicharron de pollo and lomo saltado were solid as well.  Mac and cheese was alright- I wish it had a bit more of the truffle taste.

All in all, a solid meal.  Nice clean and modern space, friendly service and solid food!
author: Jeff C.

description:
The food is great here, and drinks are great as well. They have three locations in SF, and they all are pretty spacious and great for groups. They take reservations as well and don't seem to ever be too packed. 

I liked everything that I ordered here - rotisserie chicken, sangria, lomo saltado, ceviche, mac and cheese... everything is great!!
author: Jeanette S.

description: Didn't know that rotisserie chicken was Peruvian. That said, I really like our meal here. The chicken was moist and flavourful, which helped because I didn't personally love the sauces it came with. The sweet potato fries and vegetables sides were good though. We also had the three different types of ceviche. It was fresh, and a good amount of flavour. Disappointing use of corn though.
author: Linh D.

description: I will definitely return to this fine restaurant.  I had the braised boneless beef short ribs with huacatay-cilantro broth, potatoes, carrots, english peas and served with rice.  The meat was very succulent and tender bursting with flavor.  I just regret NOT getting the sangria, which is house made.  I highly advise making reservations or you will be waiting.
author: G C.

description: Amazing! This place is a diamond in the rough. Parking is terrible, it will give you nightmares! But it is all worth it once you walk inside. They have a downstairs seating area that is very cozy.
author: Kamryn S.

description:
There's "rotisserie" in the restaurant's name for a reason. Go for the chicken. It reminds me a bit of the rotisserie chicken I can get from the farmer's market at Upper Haight. But sooo much better! Less salty, more tender, and thoughtfully seasoned. I prefer dark over white and would probably just get a quarter of the dark next time instead of half a chicken. The half was way too much for me and my friend (also a small female Asian) to finish.

One of the specials of the day was mahi mahi grilled with a tasty soy sauce based sauce over a bed of veggies including green beans, mushrooms, and garlic. This was good except that the green beans were sour and expired. You know that taste when you try to eat leftovers that have been in your fridge for 2 weeks...or when you have that veggie you left in there for too long but you decide to cook with it anyway because you don't want to waste $. That's exactly how the green beans tasted and it's the reason why I can't in good conscience give this restaurant more than 3 stars, as much as I enjoyed the chicken and fish.

Another plus is that all chicken orders come with your choice of two sides. The waiter recommended veggies (which included even more inedible green beans, unfortunately) and sweet potato fries.
