description: So let me just preface this review by saying that Limon used to be one of my favorite restaurants in the city... so when I had heard the new Limon had just opened up at their new location, I was excited to go. First of all - major problem with their website: we called the number on the website assuming that this was the number to call for reservations for Limon (logically). Wrong! Not only did they not confirm what location the reservation was for (the website does not differentiate between the Rotisserie and the regular Limon) but no confirm call was given, nothing. So we show up for a table for 4 at 8pm last Friday night - turns out the reso was for the other location. The hostess called to the other location to tell us we were coming and to hold our table. We get there - and our names were already crossed off. We were only a few minutes late going to the wrong restaurant but the hostess says she'll get us a table. Fast forward an HOUR AND A HALF - we're STILL waiting for our table - despite my seeing open tables. A whole group of us were waiting to be seated for over an hour, despite having made a reservation a week in advance. The worst part was - the hostess didn't seem to know what she was doing and was rather rude to us. It's 9:30 when we finally get seated, no apologies, no one addressing how visibly pissed we were. The food was OK (which is why I give the one star) - but definitely not worth the terrible experience we had leading up to it. I can safely say - until they fire their hostess and get open table - and at least get their act together - I will never come back to this restaurant. Save your money and go somewhere else instead.
author: Christie W.

description: great food, great sangria, great price, great service! i've been there a few times now and it's pretty consistant! tables turn pretty quickly too so the wait is never bad. i'm obsessed over the yucca fries! i think the staff is super friendly and on it! my first time there was a rainy friday night - which means not a taxi in sight - after dinner, my friend and I waiting outside roughly 40 minutes - meanwhile the owner/manager was calling every cab company in town, hailing us cabs in the pouring rain, and was insisting to drive us where we needed to be because he was concerned we were stranded ! what restaurant does that after you pay their bill?!
author: Lucy M.

description: GOod food for your money!  and great service, too!  If youre in the mood for rotisserie chicken, this is definetly the place to go!
author: chris y.

description: Can I just eat here every night?  Rotisserie chicken was ultra flavorful and moist sans sauces, but ultra tasty with the dipping sauces.  Prices are low, but the ambience makes it perfect for a nice night out.  The ceviche de pescado was phenomenal, with just the right amount of heat from the chile.  Despite the only drawback that they don't have Cusqueña beer, we will certainly make this a regular stop.
author: Kristin L.

description: Just went for second time in 2 weeks and I think this is my new favorite place in the city.  The ceviche is fantastic, so is the chicken, the hanger steak, short ribs, yuca, fries, tacu tacu and fruit cake.  Both times we went at 6:30 and were seated with no wait (3 people).  Service is very good.  Today we took my toddler and they were friendly and quick, last time I was with friends and not at all rushed.
author: diana c.

description: I'm a rare Yelper, but this place is worth it.  I've been waiting to find a great Peruvian chicken place, and finally we've got one in SF!  Delicious!  My mouth is still watering.  Highly recommended for lunch or dinner.  And to top it off, the prices are very reasonable.  Especially when you get the whole chicken with two sides, which is almost enough food for two hungry eaters.  They could double their prices and I still think they'd be a great place to get dinner.
author: Erik B.

description: I can't begin to say how awful our experience at this restaurant was.  Having heard good things, we went there on a Sunday night around 7:00 p.m.  The staff seemed totally overwhelmed.  When we asked how long it would take for a table the maitre de told us it would be at least a half hour so we opted to sit at the bar where he told us we could eat dinner.  We waited for over 20 minutes and no one came to take an order or even check in.  Finally we asked one of the waiters if he could take our order and he refused, telling us we could not eat at the bar.  However, a couple seats down another waitress was taking a food order at the bar.  When we pointed this out, he huffed "well SHE can take your order then".  When we finally caught her eye she said she would be back to take our order but never did.  At that point we left.  I have never written a restaurant review before; I can tolerate mediocre food, slow service, etc., but not outright rudeness.  The staff is absolutely incompetent and incredibly rude.  Take your business elsewhere.
author: ann j.

description: delicious bday dinner for 4 including a pitcher of sangria for $80???? amazing!
author: Kay T.

description: A little peeved that we were told it would take 1.5 hrs to get seated but there was a lounge downstairs that just opened. Luckily, a couple left so there were empty footstools to sit on but we had to share a coffee table with another couple until we got seated at a real table in the lounge.   Service downstairs was somewhat scatterbrained until we got our table, altogether 20-30 min wait.  I think for the main dining room, it was about a 1 hr wait.  But oh boy was the food good!  Recommend the ceviche mixto with shrimp, halibut and calamari.  The hangar steak, the ceviche halibut and shrimp, and tuna tartare. For dessert, the mascarpone rasberry layered cake.  So happy with everything. They had sangria carafes however I had the mango and strawberry drinks (non alcoholic since I'm driving).  Between 2 people, it was just enough and came out to about $25+ tip.  Not bad.  Very young crowd.  Looks like they'll be having a DJ booth in the lounge as well. Our server Eduardo was especially beautiful to look at.
author: Eesayah O.

description: Going to this place proves just how unpredictable a dining experience can be.  I'd been to Limon on Valencia many times but the last few times was disappointed.  I wanted to like this place but approached it with apprehension.  How good could it be, afterall, being something of a stepchild to Limon grande?  All this notwithstanding, my first bite of the Pollo a la Brasa dispelled all doubts and I was wisked away to the hallowed state of culinary bliss.  And it was just chicken!  I have chicken all the time, but somehow this chicken was extra tasty and succulent, nicely enhanced by the two dipping sauces.   Along with that we had the Lomito Saltado, which I think was better than the same dish I had at big Limon, and the rice we ordered was absolutely heavenly.  When you can actually rave about plain rice then you know something is right.   To cap it all off, I was totally enraptured by the bandido chocolate cake, a definite must order.   Vas-y toute suite!  (oops, wrong language).
author: David T.

description: i've been here a few times in the last couple of years and limon r doesn't disappoint.  reminds me of my peruvian haunts in bklyn- good portions & reasonable prices.  i heart limon rotisserie.
author: M R.

description: We arrived on time for our reservation. The hostess told us it would be 5-10 min for the table to be ready. This was fine so we waited near the door. A couple came in without a res. and was seated before us, but soon after that we were called. The decor was nice. It was a little dark when we were seated and as we glanced the menu. They soon turned the lights on a little brighter. It was a little claustrphobic and stuffy. Good thing we sat right by the door. This place harbors trendy yuppie clientele which I wasn't really fond of but that's just me. The waiter was nice but I felt pressure through out the meal. We ordered the saltado chicken dish which was very good. Only thing is that the waiter was taking the plate away as I was still finishing. So I had to inform him I was still working on it and he thought I was crazy or something. We also ordered the sirloin strips with onions, red peppers, etc..it was just ok, not great. We finished and he wanted us to look at the menu again since we ordered those "small plates" and again he was stunned that "this was your dinner?" So, this waiter kinda bothered me. He pressured us to order yet rushed us to finish.  Limon is ok but not great, I wouldn't go back.
author: Jay W.

description: completely awesome.  maybe the best restaurant in the city, when you factor in taste, value, and service.  but please dont come here, because i dont want to wait longer.
author: Robert C.

description: Ok, so last December one of my bestfriend and peers went there to celebrate her 27th birthday, now I've never been to this place and i was really skeptical about how small the place was and the location.  There wasn't really alot to choose from but hey who am i to be picky?  So i ordered steak with fries and DAMN! that was the best thing i've ever had!!!! lol.. then i tried their chicken it was PHENOMENAL!!! It was sooo good!!! it reminded me of my hometown in Jeddah, K.S.A. then the chocolate cake, OMG!  Best thing ever!!!! EVER!!! I had such a blast there that two days after I ate there with my friends I brought my boyfriend there for our anniversary and he loved theplace too!!!! lol... portions are decent (well at least for me) and the wine with fruits is HELLA GOOD!!! i really and strongly recommend this place to anyone out there... Don't let the location and size of the place fool you because this place is always packed.. I'm not surprised why... You all should check this place out... I give this restaurant a 10 star if I could, but 5 starts should be enough to let everyone know how GREAT this place is... Bon Apetit!
author: Christina Z.
